ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW

block.text: MATTHEW

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 1
The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

block.text: Inilah silsilah Yesus Kristus, anak Daud, anak Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac became the father of Jacob. Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers.

block.text: Abraham memperanakkan Ishak, Ishak memperanakkan Yakub, Yakub memperanakkan Yehuda dan saudara-saudaranya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron. Hezron became the father of Ram.

block.text: Yehuda memperanakkan Peres dan Zerah dari Tamar, Peres memperanakkan Hezron, Hezron memperanakkan Ram,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ram became the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon. Nahshon became the father of Salmon.

block.text: Ram memperanakkan Aminadab, Aminadab memperanakkan Nahason, Nahason memperanakkan Salmon,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.

block.text: Salmon memperanakkan Boas dari Rahab, Boas memperanakkan Obed dari Rut, Obed memperanakkan Isai,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesse became the father of King David. David became the father of Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.

block.text: Isai memperanakkan raja Daud. Daud memperanakkan Salomo dari isteri Uria,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Solomon became the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam became the father of Abijah. Abijah became the father of Asa.

block.text: Salomo memperanakkan Rehabeam, Rehabeam memperanakkan Abia, Abia memperanakkan Asa,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram. Joram became the father of Uzziah.

block.text: Asa memperanakkan Yosafat, Yosafat memperanakkan Yoram, Yoram memperanakkan Uzia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Uzziah became the father of Jotham. Jotham became the father of Ahaz. Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah.

block.text: Uzia memperanakkan Yotam, Yotam memperanakkan Ahas, Ahas memperanakkan Hizkia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh. Manasseh became the father of Amon. Amon became the father of Josiah.

block.text: Hizkia memperanakkan Manasye, Manasye memperanakkan Amon, Amon memperanakkan Yosia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the exile to Babylon.

block.text: Yosia memperanakkan Yekhonya dan saudara-saudaranya pada waktu pembuangan ke Babel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel.

block.text: Sesudah pembuangan ke Babel, Yekhonya memperanakkan Sealtiel, Sealtiel memperanakkan Zerubabel,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim. Eliakim became the father of Azor.

block.text: Zerubabel memperanakkan Abihud, Abihud memperanakkan Elyakim, Elyakim memperanakkan Azor,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Azor became the father of Sadoc. Sadoc became the father of Achim. Achim became the father of Eliud.

block.text: Azor memperanakkan Zadok, Zadok memperanakkan Akhim, Akhim memperanakkan Eliud,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Eliud became the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan. Matthan became the father of Jacob.

block.text: Eliud memperanakkan Eleazar, Eleazar memperanakkan Matan, Matan memperanakkan Yakub,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

block.text: Yakub memperanakkan Yusuf suami Maria, yang melahirkan Yesus yang disebut Kristus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon to the Christ, fourteen generations.

block.text: Jadi seluruhnya ada: empat belas keturunan dari Abraham sampai Daud, empat belas keturunan dari Daud sampai pembuangan ke Babel, dan empat belas keturunan dari pembuangan ke Babel sampai Kristus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this; After his mother, Mary, was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Kelahiran Yesus Kristus adalah seperti berikut: Pada waktu Maria, ibu-Nya, bertunangan dengan Yusuf, ternyata ia mengandung dari Roh Kudus, sebelum mereka hidup sebagai suami isteri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Joseph, her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, intended to put her away secretly.

block.text: Karena Yusuf suaminya, seorang yang tulus hati dan tidak mau mencemarkan nama isterinya di muka umum, ia bermaksud menceraikannya dengan diam-diam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying,

block.text: Tetapi ketika ia mempertimbangkan maksud itu, malaikat Tuhan nampak kepadanya dalam mimpi dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Joseph, son of David, don’t be afraid to take to yourself Mary, your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: <<Yusuf, anak Daud, janganlah engkau takut mengambil Maria sebagai isterimu, sebab anak yang di dalam kandungannya adalah dari Roh Kudus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She shall bring forth a son. You shall call his name Jesus, for it is he who shall save his people from their sins.”

block.text: Ia akan melahirkan anak laki-laki dan engkau akan menamakan Dia Yesus, karena Dialah yang akan menyelamatkan umat-Nya dari dosa mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now all this has happened, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,

block.text: Hal itu terjadi supaya genaplah yang difirmankan Tuhan oleh nabi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son. They shall call his name Immanuel”;

block.text: <<Sesungguhnya, anak dara itu akan mengandung dan melahirkan seorang anak laki-laki, dan mereka akan menamakan Dia Imanuel

ReferenceBlocks.text: which is, being interpreted, “God with us.”
Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;

block.text: —yang berarti: Allah menyertai kita.>>
Sesudah bangun dari tidurnya, Yusuf berbuat seperti yang diperintahkan malaikat Tuhan itu kepadanya. Ia mengambil Maria sebagai isterinya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and didn’t know her sexually until she had brought forth her firstborn son. He named him Jesus.

block.text: tetapi tidak bersetubuh dengan dia sampai ia melahirkan anaknya laki-laki dan Yusuf menamakan Dia Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 2
Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem,
saying,

block.text: Sesudah Yesus dilahirkan di Betlehem di tanah Yudea pada zaman raja Herodes, datanglah orang-orang majus dari Timur ke Yerusalem
dan bertanya-tanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is the one who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him.”

block.text: <<Di manakah Dia, raja orang Yahudi yang baru dilahirkan itu?>> <<Kami telah melihat bintang-Nya di Timur dan kami datang untuk menyembah Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

block.text: Ketika raja Herodes mendengar hal itu terkejutlah ia beserta seluruh Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them:

block.text: Maka dikumpulkannya semua imam kepala dan ahli Taurat bangsa Yahudi, lalu dimintanya keterangan dari mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is the Christ to be be born?”

block.text: di mana Mesias akan dilahirkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Mereka berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is written through the prophet,

block.text: <<Di Betlehem di tanah Yudea, karena demikianlah ada tertulis dalam kitab nabi:>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘You Bethlehem, land of Judah, are in no way least among the princes of Judah: for out of you shall come forth a governor, who shall shepherd my people, Israel.’”

block.text: <Dan engkau Betlehem, tanah Yehuda, engkau sekali-kali bukanlah yang terkecil di antara mereka yang memerintah Yehuda, karena dari padamulah akan bangkit seorang pemimpin, yang akan menggembalakan umat-Ku Israel.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and asked them:

block.text: Lalu dengan diam-diam Herodes memanggil orang-orang majus itu dan dengan teliti bertanya kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What time did the star appear?”

block.text: bilamana bintang itu nampak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent them to Bethlehem, and said,

block.text: Kemudian ia menyuruh mereka ke Betlehem, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and search diligently for the young child. When you have found him, bring me word, so that I also may come and worship him.”

block.text: <<Pergi dan selidikilah dengan seksama hal-hal mengenai Anak itu dan segera sesudah kamu menemukan Dia, kabarkanlah kepadaku supaya aku pun datang menyembah Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.

block.text: Setelah mendengar kata-kata raja itu, berangkatlah mereka. Dan lihatlah, bintang yang mereka lihat di Timur itu mendahului mereka hingga tiba dan berhenti di atas tempat, di mana Anak itu berada.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.

block.text: Ketika mereka melihat bintang itu, sangat bersukacitalah mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary, his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him.

block.text: Maka masuklah mereka ke dalam rumah itu dan melihat Anak itu bersama Maria, ibu-Nya, lalu sujud menyembah Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Opening their treasures, they offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

block.text: Merekapun membuka tempat harta bendanya dan mempersembahkan persembahan kepada-Nya, yaitu emas, kemenyan dan mur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being warned in a dream that they shouldn’t return to Herod, they went back to their own country another way.

block.text: Dan karena diperingatkan dalam mimpi, supaya jangan kembali kepada Herodes, maka pulanglah mereka ke negerinya melalui jalan lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying,

block.text: Setelah orang-orang majus itu berangkat, nampaklah malaikat Tuhan kepada Yusuf dalam mimpi dan berkata:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.”

block.text: <<Bangunlah, ambillah Anak itu serta ibu-Nya, larilah ke Mesir dan tinggallah di sana sampai Aku berfirman kepadamu, karena Herodes akan mencari Anak itu untuk membunuh Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt.

block.text: Maka Yusufpun bangunlah, diambilnya Anak itu serta ibu-Nya malam itu juga, lalu menyingkir ke Mesir,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They remained there until the death of Herod; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,

block.text: dan tinggal di sana hingga Herodes mati. Hal itu terjadi supaya genaplah yang difirmankan Tuhan oleh nabi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Out of Egypt I called my son.”

block.text: <<Dari Mesir Kupanggil Anak-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Herod saw that he was mocked by the wise men, he became exceedingly angry. He sent out and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under, according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men.

block.text: Ketika Herodes tahu, bahwa ia telah diperdayakan oleh orang-orang majus itu, ia sangat marah. Lalu ia menyuruh membunuh semua anak di Betlehem dan sekitarnya, yaitu anak-anak yang berumur dua tahun ke bawah, sesuai dengan waktu yang dapat diketahuinya dari orang-orang majus itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,

block.text: Dengan demikian genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi Yeremia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; she wouldn’t be comforted, because they are no more.”

block.text: <<Terdengarlah suara di Rama, tangis dan ratap yang amat sedih; Rahel menangisi anak-anaknya dan ia tidak mau dihibur, sebab mereka tidak ada lagi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,

block.text: Setelah Herodes mati, nampaklah malaikat Tuhan kepada Yusuf dalam mimpi di Mesir, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young child’s life are dead.”

block.text: <<Bangunlah, ambillah Anak itu serta ibu-Nya dan berangkatlah ke tanah Israel, karena mereka yang hendak membunuh Anak itu, sudah mati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

block.text: Lalu Yusuf pun bangunlah, diambilnya Anak itu serta ibu-Nya dan pergi ke tanah Israel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father, Herod, he was afraid to go there. Being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the region of Galilee.

block.text: Tetapi setelah didengarnya, bahwa Arkhelaus menjadi raja di Yudea menggantikan Herodes, ayahnya, ia takut ke sana. Karena dinasihati dalam mimpi, pergilah Yusuf ke daerah Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets:

block.text: Setibanya di sana ia pun tinggal di sebuah kota yang bernama Nazaret. Hal itu terjadi supaya genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi-nabi, bahwa Ia akan disebut:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He will be called a Nazarene.”

block.text: <<Orang Nazaret.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 3
In those days, John the Baptizer came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea, saying,

block.text: Pada waktu itu tampillah Yohanes Pembaptis di padang gurun Yudea dan memberitakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!”

block.text: <<Bertobatlah, sebab Kerajaan Sorga sudah dekat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying,

block.text: Sesungguhnya dialah yang dimaksudkan nabi Yesaya ketika ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight.”

block.text: <<Ada suara orang yang berseru-seru di padang gurun: Persiapkanlah jalan untuk Tuhan, luruskanlah jalan bagi-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now John himself wore clothing made of camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.

block.text: Yohanes memakai jubah bulu unta dan ikat pinggang kulit, dan makanannya belalang dan madu hutan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then people from Jerusalem, all of Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him.

block.text: Maka datanglah kepadanya penduduk dari Yerusalem, dari seluruh Yudea dan dari seluruh daerah sekitar Yordan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.

block.text: Lalu sambil mengaku dosanya mereka dibaptis oleh Yohanes di sungai Yordan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them,

block.text: Tetapi waktu ia melihat banyak orang Farisi dan orang Saduki datang untuk dibaptis, berkatalah ia kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

block.text: <<Hai kamu keturunan ular beludak. Siapakah yang mengatakan kepada kamu, bahwa kamu dapat melarikan diri dari murka yang akan datang?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore bring forth fruit worthy of repentance!

block.text: Jadi hasilkanlah buah yang sesuai dengan pertobatan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t think to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father,’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.

block.text: Dan janganlah mengira, bahwa kamu dapat berkata dalam hatimu: Abraham adalah bapa kami! Karena aku berkata kepadamu: Allah dapat menjadikan anak-anak bagi Abraham dari batu-batu ini!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even now the axe lies at the root of the trees. Therefore every tree that doesn’t bring forth good fruit is cut down, and cast into the fire.

block.text: Kapak sudah tersedia pada akar pohon dan setiap pohon yang tidak menghasilkan buah yang baik, pasti ditebang dan dibuang ke dalam api.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I indeed baptize you in water for repentance, but there is one who comes after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.

block.text: <<Aku membaptis kamu dengan air sebagai tanda pertobatan, tetapi Ia yang datang kemudian dari padaku lebih berkuasa dari padaku dan aku tidak layak melepaskan kasut-Nya. Ia akan membaptiskan kamu dengan Roh Kudus dan dengan api.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.”

block.text: Alat penampi sudah ditangan-Nya. Ia akan membersihkan tempat pengirikan-Nya dan mengumpulkan gandum-Nya ke dalam lumbung, tetapi debu jerami itu akan dibakar-Nya dalam api yang tidak terpadamkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.

block.text: Maka datanglah Yesus dari Galilea ke Yordan kepada Yohanes untuk dibaptis olehnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But John would have hindered him, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Yohanes mencegah Dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me?”

block.text: <<Akulah yang perlu dibaptis oleh-Mu, dan Engkau yang datang kepadaku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus, answering, said to him,

block.text: Lalu Yesus menjawab, kata-Nya kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow it now, for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness.”

block.text: <<Biarlah hal itu terjadi, karena demikianlah sepatutnya kita menggenapkan seluruh kehendak Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he allowed him.

block.text: Dan Yohanespun menuruti-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, when he was baptized, went up directly from the water: and behold, the heavens were opened to him. He saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming on him.

block.text: Sesudah dibaptis, Yesus segera keluar dari air dan pada waktu itu juga langit terbuka dan Ia melihat Roh Allah seperti burung merpati turun ke atas-Nya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a voice out of the heavens said,

block.text: lalu terdengarlah suara dari sorga yang mengatakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”

block.text: <<Inilah Anak-Ku yang Kukasihi, kepada-Nyalah Aku berkenan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 4
Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

block.text: Maka Yesus dibawa oleh Roh ke padang gurun untuk dicobai Iblis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was hungry afterward.

block.text: Dan setelah berpuasa empat puluh hari dan empat puluh malam, akhirnya laparlah Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The tempter came and said to him,

block.text: Lalu datanglah si pencoba itu dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”

block.text: <<Jika Engkau Anak Allah, perintahkanlah supaya batu-batu ini menjadi roti.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God.’”

block.text: <<Ada tertulis: <Manusia hidup bukan dari roti saja, tetapi dari setiap firman yang keluar dari mulut Allah.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the devil took him into the holy city. He set him on the pinnacle of the temple,
and said to him,

block.text: Kemudian Iblis membawa-Nya ke Kota Suci dan menempatkan Dia di bubungan Bait Allah,
lalu berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you.’ and, ‘On their hands they will bear you up, so that you don’t dash your foot against a stone.’”

block.text: <<Jika Engkau Anak Allah, jatuhkanlah diri-Mu ke bawah, sebab ada tertulis: <Mengenai Engkau Ia akan memerintahkan malaikat-malaikat-Nya dan mereka akan menatang Engkau di atas tangannya, supaya kaki-Mu jangan terantuk kepada batu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, it is written, ‘You shall not test the Lord, your God.’”

block.text: <<Ada pula tertulis: <Janganlah engkau mencobai Tuhan, Allahmu!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, and their glory.
He said to him,

block.text: Dan Iblis membawa-Nya pula ke atas gunung yang sangat tinggi dan memperlihatkan kepada-Nya semua kerajaan dunia dengan kemegahannya,
dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will give you all of these things, if you will fall down and worship me.”

block.text: <<Semua itu akan kuberikan kepada-Mu, jika Engkau sujud menyembah aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus said to him,

block.text: Maka berkatalah Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’”

block.text: <<Enyahlah, Iblis! Sebab ada tertulis: <Engkau harus menyembah Tuhan, Allahmu, dan hanya kepada Dia sajalah engkau berbakti!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and served him.

block.text: Lalu Iblis meninggalkan Dia, dan lihatlah, malaikat-malaikat datang melayani Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee.

block.text: Tetapi waktu Yesus mendengar, bahwa Yohanes telah ditangkap, menyingkirlah Ia ke Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.

block.text: Ia meninggalkan Nazaret dan diam di Kapernaum, di tepi danau, di daerah Zebulon dan Naftali,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet was fulfilled:

block.text: supaya genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi Yesaya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,

block.text: <<Tanah Zebulon dan tanah Naftali, jalan ke laut, daerah seberang sungai Yordan, Galilea, wilayah bangsa-bangsa lain, —

ReferenceBlocks.text: the people who sat in darkness saw a great light, to those who sat in the region and shadow of death, to them light has dawned.”

block.text: bangsa yang diam dalam kegelapan, telah melihat Terang yang besar dan bagi mereka yang diam di negeri yang dinaungi maut, telah terbit Terang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say,

block.text: Sejak waktu itulah Yesus memberitakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.”

block.text: <<Bertobatlah, sebab Kerajaan Sorga sudah dekat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers: Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
He said to them,

block.text: Dan ketika Yesus sedang berjalan menyusur danau Galilea, Ia melihat dua orang bersaudara, yaitu Simon yang disebut Petrus, dan Andreas, saudaranya. Mereka sedang menebarkan jala di danau, sebab mereka penjala ikan.
Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come after me, and I will make you fishers for men.”

block.text: <<Mari, ikutlah Aku, dan kamu akan Kujadikan penjala manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They immediately left their nets and followed him.

block.text: Lalu merekapun segera meninggalkan jalanya dan mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them.

block.text: Dan setelah Yesus pergi dari sana, dilihat-Nya pula dua orang bersaudara, yaitu Yakobus anak Zebedeus dan Yohanes saudaranya, bersama ayah mereka, Zebedeus, sedang membereskan jala di dalam perahu. Yesus memanggil mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: They immediately left the boat and their father, and followed him.

block.text: dan mereka segera meninggalkan perahu serta ayahnya, lalu mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

block.text: Yesuspun berkeliling di seluruh Galilea; Ia mengajar dalam rumah-rumah ibadat dan memberitakan Injil Kerajaan Allah serta melenyapkan segala penyakit dan kelemahan di antara bangsa itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report about him went out into all Syria. They brought to him all who were sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, possessed with demons, epileptics, and paralytics; and he healed them.

block.text: Maka tersiarlah berita tentang Dia di seluruh Siria dan dibawalah kepada-Nya semua orang yang buruk keadaannya, yang menderita pelbagai penyakit dan sengsara, yang kerasukan, yang sakit ayan dan yang lumpuh, lalu Yesus menyembuhkan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and from beyond the Jordan followed him.

block.text: Maka orang banyak berbondong-bondong mengikuti Dia. Mereka datang dari Galilea dan dari Dekapolis, dari Yerusalem dan dari Yudea dan dari seberang Yordan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 5
Seeing the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain. When he had sat down, his disciples came to him.
He began to teach them, saying,

block.text: Ketika Yesus melihat orang banyak itu, naiklah Ia ke atas bukit dan setelah Ia duduk, datanglah murid-murid-Nya kepada-Nya.
Maka Yesuspun mulai berbicara dan mengajar mereka, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: <<Berbahagialah orang yang miskin di hadapan Allah, karena merekalah yang empunya Kerajaan Sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

block.text: Berbahagialah orang yang berdukacita, karena mereka akan dihibur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are the gentle, for they shall inherit the earth.

block.text: Berbahagialah orang yang lemah lembut, karena mereka akan memiliki bumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled.

block.text: Berbahagialah orang yang lapar dan haus akan kebenaran, karena mereka akan dipuaskan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.

block.text: Berbahagialah orang yang murah hatinya, karena mereka akan beroleh kemurahan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.

block.text: <<Berbahagialah orang yang suci hatinya, karena mereka akan melihat Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called children of God.

block.text: Berbahagialah orang yang membawa damai, karena mereka akan disebut anak-anak Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: Berbahagialah orang yang dianiaya oleh sebab kebenaran, karena merekalah yang empunya Kerajaan Sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are you when people reproach you, persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

block.text: Berbahagialah kamu, jika karena Aku kamu dicela dan dianiaya dan kepadamu difitnahkan segala yang jahat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Rejoice, and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven. For that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

block.text: Bersukacita dan bergembiralah, karena upahmu besar di sorga, sebab demikian juga telah dianiaya nabi-nabi yang sebelum kamu.>> Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost its flavor, with what will it be salted? It is then good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men.

block.text: <<Kamu adalah garam dunia. Jika garam itu menjadi tawar, dengan apakah ia diasinkan? Tidak ada lagi gunanya selain dibuang dan diinjak orang.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill can’t be hidden.

block.text: <<Kamu adalah terang dunia. Kota yang terletak di atas gunung tidak mungkin tersembunyi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither do you light a lamp, and put it under a measuring basket, but on a stand; and it shines to all who are in the house.

block.text: Lagipula orang tidak menyalakan pelita lalu meletakkannya di bawah gantang, melainkan di atas kaki dian sehingga menerangi semua orang di dalam rumah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so, let your light shine before men; that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Demikianlah hendaknya terangmu bercahaya di depan orang, supaya mereka melihat perbuatanmu yang baik dan memuliakan Bapamu yang di sorga.> Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets. I didn’t come to destroy, but to fulfill.

block.text: <<Janganlah kamu menyangka, bahwa Aku datang untuk meniadakan hukum Taurat atau kitab para nabi. Aku datang bukan untuk meniadakannya, melainkan untuk menggenapinya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For most certainly, I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not even one smallest letter or one tiny pen stroke shall in any way pass away from the law, until all things are accomplished.

block.text: Karena Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya selama belum lenyap langit dan bumi ini, satu iota atau satu TITikpun tidak akan ditiadakan dari hukum Taurat, sebelum semuanya terjadi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever, therefore, shall break one of these least commandments, and teach others to do so, shall be called least in the Kingdom of Heaven; but whoever shall do and teach them shall be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: <<Karena itu siapa yang meniadakan salah satu perintah hukum Taurat sekalipun yang paling kecil, dan mengajarkannya demikian kepada orang lain, ia akan menduduki tempat yang paling rendah di dalam Kerajaan Sorga; tetapi siapa yang melakukan dan mengajarkan segala perintah-perintah hukum Taurat, ia akan menduduki tempat yang tinggi di dalam Kerajaan Sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I tell you that unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, there is no way you will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: Maka Aku berkata kepadamu: Jika hidup keagamaanmu tidak lebih benar dari pada hidup keagamaan ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi, sesungguhnya kamu tidak akan masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Sorga.>> Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, ‘You shall not murder;’ and ‘Whoever shall murder shall be in danger of the judgment.’

block.text: <<Kamu telah mendengar yang difirmankan kepada nenek moyang kita: <Jangan membunuh;> siapa yang membunuh harus dihukum.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment; and whoever shall say to his brother, ‘Raca!’ shall be in danger of the council; and whoever shall say, ‘You fool!’ shall be in danger of the fire of Gehenna.

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Setiap orang yang marah terhadap saudaranya harus dihukum; siapa yang berkata kepada saudaranya: <Kafir!> harus dihadapkan ke Mahkamah Agama dan siapa yang berkata: <Jahil!> harus diserahkan ke dalam neraka yang menyala-nyala.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore you are offering your gift at the altar, and there remember that your brother has anything against you,
leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.

block.text: <<Sebab itu, jika engkau mempersembahkan persembahanmu di atas mezbah dan engkau teringat akan sesuatu yang ada dalam hati saudaramu terhadap engkau,
tinggalkanlah persembahanmu di depan mezbah itu dan pergilah berdamai dahulu dengan saudaramu, lalu kembali untuk mempersembahkan persembahanmu itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Agree with your adversary quickly, while you are with him in the way; lest perhaps the prosecutor deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be cast into prison.

block.text: <<Segeralah berdamai dengan lawanmu selama engkau bersama-sama dengan dia di tengah jalan, supaya lawanmu itu jangan menyerahkan engkau kepada hakim dan hakim itu menyerahkan engkau kepada pembantunya dan engkau dilemparkan ke dalam penjara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, you shall by no means get out of there, until you have paid the last penny.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya engkau tidak akan keluar dari sana, sebelum engkau membayar hutangmu sampai lunas.>> Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery;’

block.text: <<Kamu telah mendengar firman: <Jangan berzinah.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: but I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Setiap orang yang memandang perempuan serta menginginkannya, sudah berzinah dengan dia di dalam hatinya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your right eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

block.text: Maka jika matamu yang kanan menyesatkan engkau, cungkillah dan buanglah itu, karena lebih baik bagimu jika satu dari anggota tubuhmu binasa, dari pada tubuhmu dengan utuh dicampakkan ke dalam neraka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off, and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

block.text: Dan jika tanganmu yang kanan menyesatkan engkau, penggallah dan buanglah itu, karena lebih baik bagimu jika satu dari anggota tubuhmu binasa dari pada tubuhmu dengan utuh masuk neraka.> Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was also said, ‘Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorce.’

block.text: <<Telah difirmankan juga: <Siapa yang menceraikan isterinya harus memberi surat cerai kepadanya.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that whoever puts away his wife, except for the cause of sexual immorality, makes her an adulteress; and whoever marries her when she is put away commits adultery.

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Setiap orang yang menceraikan isterinya kecuali karena zinah, ia menjadikan isterinya berzinah; dan siapa yang kawin dengan perempuan yang diceraikan, ia berbuat zinah.>> Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again you have heard that it was said to them of old time, ‘You shall not make false vows, but shall perform to the Lord your vows,’

block.text: <<Kamu telah mendengar pula yang difirmankan kepada nenek moyang kita: <Jangan bersumpah palsu, melainkan peganglah sumpahmu di depan Tuhan.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: but I tell you, don’t swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Janganlah sekali-kali bersumpah, baik demi langit, karena langit adalah takhta Allah,

ReferenceBlocks.text: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

block.text: maupun demi bumi, karena bumi adalah tumpuan kaki-Nya, ataupun demi Yerusalem, karena Yerusalem adalah kota Raja Besar;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither shall you swear by your head, for you can’t make one hair white or black.

block.text: janganlah juga engkau bersumpah demi kepalamu, karena engkau tidak berkuasa memutihkan atau menghitamkan sehelai rambutpun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But let your ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes’ and your ‘No’ be ‘No.’ Whatever is more than these is of the evil one.

block.text: Jika ya, hendaklah kamu katakan: <ya>, jika tidak, hendaklah kamu katakan: <tidak.> Apa yang lebih dari pada itu berasal dari si jahat.>> Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’

block.text: <<Kamu telah mendengar firman: <Mata ganti mata dan gigi ganti gigi.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, don’t resist him who is evil; but whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other also.

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Janganlah kamu melawan orang yang berbuat jahat kepadamu, melainkan siapapun yang menampar pipi kananmu, berilah juga kepadanya pipi kirimu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone sues you to take away your coat, let him have your cloak also.

block.text: Dan kepada orang yang hendak mengadukan engkau karena mengingini bajumu, serahkanlah juga jubahmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.

block.text: Dan siapapun yang memaksa engkau berjalan sejauh satu mil, berjalanlah bersama dia sejauh dua mil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give to him who asks you, and don’t turn away him who desires to borrow from you.

block.text: Berilah kepada orang yang meminta kepadamu dan janganlah menolak orang yang mau meminjam dari padamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor, and hate your enemy.’

block.text: <<Kamu telah mendengar firman: <Kasihilah sesamamu manusia dan bencilah musuhmu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat you and persecute you.

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Kasihilah musuhmu dan berdoalah bagi mereka yang menganiaya kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then you will be children of your Father who is in heaven. For He makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and He sends rain on the just and the unjust.

block.text: Kemudian Anda akan menjadi anak-anak Bapamu yang di sorga. Untuk Dia membuat matahari naik yang jahat dan yang baik, dan Dia menurunkan hujan bagi adil dan tidak adil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Don’t even the tax collectors do the same?

block.text: Apabila kamu mengasihi orang yang mengasihi kamu, apakah upahmu? Bukankah pemungut cukai juga berbuat demikian?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you only greet your friends, what more do you do than others? Don’t even the tax collectors do the same?

block.text: Dan apabila kamu hanya memberi salam kepada saudara-saudaramu saja, apakah lebihnya dari pada perbuatan orang lain? Bukankah orang yang tidak mengenal Allahpun berbuat demikian?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.”

block.text: Karena itu haruslah kamu sempurna, sama seperti Bapamu yang di sorga adalah sempurna.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 6
“Be careful that you don’t do your charitable giving before men, to be seen by them. Otherwise you will have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

block.text: <<Ingatlah, jangan kamu melakukan <kewajiban agamamu> di hadapan orang supaya dilihat mereka, karena jika demikian, kamu tidak beroleh upah dari Bapamu yang di sorga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when you do merciful deeds, don’t sound a trumpet before yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may get glory from men. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.

block.text: <<Jadi apabila engkau memberi sedekah, janganlah engkau mencanangkan hal itu, seperti yang dilakukan orang munafik di rumah-rumah ibadat dan di lorong-lorong, supaya mereka dipuji orang. Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya mereka sudah mendapat upahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you do merciful deeds, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand does.

block.text: Tetapi jika engkau memberi sedekah, janganlah diketahui tangan kirimu apa yang diperbuat tangan kananmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That way your merciful deeds will be done in secret, then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

block.text: Hendaklah sedekahmu itu diberikan dengan tersembunyi, maka Bapamu yang melihat yang tersembunyi akan membalasnya kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Most certainly, I tell you, they have received their reward.

block.text: <<Dan apabila kamu berdoa, janganlah berdoa seperti orang munafik. Mereka suka mengucapkan doanya dengan berdiri dalam rumah-rumah ibadat dan pada tikungan-tikungan jalan raya, supaya mereka dilihat orang. Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya mereka sudah mendapat upahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you, when you pray, enter into your inner room, and having shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret. Your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

block.text: Tetapi jika engkau berdoa, masuklah ke dalam kamarmu, tutuplah pintu dan berdoalah kepada Bapamu yang ada di tempat tersembunyi. Maka Bapamu yang melihat yang tersembunyi akan membalasnya kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: In praying, don’t use vain repetitions, as the Gentiles do; for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.

block.text: Lagipula dalam doamu itu janganlah kamu bertele-tele seperti kebiasaan orang yang tidak mengenal Allah. Mereka menyangka bahwa karena banyaknya kata-kata doanya akan dikabulkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be like them, for your Father knows what things you need, before you ask him.

block.text: Jadi janganlah kamu seperti mereka, karena Bapamu mengetahui apa yang kamu perlukan, sebelum kamu minta kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pray like this: ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy.

block.text: <<Karena itu berdoalah demikian: Bapa kami yang di sorga, Dikuduskanlah nama-Mu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let your Kingdom come. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.

block.text: datanglah Kerajaan-Mu, jadilah kehendak-Mu di bumi seperti di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give us today our daily bread.

block.text: Berikanlah kami pada hari ini makanan kami yang secukupnya

ReferenceBlocks.text: Forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.

block.text: dan ampunilah kami akan kesalahan kami, seperti kami juga mengampuni orang yang bersalah kepada kami;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one. For yours is the Kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen.’

block.text: dan janganlah membawa kami ke dalam pencobaan, tetapi lepaskanlah kami dari pada yang jahat. (Karena Engkaulah yang empunya Kerajaan dan kuasa dan kemuliaan sampai selama-lamanya. Amin.)>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

block.text: Karena jikalau kamu mengampuni kesalahan orang, Bapamu yang di sorga akan mengampuni kamu juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you don’t forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

block.text: Tetapi jikalau kamu tidak mengampuni orang, Bapamu juga tidak akan mengampuni kesalahanmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moreover when you fast, don’t be like the hypocrites, with sad faces. For they disfigure their faces, that they may be seen by men to be fasting. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.

block.text: <<Dan apabila kamu berpuasa, janganlah muram mukamu seperti orang munafik. Mereka mengubah air mukanya, supaya orang melihat bahwa mereka sedang berpuasa. Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya mereka sudah mendapat upahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you, when you fast, anoint your head, and wash your face;

block.text: Tetapi apabila engkau berpuasa, minyakilah kepalamu dan cucilah mukamu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: that way you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.

block.text: supaya jangan dilihat oleh orang bahwa engkau sedang berpuasa, melainkan hanya oleh Bapamu yang ada di tempat tersembunyi. Maka Bapamu yang melihat yang tersembunyi akan membalasnya kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t lay up treasures for yourselves on the earth, where moth and rust consume, and where thieves break through and steal;

block.text: <<Janganlah kamu mengumpulkan harta di bumi; di bumi ngengat dan karat merusakkannya dan pencuri membongkar serta mencurinya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don’t break through and steal.

block.text: Tetapi kumpulkanlah bagimu harta di sorga; di sorga ngengat dan karat tidak merusakkannya dan pencuri tidak membongkar serta mencurinya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

block.text: Karena di mana hartamu berada, di situ juga hatimu berada.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is sound, your whole body will be full of light.

block.text: <<Mata adalah pelita tubuh. Jika matamu baik, teranglah seluruh tubuhmu;

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

block.text: jika matamu jahat, gelaplah seluruh tubuhmu. Jadi jika terang yang ada padamu gelap, betapa gelapnya kegelapan itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other; or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can’t serve both God and Mammon.

block.text: <<Tak seorangpun dapat mengabdi kepada dua tuan. Karena jika demikian, ia akan membenci yang seorang dan mengasihi yang lain, atau ia akan setia kepada yang seorang dan tidak mengindahkan yang lain. Kamu tidak dapat mengabdi kepada Allah dan kepada Mamon.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor yet for your body, what you will wear. Isn’t life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

block.text: <<Karena itu Aku berkata kepadamu: Janganlah kuatir akan hidupmu, akan apa yang hendak kamu makan atau minum, dan janganlah kuatir pula akan tubuhmu, akan apa yang hendak kamu pakai. Bukankah hidup itu lebih penting dari pada makanan dan tubuh itu lebih penting dari pada pakaian?

ReferenceBlocks.text: See the birds of the sky, that they don’t sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you of much more value than they?

block.text: Pandanglah burung-burung di langit, yang tidak menabur dan tidak menuai dan tidak mengumpulkan bekal dalam lumbung, namun diberi makan oleh Bapamu yang di sorga. Bukankah kamu jauh melebihi burung-burung itu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which of you, by being anxious, can add one moment to his lifespan?

block.text: Siapakah di antara kamu yang karena kekuatirannya dapat menambahkan sehasta saja pada jalan hidupnya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin,

block.text: Dan mengapa kamu kuatir akan pakaian? Perhatikanlah bunga bakung di ladang, yang tumbuh tanpa bekerja dan tanpa memintal,

ReferenceBlocks.text: yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.

block.text: namun Aku berkata kepadamu: Salomo dalam segala kemegahannyapun tidak berpakaian seindah salah satu dari bunga itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won’t he much more clothe you, you of little faith?

block.text: Jadi jika demikian Allah mendandani rumput di ladang, yang hari ini ada dan besok dibuang ke dalam api, tidakkah Ia akan terlebih lagi mendandani kamu, hai orang yang kurang percaya?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be anxious, saying, ‘What will we eat?’, ‘What will we drink?’ or, ‘With what will we be clothed?’

block.text: Sebab itu janganlah kamu kuatir dan berkata: <Apakah yang akan kami makan?> <Apakah yang akan kami minum?> <Apakah yang akan kami pakai?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Gentiles seek after all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.

block.text: Semua itu dicari bangsa-bangsa yang tidak mengenal Allah. Akan tetapi Bapamu yang di sorga tahu, bahwa kamu memerlukan semuanya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But seek first God’s Kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things will be given to you as well.

block.text: Tetapi carilah dahulu Kerajaan Allah dan kebenarannya, maka semuanya itu akan ditambahkan kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day’s own evil is sufficient.”

block.text: Sebab itu janganlah kamu kuatir akan hari besok, karena hari besok mempunyai kesusahannya sendiri. Kesusahan sehari cukuplah untuk sehari.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 7
“Don’t judge, so that you won’t be judged.

block.text: <<Jangan kamu menghakimi, supaya kamu tidak dihakimi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For with whatever judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you.

block.text: Karena dengan penghakiman yang kamu pakai untuk menghakimi, kamu akan dihakimi dan ukuran yang kamu pakai untuk mengukur, akan diukurkan kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?

block.text: <<Mengapakah engkau melihat selumbar di mata saudaramu, sedangkan balok di dalam matamu tidak engkau ketahui?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or how will you tell your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye;’ and behold, the beam is in your own eye?

block.text: Bagaimanakah engkau dapat berkata kepada saudaramu: <Biarlah aku mengeluarkan selumbar itu dari matamu,> padahal ada balok di dalam matamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You hypocrite! First remove the beam out of your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother’s eye.

block.text: Hai orang munafik, keluarkanlah dahulu balok dari matamu, maka engkau akan melihat dengan jelas untuk mengeluarkan selumbar itu dari mata saudaramu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t give that which is holy to the dogs, neither throw your pearls before the pigs, lest perhaps they trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.

block.text: <<Jangan kamu memberikan barang yang kudus kepada anjing dan jangan kamu melemparkan mutiaramu kepada babi, supaya jangan diinjak-injaknya dengan kakinya, lalu ia berbalik mengoyak kamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ask, and it will be given you. Seek, and you will find. Knock, and it will be opened for you.

block.text: <<Mintalah, maka akan diberikan kepadamu; carilah, maka kamu akan mendapat; ketoklah, maka pintu akan dibukakan bagimu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.

block.text: Karena setiap orang yang meminta, menerima dan setiap orang yang mencari, mendapat dan setiap orang yang mengetok, baginya pintu dibukakan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or who is there among you, who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

block.text: Adakah seorang dari padamu yang memberi batu kepada anaknya, jika ia meminta roti,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or if he asks for a fish, who will give him a serpent?

block.text: atau memberi ular, jika ia meminta ikan?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him!

block.text: Jadi jika kamu yang jahat tahu memberi pemberian yang baik kepada anak-anakmu, apalagi Bapamu yang di sorga! Ia akan memberikan yang baik kepada mereka yang meminta kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore whatever you desire for men to do to you, you shall also do to them; for this is the law and the prophets.

block.text: Segala sesuatu yang kamu kehendaki supaya orang perbuat kepadamu, perbuatlah demikian juga kepada mereka. Itulah isi seluruh hukum Taurat dan kitab para nabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Enter in by the narrow gate; for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and many are those who enter in by it.

block.text: <<Masuklah melalui pintu yang sesak itu, karena lebarlah pintu dan luaslah jalan yang menuju kepada kebinasaan, dan banyak orang yang masuk melaluinya;

ReferenceBlocks.text: How narrow is the gate, and restricted is the way that leads to life! Few are those who find it.

block.text: karena sesaklah pintu dan sempitlah jalan yang menuju kepada kehidupan, dan sedikit orang yang mendapatinya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly are ravening wolves.

block.text: <<Waspadalah terhadap nabi-nabi palsu yang datang kepadamu dengan menyamar seperti domba, tetapi sesungguhnya mereka adalah serigala yang buas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By their fruits you will know them. Do you gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?

block.text: Dari buahnyalah kamu akan mengenal mereka. Dapatkah orang memetik buah anggur dari semak duri atau buah ara dari rumput duri?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so, every good tree produces good fruit; but the corrupt tree produces evil fruit.

block.text: Demikianlah setiap pohon yang baik menghasilkan buah yang baik, sedang pohon yang tidak baik menghasilkan buah yang tidak baik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A good tree can’t produce evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree produce good fruit.

block.text: Tidak mungkin pohon yang baik itu menghasilkan buah yang tidak baik, ataupun pohon yang tidak baik itu menghasilkan buah yang baik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every tree that doesn’t grow good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.

block.text: Dan setiap pohon yang tidak menghasilkan buah yang baik, pasti ditebang dan dibuang ke dalam api.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore by their fruits you will know them.

block.text: Jadi dari buahnyalah kamu akan mengenal mereka.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven; but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Bukan setiap orang yang berseru kepada-Ku: <Tuhan, Tuhan!< akan masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Sorga, melainkan dia yang melakukan kehendak Bapa-Ku yang di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many will tell me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name, in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many mighty works?’

block.text: Pada hari terakhir banyak orang akan berseru kepada-Ku: <Tuhan, Tuhan, bukankah kami bernubuat demi nama-Mu, dan mengusir setan demi nama-Mu, dan mengadakan banyak mujizat demi nama-Mu juga?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then I will tell them, ‘I never knew you. Depart from me, you who work iniquity.’

block.text: Pada waktu itulah Aku akan berterus terang kepada mereka dan berkata: <Aku tidak pernah mengenal kamu! Enyahlah dari pada-Ku, kamu sekalian pembuat kejahatan!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone therefore who hears these words of mine, and does them, I will liken him to a wise man, who built his house on a rock.

block.text: <<Setiap orang yang mendengar perkataan-Ku ini dan melakukannya, ia sama dengan orang yang bijaksana, yang mendirikan rumahnya di atas batu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat on that house; and it didn’t fall, for it was founded on the rock.

block.text: Kemudian turunlah hujan dan datanglah banjir, lalu angin melanda rumah itu, tetapi rumah itu tidak rubuh sebab didirikan di atas batu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who hears these words of mine, and doesn’t do them will be like a foolish man, who built his house on the sand.

block.text: Tetapi setiap orang yang mendengar perkataan-Ku ini dan tidak melakukannya, ia sama dengan orang yang bodoh, yang mendirikan rumahnya di atas pasir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat on that house; and it fell--and great was its fall.”

block.text: Kemudian turunlah hujan dan datanglah banjir, lalu angin melanda rumah itu, sehingga rubuhlah rumah itu dan hebatlah kerusakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, when Jesus had finished saying these things, that the multitudes were astonished at his teaching.

block.text: Dan setelah Yesus mengakhiri perkataan ini, takjublah orang banyak itu mendengar pengajaran-Nya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He taught them as one who had authority, and not like the scribes.

block.text: sebab Ia mengajar mereka sebagai orang yang berkuasa, tidak seperti ahli-ahli Taurat mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 8
When he came down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

block.text: Setelah Yesus turun dari bukit, orang banyak berbondong-bondong mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a leper came to him and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Maka datanglah seorang yang sakit kusta kepada-Nya, lalu sujud menyembah Dia dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”

block.text: <<Tuan, jika Tuan mau, Tuan dapat mentahirkan aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying,

block.text: Lalu Yesus mengulurkan tangan-Nya, menjamah orang itu dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to... Be made clean.”

block.text: <<Aku mau, jadilah engkau tahir.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
Jesus said to him,

block.text: Seketika itu juga tahirlah orang itu dari pada kustanya.
Lalu Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See that you tell nobody, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”

block.text: <<Ingatlah, jangan engkau memberitahukan hal ini kepada siapapun, tetapi pergilah, perlihatkanlah dirimu kepada imam dan persembahkanlah persembahan yang diperintahkan Musa, sebagai bukti bagi mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking him,
and saying,

block.text: Ketika Yesus masuk ke Kapernaum, datanglah seorang perwira mendapatkan Dia dan memohon kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, my servant lies in the house paralyzed, grievously tormented.”

block.text: <<Tuan, hambaku terbaring di rumah karena sakit lumpuh dan ia sangat menderita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will come and heal him.”

block.text: <<Aku akan datang menyembuhkannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The centurion answered,

block.text: Tetapi jawab perwira itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I’m not worthy for you to come under my roof. Just say the word, and my servant will be healed.

block.text: <<Tuan, aku tidak layak menerima Tuan di dalam rumahku, katakan saja sepatah kata, maka hambaku itu akan sembuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I am also a man under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and tell another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and tell my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

block.text: Sebab aku sendiri seorang bawahan, dan di bawahku ada pula prajurit. Jika aku berkata kepada salah seorang prajurit itu: <Pergi!,> maka ia pergi, dan kepada seorang lagi: <Datang!,> maka ia datang, ataupun kepada hambaku: <Kerjakanlah ini!,> maka ia mengerjakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard it, he marveled, and said to those who followed,

block.text: Setelah Yesus mendengar hal itu, heranlah Ia dan berkata kepada mereka yang mengikuti-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, I haven’t found so great a faith, not even in Israel.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya iman sebesar ini tidak pernah Aku jumpai pada seorangpun di antara orang Israel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the Kingdom of Heaven,

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Banyak orang akan datang dari Timur dan Barat dan duduk makan bersama-sama dengan Abraham, Ishak dan Yakub di dalam Kerajaan Sorga,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but the children of the Kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

block.text: sedangkan anak-anak Kerajaan itu akan dicampakkan ke dalam kegelapan yang paling gelap, di sanalah akan terdapat ratap dan kertak gigi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to the centurion,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berkata kepada perwira itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way. Let it be done for you as you have believed.”

block.text: <<Pulanglah dan jadilah kepadamu seperti yang engkau percaya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His servant was healed in that hour.

block.text: " Maka pada saat itu juga sembuhlah hambanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw his wife’s mother lying sick with a fever.

block.text: Setibanya di rumah Petrus, Yesuspun melihat ibu mertua Petrus terbaring karena sakit demam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. She got up and served him.

block.text: Maka dipegang-Nya tangan perempuan itu, lalu lenyaplah demamnya. Iapun bangunlah dan melayani Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening came, they brought to him many possessed with demons. He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick.

block.text: Menjelang malam dibawalah kepada Yesus banyak orang yang kerasukan setan dan dengan sepatah kata Yesus mengusir roh-roh itu dan menyembuhkan orang-orang yang menderita sakit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was to fulfill what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying:

block.text: Hal itu terjadi supaya genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi Yesaya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He took our infirmities, and bore our diseases.”

block.text: <<Dialah yang memikul kelemahan kita dan menanggung penyakit kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes around him, he gave the order to depart to the other side.

block.text: Ketika Yesus melihat orang banyak mengelilingi-Nya, Ia menyuruh bertolak ke seberang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A scribe came, and said to him,

block.text: Lalu datanglah seorang ahli Taurat dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”

block.text: <<Guru, aku akan mengikut Engkau, ke mana saja Engkau pergi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”

block.text: <<Serigala mempunyai liang dan burung mempunyai sarang, tetapi Anak Manusia tidak mempunyai tempat untuk meletakkan kepala-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Another of his disciples said to him,

block.text: Seorang lain, yaitu salah seorang murid-Nya, berkata kepada-Nya:

block.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, izinkanlah aku pergi dahulu menguburkan ayahku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead.”

block.text: <<Ikutlah Aku dan biarlah orang-orang mati menguburkan orang-orang mati mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he got into a boat, his disciples followed him.

block.text: Lalu Yesus naik ke dalam perahu dan murid-murid-Nyapun mengikuti-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a violent storm came up on the sea, so much that the boat was covered with the waves, but he was asleep.

block.text: Sekonyong-konyong mengamuklah angin ribut di danau itu, sehingga perahu itu ditimbus gelombang, tetapi Yesus tidur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to him, and woke him up, saying,

block.text: Maka datanglah murid-murid-Nya membangunkan Dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Save us, Lord! We are dying!”

block.text: <<Tuhan, tolonglah, kita binasa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you so afraid O you of little faith?”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu takut, kamu yang kurang percaya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he got up, rebuked the wind and the sea, and there was a great calm.

block.text: Lalu bangunlah Yesus menghardik angin dan danau itu, maka danau itu menjadi teduh sekali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men marveled, saying,

block.text: Dan heranlah orang-orang itu, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What kind of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

block.text: <<Orang apakah Dia ini, sehingga angin dan danaupun taat kepada-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came to the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, two demon possessed men coming out of the tombs met him there. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.
Behold, they cried out, saying,

block.text: Setibanya di seberang, yaitu di daerah orang Gadara, datanglah dari pekuburan dua orang yang kerasukan setan menemui Yesus. Mereka sangat berbahaya, sehingga tidak seorangpun yang berani melalui jalan itu.
Dan mereka itupun berteriak, katanya:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”

block.text: <<Apa urusan-Mu dengan kami, hai Anak Allah? Adakah Engkau ke mari untuk menyiksa kami sebelum waktunya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was a herd of many pigs feeding far away from them.

block.text: Tidak jauh dari mereka itu sejumlah besar babi sedang mencari makan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The demons begged him, saying,

block.text: Maka setan-setan itu meminta kepada-Nya, katanya:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of pigs.”

block.text: <<Jika Engkau mengusir kami, suruhlah kami pindah ke dalam kawanan babi itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go!”

block.text: <<Pergilah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came out,
and went into the herd of pigs: and behold, the whole herd of pigs rushed
down the cliff into the sea,
and died in the water.

block.text: Lalu keluarlah mereka
dan masuk ke dalam babi-babi itu. Maka terjunlah
seluruh kawanan babi itu dari tepi jurang ke dalam danau
dan mati di dalam air.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who fed them fled, and went away into the city, and told everything, including what happened to those who were possessed with demons.

block.text: Maka larilah penjaga-penjaga babi itu dan setibanya di kota, diceriterakannyalah segala sesuatu, juga tentang orang-orang yang kerasukan setan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him saying:

block.text: Maka keluarlah seluruh kota mendapatkan Yesus dan setelah mereka berjumpa dengan Dia, merekapun mendesak,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Depart from our borders.”

block.text: supaya Ia meninggalkan daerah mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 9
He entered into a boat, and crossed over, and came into his own city.

block.text: Sesudah itu naiklah Yesus ke dalam perahu lalu menyeberang. Kemudian sampailah Ia ke kota-Nya sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, they brought to him a man who was paralyzed, lying on a bed. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic,

block.text: Maka dibawa oranglah kepada-Nya seorang lumpuh yang terbaring di tempat tidurnya. Ketika Yesus melihat iman mereka, berkatalah Ia kepada orang lumpuh itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son, cheer up! Your sins are forgiven you.”

block.text: <<Percayalah, hai anak-Ku, dosamu sudah diampuni.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, some of the scribes said to themselves,

block.text: Maka berkatalah beberapa orang ahli Taurat dalam hatinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man blasphemes.”

block.text: <<Ia menghujat Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mengetahui pikiran mereka, lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you think evil in your hearts?

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu memikirkan hal-hal yang jahat di dalam hatimu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Get up, and walk?’

block.text: Manakah lebih mudah, mengatakan: <Dosamu sudah diampuni,> atau mengatakan: <Bangunlah dan berjalanlah?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins...”

block.text: Tetapi supaya kamu tahu, bahwa di dunia ini Anak Manusia berkuasa mengampuni dosa>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: (then he said to the paralytic),

block.text: --lalu berkatalah Ia kepada orang lumpuh itu--:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get up, and take up your mat, and go up to your house.”

block.text: <<Bangunlah, angkatlah tempat tidurmu dan pulanglah ke rumahmu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and departed to his house.

block.text: Dan orang itupun bangun lalu pulang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such authority to men.

block.text: Maka orang banyak yang melihat hal itu takut lalu memuliakan Allah yang telah memberikan kuasa sedemikian itu kepada manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Jesus passed by from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax collection office. He said to him,

block.text: Setelah Yesus pergi dari situ, Ia melihat seorang yang bernama Matius duduk di rumah cukai, lalu Ia berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: <<Ikutlah Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He got up and followed him.

block.text: " Maka berdirilah Matius lalu mengikut Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened as he sat in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.

block.text: Kemudian ketika Yesus makan di rumah Matius, datanglah banyak pemungut cukai dan orang berdosa dan makan bersama-sama dengan Dia dan murid-murid-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples,

block.text: Pada waktu orang Farisi melihat hal itu, berkatalah mereka kepada murid-murid Yesus:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

block.text: <<Mengapa gurumu makan bersama-sama dengan pemungut cukai dan orang berdosa?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them,

block.text: Yesus mendengarnya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.

block.text: <<Bukan orang sehat yang memerlukan tabib, tetapi orang sakit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ for I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

block.text: Jadi pergilah dan pelajarilah arti firman ini: <Yang Kukehendaki ialah belas kasihan dan bukan persembahan,> karena Aku datang bukan untuk memanggil orang benar, melainkan orang berdosa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then John’s disciples came to him, saying,

block.text: Kemudian datanglah murid-murid Yohanes kepada Yesus dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples don’t fast?”

block.text: <<Mengapa kami dan orang Farisi berpuasa, tetapi murid-murid-Mu tidak?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can the friends of the bridegroom mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.

block.text: <<Dapatkah sahabat-sahabat mempelai laki-laki berdukacita selama mempelai itu bersama mereka? Tetapi waktunya akan datang mempelai itu diambil dari mereka dan pada waktu itulah mereka akan berpuasa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the patch would tear away from the garment, and a worse hole is made.

block.text: Tidak seorangpun menambalkan secarik kain yang belum susut pada baju yang tua, karena jika demikian kain penambal itu akan mencabik baju itu, lalu makin besarlah koyaknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither do people put new wine into old wineskins, or else the skins would burst, and the wine be spilled, and the skins ruined. No, they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.”

block.text: Begitu pula anggur yang baru tidak diisikan ke dalam kantong kulit yang tua, karena jika demikian kantong itu akan koyak sehingga anggur itu terbuang dan kantong itupun hancur. Tetapi anggur yang baru disimpan orang dalam kantong yang baru pula, dan dengan demikian terpeliharalah kedua-duanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he told these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Sementara Yesus berbicara demikian kepada mereka, datanglah seorang kepala rumah ibadat, lalu menyembah Dia dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”

block.text: <<Anakku perempuan baru saja meninggal, tetapi datanglah dan letakkanlah tangan-Mu atasnya, maka ia akan hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus got up and followed him, as did his disciples.

block.text: Lalu Yesuspun bangunlah dan mengikuti orang itu bersama-sama dengan murid-murid-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a woman who had an issue of blood for twelve years came behind him and touched the fringe of his garment.
She thought to herself,

block.text: Pada waktu itu seorang perempuan yang sudah dua belas tahun lamanya menderita pendarahan maju mendekati Yesus dari belakang dan menjamah jumbai jubah-Nya.
Karena katanya dalam hatinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I just touch his garment, I will be made well.”

block.text: <<Asal kujamah saja jubah-Nya, aku akan sembuh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berpaling dan memandang dia serta berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughter, cheer up! Your faith has made you well.”

block.text: <<Teguhkanlah hatimu, hai anak-Ku, imanmu telah menyelamatkan engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And the woman was made well from that hour.

block.text: " Maka sejak saat itu sembuhlah perempuan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus came into the ruler’s house and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd,
he said to them,

block.text: Ketika Yesus tiba di rumah kepala rumah ibadat itu dan melihat peniup-peniup seruling dan orang banyak ribut,
berkatalah Ia:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go away. The girl isn’t dead, but sleeping.”

block.text: <<Pergilah, karena anak ini tidak mati, tetapi tidur.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They mocked him, saying:

block.text: Tetapi mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The girl is dead!”

block.text: menertawakan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the crowd was put out, he entered in, took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

block.text: Setelah orang banyak itu diusir, Yesus masuk dan memegang tangan anak itu, lalu bangkitlah anak itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report of this went out into all that land.

block.text: Maka tersiarlah kabar tentang hal itu ke seluruh daerah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Jesus passed by from there, two blind men followed him, calling out and saying,

block.text: Ketika Yesus meneruskan perjalanan-Nya dari sana, dua orang buta mengikuti-Nya sambil berseru-seru dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have mercy on us, son of David!”

block.text: <<Kasihanilah kami, hai Anak Daud.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them,

block.text: Setelah Yesus masuk ke dalam sebuah rumah, datanglah kedua orang buta itu kepada-Nya dan Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you believe that I am able to do this?”

block.text: <<Percayakah kamu, bahwa Aku dapat melakukannya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Mereka menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord.”

block.text: <<Ya Tuhan, kami percaya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he touched their eyes, saying,

block.text: Lalu Yesus menjamah mata mereka sambil berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “According to your faith be it done to you.”

block.text: <<Jadilah kepadamu menurut imanmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Their eyes were opened. Jesus strictly commanded them, saying,

block.text: Maka meleklah mata mereka. Dan Yesuspun dengan tegas berpesan kepada mereka, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See that no one knows about this.”

block.text: <<Jagalah supaya jangan seorangpun mengetahui hal ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they went out and spread abroad his fame in all that land.

block.text: Tetapi mereka keluar dan memasyhurkan Dia ke seluruh daerah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went out, behold, a mute man who was demon possessed was brought to him.

block.text: Sedang kedua orang buta itu keluar, dibawalah kepada Yesus seorang bisu yang kerasukan setan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. The multitudes marveled, saying,

block.text: Dan setelah setan itu diusir, dapatlah orang bisu itu berkata-kata. Maka heranlah orang banyak, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!”

block.text: <<Yang demikian belum pernah dilihat orang di Israel.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees said,

block.text: Tetapi orang Farisi berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “By the prince of the demons, he casts out demons.”

block.text: <<Dengan kuasa penghulu setan Ia mengusir setan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went about all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
