block.text: Demikianlah Yesus berkeliling ke semua kota dan desa; Ia mengajar dalam rumah-rumah ibadat dan memberitakan Injil Kerajaan Sorga serta melenyapkan segala penyakit dan kelemahan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion for them, because they were harassed and scattered, like sheep without a shepherd.

block.text: Melihat orang banyak itu, tergeraklah hati Yesus oleh belas kasihan kepada mereka, karena mereka lelah dan terlantar seperti domba yang tidak bergembala.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to his disciples,

block.text: Maka kata-Nya kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The harvest indeed is plentiful, but the laborers are few.

block.text: <<Tuaian memang banyak, tetapi pekerja sedikit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pray therefore that the Lord of the harvest will send out laborers into his harvest.”

block.text: Karena itu mintalah kepada tuan yang empunya tuaian, supaya Ia mengirimkan pekerja-pekerja untuk tuaian itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 10
He called to himself his twelve disciples, and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every disease and every sickness.

block.text: Yesus memanggil kedua belas murid-Nya dan memberi kuasa kepada mereka untuk mengusir roh-roh jahat dan untuk melenyapkan segala penyakit dan segala kelemahan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these. The first, Simon, who is called Peter; Andrew, his brother; James the son of Zebedee; John, his brother;

block.text: Inilah nama kedua belas rasul itu: Pertama Simon yang disebut Petrus dan Andreas saudaranya, dan Yakobus anak Zebedeus dan Yohanes saudaranya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip; Bartholomew; Thomas; Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus; Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

block.text: Filipus dan Bartolomeus, Tomas dan Matius pemungut cukai, Yakobus anak Alfeus, dan Tadeus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon the Canaanite; and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

block.text: Simon orang Zelot dan Yudas Iskariot yang mengkhianati Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus sent these twelve out, and commanded them, saying,

block.text: Kedua belas murid itu diutus oleh Yesus dan Ia berpesan kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t go among the Gentiles, and don’t enter into any city of the Samaritans.

block.text: <<Janganlah kamu menyimpang ke jalan bangsa lain atau masuk ke dalam kota orang Samaria,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Rather, go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

block.text: melainkan pergilah kepada domba-domba yang hilang dari umat Israel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As you go, preach, saying, ‘The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!’

block.text: Pergilah dan beritakanlah: <Kerajaan Sorga sudah dekat.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, and cast out demons. Freely you received, so freely give.

block.text: Sembuhkanlah orang sakit; bangkitkanlah orang mati; tahirkanlah orang kusta; usirlah setan-setan. Kamu telah memperolehnya dengan cuma-cuma, karena itu berikanlah pula dengan cuma-cuma.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t take any gold, nor silver, nor brass in your money belts.

block.text: <<Janganlah kamu membawa emas atau perak atau tembaga dalam ikat pinggangmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take no bag for your journey, neither two coats, nor shoes, nor staff: for the laborer is worthy of his food.

block.text: Janganlah kamu membawa bekal dalam perjalanan, janganlah kamu membawa baju dua helai, kasut atau tongkat, sebab seorang pekerja patut mendapat upahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever city or village you enter, find out who in it is worthy; and stay there until you go on.

block.text: Apabila kamu masuk kota atau desa, carilah di situ seorang yang layak dan tinggallah padanya sampai kamu berangkat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As you enter into the household, greet it.

block.text: Apabila kamu masuk rumah orang, berilah salam kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If the household is worthy, let your peace come on it, but if it isn’t worthy, let your peace return to you.

block.text: Jika mereka layak menerimanya, salammu itu turun ke atasnya, jika tidak, salammu itu kembali kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever doesn’t receive you, nor hear your words, as you go out of that house or that city, shake off the dust from your feet.

block.text: Dan apabila seorang tidak menerima kamu dan tidak mendengar perkataanmu, keluarlah dan tinggalkanlah rumah atau kota itu dan kebaskanlah debunya dari kakimu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya pada hari penghakiman tanah Sodom dan Gomora akan lebih ringan tanggungannya dari pada kota itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, I send you out as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

block.text: <<Lihat, Aku mengutus kamu seperti domba ke tengah-tengah serigala, sebab itu hendaklah kamu cerdik seperti ular dan tulus seperti merpati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to councils, and in their synagogues they will scourge you.

block.text: <<Tetapi waspadalah terhadap semua orang; karena ada yang akan menyerahkan kamu kepada majelis agama dan mereka akan menyesah kamu di rumah ibadatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the nations.

block.text: Dan karena Aku, kamu akan digiring ke muka penguasa-penguasa dan raja-raja sebagai suatu kesaksian bagi mereka dan bagi orang-orang yang tidak mengenal Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they deliver you up, don’t be anxious how or what you will say, for it will be given you in that hour what you will say.

block.text: Apabila mereka menyerahkan kamu, janganlah kamu kuatir akan bagaimana dan akan apa yang harus kamu katakan, karena semuanya itu akan dikaruniakan kepadamu pada saat itu juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.

block.text: Karena bukan kamu yang berkata-kata, melainkan Roh Bapamu; Dia yang akan berkata-kata di dalam kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

block.text: <<Orang akan menyerahkan saudaranya untuk dibunuh, demikian juga seorang ayah akan anaknya. Dan anak-anak akan memberontak terhadap orang tuanya dan akan membunuh mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.

block.text: Dan kamu akan dibenci semua orang oleh karena nama-Ku; tetapi orang yang bertahan sampai pada kesudahannya akan selamat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the next, for most certainly I tell you, you will not have gone through all the cities of Israel until the Son of Man has come.

block.text: Apabila mereka menganiaya kamu dalam kota yang satu, larilah ke kota yang lain; karena Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya sebelum kamu selesai mengunjungi kota-kota Israel, Anak Manusia sudah datang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his lord.

block.text: Seorang murid tidak lebih dari pada gurunya, atau seorang hamba dari pada tuannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is enough for the disciple that he be like his teacher, and the servant like his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more those of his household!

block.text: Cukuplah bagi seorang murid jika ia menjadi sama seperti gurunya dan bagi seorang hamba jika ia menjadi sama seperti tuannya. Jika tuan rumah disebut Beelzebul, apalagi seisi rumahnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be afraid of them, for there is nothing covered that will not be revealed; and hidden that will not be known.

block.text: <<Jadi janganlah kamu takut terhadap mereka, karena tidak ada sesuatupun yang tertutup yang tidak akan dibuka dan tidak ada sesuatupun yang tersembunyi yang tidak akan diketahui.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear whispered in the ear, proclaim on the housetops.

block.text: Apa yang Kukatakan kepadamu dalam gelap, katakanlah itu dalam terang; dan apa yang dibisikkan ke telingamu, beritakanlah itu dari atas atap rumah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul. Rather, fear the one who is able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna.

block.text: Dan janganlah kamu takut kepada mereka yang dapat membunuh tubuh, tetapi yang tidak berkuasa membunuh jiwa; takutlah terutama kepada Dia yang berkuasa membinasakan baik jiwa maupun tubuh di dalam neraka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren’t two sparrows sold for a penny? Not one of them falls on the ground apart from your Father’s will.

block.text: <<Bukankah burung pipit dijual dua ekor seduit? Namun seekorpun dari padanya tidak akan jatuh ke bumi di luar kehendak Bapamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

block.text: Dan kamu, rambut kepalamupun terhitung semuanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.

block.text: Sebab itu janganlah kamu takut, karena kamu lebih berharga dari pada banyak burung pipit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone therefore who confesses me before men, him I will also confess before my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: <<Setiap orang yang mengakui Aku di depan manusia, Aku juga akan mengakuinya di depan Bapa-Ku yang di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But whoever denies me before men, him I will also deny before my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Tetapi barangsiapa menyangkal Aku di depan manusia, Aku juga akan menyangkalnya di depan Bapa-Ku yang di sorga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t think that I came to send peace on the earth. I didn’t come to send peace, but a sword.

block.text: <<Jangan kamu menyangka, bahwa Aku datang untuk membawa damai di atas bumi; Aku datang bukan untuk membawa damai, melainkan pedang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I came to set a man at odds against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

block.text: Sebab Aku datang untuk memisahkan orang dari ayahnya, anak perempuan dari ibunya, menantu perempuan dari ibu mertuanya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: A man’s foes will be those of his own household.

block.text: dan musuh orang ialah orang-orang seisi rumahnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn’t worthy of me.

block.text: <<Barangsiapa mengasihi bapa atau ibunya lebih dari pada-Ku, ia tidak layak bagi-Ku; dan barangsiapa mengasihi anaknya laki-laki atau perempuan lebih dari pada-Ku, ia tidak layak bagi-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who doesn’t take his cross and follow after me, isn’t worthy of me.

block.text: Barangsiapa tidak memikul salibnya dan mengikut Aku, ia tidak layak bagi-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who seeks his life will lose it; and he who loses his life for my sake will find it.

block.text: Barangsiapa mempertahankan nyawanya, ia akan kehilangan nyawanya, dan barangsiapa kehilangan nyawanya karena Aku, ia akan memperolehnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who receives you receives me, and he who receives me receives him who sent me.

block.text: <<Barangsiapa menyambut kamu, ia menyambut Aku, dan barangsiapa menyambut Aku, ia menyambut Dia yang mengutus Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. He who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man’s reward.

block.text: Barangsiapa menyambut seorang nabi sebagai nabi, ia akan menerima upah nabi, dan barangsiapa menyambut seorang benar sebagai orang benar, ia akan menerima upah orang benar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, most certainly I tell you he will in no way lose his reward.”

block.text: Dan barangsiapa memberi air sejuk secangkir sajapun kepada salah seorang yang kecil ini, karena ia murid-Ku, Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya ia tidak akan kehilangan upahnya dari padanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 11
It happened that when Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.

block.text: Setelah Yesus selesai berpesan kepada kedua belas murid-Nya, pergilah Ia dari sana untuk mengajar dan memberitakan Injil di dalam kota-kota mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when John heard in the prison what Christ was doing, he sent two of his disciples
and said to him,

block.text: Di dalam penjara Yohanes mendengar tentang pekerjaan Kristus,
lalu menyuruh murid-muridnya bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the one who comes, or should we look for another?”

block.text: <<Engkaukah yang akan datang itu atau haruskah kami menantikan orang lain?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Yesus menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:

block.text: <<Pergilah dan katakanlah kepada Yohanes apa yang kamu dengar dan kamu lihat:

ReferenceBlocks.text: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

block.text: orang buta melihat, orang lumpuh berjalan, orang kusta menjadi tahir, orang tuli mendengar, orang mati dibangkitkan dan kepada orang miskin diberitakan kabar baik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”

block.text: Dan berbahagialah orang yang tidak menjadi kecewa dan menolak Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As these went their way, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John,

block.text: Setelah murid-murid Yohanes pergi, mulailah Yesus berbicara kepada orang banyak itu tentang Yohanes:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

block.text: <<Untuk apakah kamu pergi ke padang gurun? Melihat buluh yang digoyangkan angin kian ke mari?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A man in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in king’s houses.

block.text: Atau untuk apakah kamu pergi? Melihat orang yang berpakaian halus? Orang yang berpakaian halus itu tempatnya di istana raja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

block.text: Jadi untuk apakah kamu pergi? Melihat nabi? Benar, dan Aku berkata kepadamu, bahkan lebih dari pada nabi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this is the one of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’

block.text: Karena tentang dia ada tertulis: <Lihatlah, Aku menyuruh utusan-Ku mendahului Engkau, ia akan mempersiapkan jalan-Mu di hadapan-Mu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya di antara mereka yang dilahirkan oleh perempuan tidak pernah tampil seorang yang lebih besar dari pada Yohanes Pembaptis, namun yang terkecil dalam Kerajaan Sorga lebih besar dari padanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.

block.text: Sejak tampilnya Yohanes Pembaptis hingga sekarang, Kerajaan Sorga diserong dan orang yang menyerongnya mencoba menguasainya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

block.text: Sebab semua nabi dan kitab Taurat bernubuat hingga tampilnya Yohanes

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.

block.text: dan--jika kamu mau menerimanya--ialah Elia yang akan datang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Siapa bertelinga, hendaklah ia mendengar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call to their companions and say,

block.text: <<Dengan apakah akan Kuumpamakan angkatan ini? Mereka itu seumpama anak-anak yang duduk di pasar dan berseru kepada teman-temannya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘We played the flute for you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned for you, and you didn’t lament.’

block.text: <Kami meniup seruling bagimu, tetapi kamu tidak menari, kami menyanyikan kidung duka, tetapi kamu tidak berkabung.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’

block.text: Karena Yohanes datang, ia tidak makan, dan tidak minum, dan mereka berkata: <Ia kerasukan setan.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”

block.text: Kemudian Anak Manusia datang, Ia makan dan minum, dan mereka berkata: <Lihatlah, Ia seorang pelahap dan peminum, sahabat pemungut cukai dan orang berdosa.> Tetapi hikmat Allah dibenarkan oleh perbuatannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn’t repent.

block.text: Lalu Yesus mulai mengecam kota-kota yang tidak bertobat, sekalipun di situ Ia paling banyak melakukan mujizat-mujizat-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

block.text: <<Celakalah engkau Khorazim! Celakalah engkau Betsaida! Karena jika di Tirus dan di Sidon terjadi mujizat-mujizat yang telah terjadi di tengah-tengah kamu, sudah lama mereka bertobat dan berkabung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Pada hari penghakiman, tanggungan Tirus dan Sidon akan lebih ringan dari pada tanggunganmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, you will go down to Hades. For if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in you, it would have remained until this day.

block.text: Dan engkau Kapernaum, apakah engkau akan dinaikkan sampai ke langit? Tidak, engkau akan diturunkan sampai ke dunia orang mati! Karena jika di Sodom terjadi mujizat-mujizat yang telah terjadi di tengah-tengah kamu, kota itu tentu masih berdiri sampai hari ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom, on the day of judgment, than for you.”

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Pada hari penghakiman, tanggungan negeri Sodom akan lebih ringan dari pada tanggunganmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: At that time, Jesus declared,

block.text: Pada waktu itu berkatalah Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.

block.text: <<Aku bersyukur kepada-Mu, Bapa, Tuhan langit dan bumi, karena semuanya itu Engkau sembunyikan bagi orang bijak dan orang pandai, tetapi Engkau nyatakan kepada orang kecil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, Father, for it was pleasing in your sight.

block.text: Ya Bapa, itulah yang berkenan kepada-Mu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows the Son, except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father, except the Son, and he to whom the Son desires to reveal him.”

block.text: Semua telah diserahkan kepada-Ku oleh Bapa-Ku dan tidak seorangpun mengenal Anak selain Bapa, dan tidak seorangpun mengenal Bapa selain Anak dan orang yang kepadanya Anak itu berkenan menyatakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.

block.text: <<Marilah kepada-Ku, semua yang letih lesu dan berbeban berat, Aku akan memberi kelegaan kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.

block.text: Pikullah kuk yang Kupasang dan belajarlah pada-Ku, karena Aku lemah lembut dan rendah hati dan jiwamu akan mendapat ketenangan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”

block.text: Sebab kuk yang Kupasang itu enak dan beban-Kupun ringan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 12
At that time, Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the grain fields. His disciples were hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.

block.text: Pada waktu itu, pada hari Sabat, Yesus berjalan di ladang gandum. Karena lapar, murid-murid-Nya memetik bulir gandum dan memakannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him,

block.text: Melihat itu, berkatalah orang-orang Farisi kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your disciples do what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath.”

block.text: <<Lihatlah, murid-murid-Mu berbuat sesuatu yang tidak diperbolehkan pada hari Sabat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Tetapi jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Haven’t you read what David did, when he was hungry, and those who were with him;

block.text: <<Tidakkah kamu baca apa yang dilakukan Daud, ketika ia dan mereka yang mengikutinya lapar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: how he entered into God’s house, and ate the show bread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?

block.text: bagaimana ia masuk ke dalam Rumah Allah dan bagaimana mereka makan roti sajian yang tidak boleh dimakan, baik olehnya maupun oleh mereka yang mengikutinya, kecuali oleh imam-imam?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or have you not read in the law, that on the Sabbath day, the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, and are guiltless?

block.text: Atau tidakkah kamu baca dalam kitab Taurat, bahwa pada hari-hari Sabat, imam-imam melanggar hukum Sabat di dalam Bait Allah, namun tidak bersalah?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that one greater than the temple is here.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Di sini ada yang melebihi Bait Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.

block.text: Jika memang kamu mengerti maksud firman ini: <Yang Kukehendaki ialah belas kasihan dan bukan persembahan,> tentu kamu tidak menghukum orang yang tidak bersalah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”

block.text: Karena Anak Manusia adalah Tuhan atas hari Sabat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He departed there, and went into their synagogue.

block.text: Setelah pergi dari sana, Yesus masuk ke rumah ibadat mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And behold there was a man with a withered hand. In order to accuse Jesus, they asked him,

block.text: Dan lihatlah ada seorang pria dengan tangan layu. Untuk menuduh Yesus, mereka bertanya kepadanya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?”

block.text: <<Bolehkah menyembuhkan orang pada hari Sabat?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What man is there among you, who has one sheep, and if this one falls into a pit on the Sabbath day, won’t he grab on to it, and lift it out?

block.text: <<Jika seorang dari antara kamu mempunyai seekor domba dan domba itu terjatuh ke dalam lobang pada hari Sabat, tidakkah ia akan menangkapnya dan mengeluarkannya?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath day.”

block.text: Bukankah manusia jauh lebih berharga dari pada domba? Karena itu boleh berbuat baik pada hari Sabat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he told the man,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepada orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stretch out your hand.”

block.text: <<Ulurkanlah tanganmu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He stretched it out; and it was restored whole, just like the other.

block.text: Dan ia mengulurkannya, maka pulihlah tangannya itu, dan menjadi sehat seperti tangannya yang lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees went out, and conspired against him, how they might destroy him.

block.text: Lalu keluarlah orang-orang Farisi itu dan bersekongkol untuk membunuh Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving that, withdrew from there. Great multitudes followed him; and he healed them all,
and commanded them, saying:

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mengetahui maksud mereka lalu menyingkir dari sana. Banyak orang mengikuti Yesus dan Ia menyembuhkan mereka semuanya.
Ia dengan keras

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not make my presence known.”

block.text: melarang mereka memberitahukan siapa Dia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

block.text: supaya genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi Yesaya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, my servant whom I have chosen; my beloved in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit on him. He will proclaim justice to the nations.

block.text: <<Lihatlah, itu Hamba-Ku yang Kupilih, yang Kukasihi, yang kepada-Nya jiwa-Ku berkenan; Aku akan menaruh roh-Ku ke atas-Nya, dan Ia akan memaklumkan hukum kepada bangsa-bangsa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will not strive, nor shout; neither will anyone hear his voice in the streets.

block.text: Ia tidak akan berbantah dan tidak akan berteriak dan orang tidak akan mendengar suara-Nya di jalan-jalan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He won’t break a bruised reed. He won’t quench a smoking flax, until he leads justice to victory.

block.text: Buluh yang patah terkulai tidak akan diputuskan-Nya, dan sumbu yang pudar nyalanya tidak akan dipadamkan-Nya, sampai Ia menjadikan hukum itu menang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In his name, the nations will hope.”

block.text: Dan pada-Nyalah bangsa-bangsa akan berharap.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then one possessed by a demon, blind and mute, was brought to him and he healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.

block.text: Kemudian dibawalah kepada Yesus seorang yang kerasukan setan. Orang itu buta dan bisu, lalu Yesus menyembuhkannya, sehingga si bisu itu berkata-kata dan melihat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the multitudes were amazed, and said,

block.text: Maka takjublah sekalian orang banyak itu, katanya:

block.characterId: people who saw healing of demon-possessed man who was blind and mute

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people who saw healing of demon-possessed man who was blind and mute
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can this be the son of David?”

block.text: <<Ia ini agaknya Anak Daud.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said,

block.text: Tetapi ketika orang Farisi mendengarnya, mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”

block.text: <<Dengan Beelzebul, penghulu setan, Ia mengusir setan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mengetahui pikiran mereka lalu berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.

block.text: <<Setiap kerajaan yang terpecah-pecah pasti binasa dan setiap kota atau rumah tangga yang terpecah-pecah tidak dapat bertahan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?

block.text: Demikianlah juga kalau Iblis mengusir Iblis, iapun terbagi-bagi dan melawan dirinya sendiri; bagaimanakah kerajaannya dapat bertahan?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I by Beelzebul cast out demons, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

block.text: Jadi jika Aku mengusir setan dengan kuasa Beelzebul, dengan kuasa siapakah pengikut-pengikutmu mengusirnya? Sebab itu merekalah yang akan menjadi hakimmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if I by the Spirit of God cast out demons, then the Kingdom of God has come upon you.

block.text: Tetapi jika Aku mengusir setan dengan kuasa Roh Allah, maka sesungguhnya Kerajaan Allah sudah datang kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man, and plunder his goods, unless he first bind the strong man? Then he will plunder his house.”

block.text: <<Atau bagaimanakah orang dapat memasuki rumah seorang yang kuat dan merampas harta bendanya apabila tidak diikatnya dahulu orang kuat itu? Sesudah diikatnya barulah dapat ia merampok rumah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who is not with me is against me, and he who doesn’t gather with me, scatters.

block.text: Siapa tidak bersama Aku, ia melawan Aku dan siapa tidak mengumpulkan bersama Aku, ia mencerai-beraikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.

block.text: Sebab itu Aku berkata kepadamu: Segala dosa dan hujat manusia akan diampuni, tetapi hujat terhadap Roh Kudus tidak akan diampuni.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, neither in this age, nor in that which is to come.”

block.text: Apabila seorang mengucapkan sesuatu menentang Anak Manusia, ia akan diampuni, tetapi jika ia menentang Roh Kudus, ia tidak akan diampuni, di dunia ini tidak, dan di dunia yang akan datangpun tidak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Either make the tree good, and its fruit good, or make the tree corrupt, and its fruit corrupt; for the tree is known by its fruit.

block.text: <<Jikalau suatu pohon kamu katakan baik, maka baik pula buahnya; jikalau suatu pohon kamu katakan tidak baik, maka tidak baik pula buahnya. Sebab dari buahnya pohon itu dikenal.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You offspring of vipers, how can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks.

block.text: Hai kamu keturunan ular beludak, bagaimanakah kamu dapat mengucapkan hal-hal yang baik, sedangkan kamu sendiri jahat? Karena yang diucapkan mulut meluap dari hati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The good man out of his good treasure of the heart brings out good things, and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings out evil things.

block.text: Orang yang baik mengeluarkan hal-hal yang baik dari perbendaharaannya yang baik dan orang yang jahat mengeluarkan hal-hal yang jahat dari perbendaharaannya yang jahat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that every idle word that men speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment.

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Setiap kata sia-sia yang diucapkan orang harus dipertanggungjawabkannya pada hari penghakiman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”

block.text: Karena menurut ucapanmu engkau akan dibenarkan, dan menurut ucapanmu pula engkau akan dihukum.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered,

block.text: Pada waktu itu berkatalah beberapa ahli Taurat dan orang Farisi kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”

block.text: <<Guru, kami ingin melihat suatu tanda dari pada-Mu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Tetapi jawab-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, but no sign will be given it but the sign of Jonah the prophet.

block.text: <<Angkatan yang jahat dan tidak setia ini menuntut suatu tanda. Tetapi kepada mereka tidak akan diberikan tanda selain tanda nabi Yunus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the whale, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

block.text: Sebab seperti Yunus tinggal di dalam perut ikan tiga hari tiga malam, demikian juga Anak Manusia akan tinggal di dalam rahim bumi tiga hari tiga malam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, someone greater than Jonah is here.

block.text: Pada waktu penghakiman, orang-orang Niniwe akan bangkit bersama angkatan ini dan menghukumnya juga. Sebab orang-orang Niniwe itu bertobat setelah mendengar pemberitaan Yunus, dan sesungguhnya yang ada di sini lebih dari pada Yunus!

ReferenceBlocks.text: The queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.

block.text: Pada waktu penghakiman, ratu dari Selatan itu akan bangkit bersama angkatan ini dan ia akan menghukumnya juga. Sebab ratu ini datang dari ujung bumi untuk mendengar hikmat Salomo, dan sesungguhnya yang ada di sini lebih dari pada Salomo!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passes through waterless places, seeking rest, and doesn’t find it.

block.text: <<Apabila roh jahat keluar dari manusia, iapun mengembara ke tempat-tempat yang tandus mencari perhentian. Tetapi ia tidak mendapatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he says, ‘I will return into my house from which I came out,’ and when he has come back, he finds it empty, swept, and put in order.

block.text: Lalu ia berkata: <Aku akan kembali ke rumah yang telah kutinggalkan itu.> Maka pergilah ia dan mendapati rumah itu kosong, bersih tersapu dan rapih teratur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he goes, and takes with himself seven other spirits more evil than he is, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first. Even so will it be also to this evil generation.”

block.text: Lalu ia keluar dan mengajak tujuh roh lain yang lebih jahat dari padanya dan mereka masuk dan berdiam di situ. Maka akhirnya keadaan orang itu lebih buruk dari pada keadaannya semula. Demikian juga akan berlaku atas angkatan yang jahat ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was yet speaking to the multitudes, behold, his mother and his brothers stood outside, seeking to speak to him.
One said to him,

block.text: Ketika Yesus masih berbicara dengan orang banyak itu, ibu-Nya dan saudara-saudara-Nya berdiri di luar dan berusaha menemui Dia.
Maka seorang berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your mother and your brothers stand outside, seeking to speak to you.”

block.text: <<Lihatlah, ibu-Mu dan saudara-saudara-Mu ada di luar dan berusaha menemui Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered him who spoke to him,

block.text: Tetapi jawab Yesus kepada orang yang menyampaikan berita itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?”

block.text: <<Siapa ibu-Ku? Dan siapa saudara-saudara-Ku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He stretched out his hand towards his disciples, and said,

block.text: Lalu kata-Nya, sambil menunjuk ke arah murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, my mother and my brothers!

block.text: <<Ini ibu-Ku dan saudara-saudara-Ku!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever does the will of my Father who is in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.”

block.text: Sebab siapapun yang melakukan kehendak Bapa-Ku di sorga, dialah saudara-Ku laki-laki, dialah saudara-Ku perempuan, dialah ibu-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 13
On that day Jesus went out of the house, and sat by the seaside.

block.text: Pada hari itu keluarlah Yesus dari rumah itu dan duduk di tepi danau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat, and sat, and all the multitude stood on the beach.

block.text: Maka datanglah orang banyak berbondong-bondong lalu mengerumuni Dia, sehingga Ia naik ke perahu dan duduk di situ, sedangkan orang banyak semuanya berdiri di pantai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke to them many things in parables, saying,

block.text: Dan Ia mengucapkan banyak hal dalam perumpamaan kepada mereka. Kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, a farmer went out to sow.
As he sowed, some seeds fell by the roadside, and the birds came and devoured them.

block.text: <<Adalah seorang penabur keluar untuk menabur.
Pada waktu ia menabur, sebagian benih itu jatuh di pinggir jalan, lalu datanglah burung dan memakannya sampai habis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell on rocky ground, where they didn’t have much soil, and immediately they sprang up, because they had no depth of earth.

block.text: Sebagian jatuh di tanah yang berbatu-batu, yang tidak banyak tanahnya, lalu benih itupun segera tumbuh, karena tanahnya tipis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the sun had risen, they were scorched. Because they had no root, they withered away.

block.text: Tetapi sesudah matahari terbit, layulah ia dan menjadi kering karena tidak berakar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked them.

block.text: Sebagian lagi jatuh di tengah semak duri, lalu makin besarlah semak itu dan menghimpitnya sampai mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell on good soil, and yielded fruit: some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.

block.text: Dan sebagian jatuh di tanah yang baik lalu berbuah: ada yang seratus kali lipat, ada yang enam puluh kali lipat, ada yang tiga puluh kali lipat. Jesus said,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Siapa bertelinga, hendaklah ia mendengar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples came, and said to him,

block.text: Maka datanglah murid-murid-Nya dan bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you speak to them in parables?”

block.text: <<Mengapa Engkau berkata-kata kepada mereka dalam perumpamaan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of Heaven, but it is not given to them.

block.text: <<Kepadamu diberi karunia untuk mengetahui rahasia Kerajaan Sorga, tetapi kepada mereka tidak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever has, to him will be given, and he will have abundance, but whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he has.

block.text: Karena siapa yang mempunyai, kepadanya akan diberi, sehingga ia berkelimpahan; tetapi siapa yang tidak mempunyai, apapun juga yang ada padanya akan diambil dari padanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I speak to them in parables, because seeing they don’t see, and hearing, they don’t hear, neither do they understand.

block.text: Itulah sebabnya Aku berkata-kata dalam perumpamaan kepada mereka; <karena sekalipun melihat, mereka tidak melihat dan sekalipun mendengar, mereka tidak mendengar dan tidak mengerti.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: In them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled, which says, ‘By hearing you will hear, and will in no way understand; Seeing you will see, and will in no way perceive:

block.text: <<Maka pada mereka genaplah nubuat Yesaya, yang berbunyi: <Kamu akan mendengar dan mendengar, namun tidak mengerti, kamu akan melihat dan melihat, namun tidak menanggap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for this people’s heart has grown callous, their ears are dull of hearing, they have closed their eyes; or else perhaps they might perceive with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and should turn again; and I would heal them.’”

block.text: Sebab hati bangsa ini telah menebal, dan telinganya berat mendengar, dan matanya melekat tertutup; supaya jangan mereka melihat dengan matanya dan mendengar dengan telinganya dan mengerti dengan hatinya, lalu berbalik sehingga Aku menyembuhkan mereka.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But blessed are your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear.

block.text: Tetapi berbahagialah matamu karena melihat dan telingamu karena mendengar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For most certainly I tell you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see the things which you see, and didn’t see them; and to hear the things which you hear, and didn’t hear them.”

block.text: Sebab Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya banyak nabi dan orang benar ingin melihat apa yang kamu lihat, tetapi tidak melihatnya, dan ingin mendengar apa yang kamu dengar, tetapi tidak mendengarnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear, then, the parable of the farmer.

block.text: <<Karena itu, dengarlah arti perumpamaan penabur itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When anyone hears the word of the Kingdom, and doesn’t understand it, the evil one comes, and snatches away that which has been sown in his heart. This is what was sown by the roadside.

block.text: Kepada setiap orang yang mendengar firman tentang Kerajaan Sorga, tetapi tidak mengertinya, datanglah si jahat dan merampas yang ditaburkan dalam hati orang itu; itulah benih yang ditaburkan di pinggir jalan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown on the rocky places, this is he who hears the word, and immediately with joy receives it;

block.text: Benih yang ditaburkan di tanah yang berbatu-batu ialah orang yang mendengar firman itu dan segera menerimanya dengan gembira.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But since he has no root in himself, he only endures for a short time. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles.

block.text: Tetapi ia tidak berakar dan tahan sebentar saja. Apabila datang penindasan atau penganiayaan karena firman itu, orang itupun segera murtad.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown among the thorns, this is he who hears the word, but the cares of this age and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.

block.text: <<Yang ditaburkan di tengah semak duri ialah orang yang mendengar firman itu, lalu kekuatiran dunia ini dan tipu daya kekayaan menghimpit firman itu sehingga tidak berbuah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown on the good ground, this is he who hears the word, and understands it, who most certainly bears fruit, and brings forth, some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.”

block.text: Yang ditaburkan di tanah yang baik ialah orang yang mendengar firman itu dan mengerti, dan karena itu ia berbuah, ada yang seratus kali lipat, ada yang enam puluh kali lipat, ada yang tiga puluh kali lipat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He set another parable before them, saying,

block.text: Yesus membentangkan suatu perumpamaan lain lagi kepada mereka, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.

block.text: <<Hal Kerajaan Sorga itu seumpama orang yang menaburkan benih yang baik di ladangnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and went away.

block.text: Tetapi pada waktu semua orang tidur, datanglah musuhnya menaburkan benih lalang di antara gandum itu, lalu pergi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the blade sprang up and brought forth fruit, the weeds appeared also.

block.text: Ketika gandum itu tumbuh dan mulai berbulir, nampak jugalah lalang itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The servants of the householder came and said to him, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Where did these weeds come from?’”

block.text: <<Maka datanglah hamba-hamba tuan ladang itu kepadanya dan berkata: <Tuan, bukankah benih baik, yang tuan taburkan di ladang tuan? Dari manakah lalang itu?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’ The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and gather them up?’”

block.text: Jawab tuan itu: <Seorang musuh yang melakukannya.> Lalu berkatalah hamba-hamba itu kepadanya: <Jadi maukah tuan supaya kami pergi mencabut lalang itu?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But he said, ‘No, lest perhaps while you gather up the weeds, you root up the wheat with them.

block.text: Tetapi ia berkata: <Jangan, sebab mungkin gandum itu ikut tercabut pada waktu kamu mencabut lalang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and in the harvest time I will tell the reapers, First, gather up the weeds, and bind them in bundles to burn them; but gather the wheat into my barn.’”

block.text: Biarkanlah keduanya tumbuh bersama sampai waktu menuai. Pada waktu itu aku akan berkata kepada para penuai: Kumpulkanlah dahulu lalang itu dan ikatlah berberkas-berkas untuk dibakar; kemudian kumpulkanlah gandum itu ke dalam lumbungku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He set another parable before them, saying,

block.text: Yesus membentangkan suatu perumpamaan lain lagi kepada mereka, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field;

block.text: <<Hal Kerajaan Sorga itu seumpama biji sesawi, yang diambil dan ditaburkan orang di ladangnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: which indeed is smaller than all seeds. But when it is grown, it is greater than the herbs, and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in its branches.”

block.text: Memang biji itu yang paling kecil dari segala jenis benih, tetapi apabila sudah tumbuh, sesawi itu lebih besar dari pada sayuran yang lain, bahkan menjadi pohon, sehingga burung-burung di udara datang bersarang pada cabang-cabangnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke another parable to them.

block.text: Dan Ia menceriterakan perumpamaan ini juga kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like yeast, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, until it was all leavened.”

block.text: <<Hal Kerajaan Sorga itu seumpama ragi yang diambil seorang perempuan dan diadukkan ke dalam tepung terigu tiga sukat sampai khamir seluruhnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the multitudes; He didn’t say anything to them without using a parable.

block.text: Semuanya itu disampaikan Yesus kepada orang banyak dalam perumpamaan, dan tanpa perumpamaan suatupun tidak disampaikan-Nya kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: So was fulfilled that which was spoken through the prophet:

block.text: supaya genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world.”

block.text: <<Aku mau membuka mulut-Ku mengatakan perumpamaan, Aku mau mengucapkan hal yang tersembunyi sejak dunia dijadikan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus sent the multitudes away, and went into the house. His disciples came to him, saying,

block.text: Maka Yesuspun meninggalkan orang banyak itu, lalu pulang. Murid-murid-Nya datang dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”

block.text: <<Jelaskanlah kepada kami perumpamaan tentang lalang di ladang itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Ia menjawab, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.

block.text: <<Orang yang menaburkan benih baik ialah Anak Manusia;

ReferenceBlocks.text: The field is the world, and the good seed are the children of the Kingdom. The weeds are the children of the evil one.

block.text: ladang ialah dunia. Benih yang baik itu anak-anak Kerajaan dan lalang anak-anak si jahat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.

block.text: Musuh yang menaburkan benih lalang ialah Iblis. Waktu menuai ialah akhir zaman dan para penuai itu malaikat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As therefore the weeds are gathered up and burned with fire; so will it be at the end of this age.

block.text: Maka seperti lalang itu dikumpulkan dan dibakar dalam api, demikian juga pada akhir zaman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will weed out of his Kingdom all things that cause stumbling, and those who do iniquity.

block.text: Anak Manusia akan menyuruh malaikat-malaikat-Nya dan mereka akan mengumpulkan segala sesuatu yang menyesatkan dan semua orang yang melakukan kejahatan dari dalam Kerajaan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will cast them into the furnace of fire where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

block.text: Semuanya akan dicampakkan ke dalam dapur api; di sanalah akan terdapat ratapan dan kertakan gigi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the righteous will shine forth like the sun in the Kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Pada waktu itulah orang-orang benar akan bercahaya seperti matahari dalam Kerajaan Bapa mereka. Siapa bertelinga, hendaklah ia mendengar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field, which a man found, and hid. In his joy, he goes and sells all that he has, and buys that field.”

block.text: <<Hal Kerajaan Sorga itu seumpama harta yang terpendam di ladang, yang ditemukan orang, lalu dipendamkannya lagi. Oleh sebab sukacitanya pergilah ia menjual seluruh miliknya lalu membeli ladang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a merchant seeking fine pearls.

block.text: Demikian pula hal Kerajaan Sorga itu seumpama seorang pedagang yang mencari mutiara yang indah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found one pearl of great price, he went and sold all that he had, and bought it.”

block.text: Setelah ditemukannya mutiara yang sangat berharga, iapun pergi menjual seluruh miliknya lalu membeli mutiara itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a dragnet, that was cast into the sea, and gathered some fish of every kind.

block.text: <<Demikian pula hal Kerajaan Sorga itu seumpama pukat yang dilabuhkan di laut, lalu mengumpulkan berbagai-bagai jenis ikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was filled, they drew up on the beach. They sat down, and gathered the good into containers, but the bad they threw away.

block.text: Setelah penuh, pukat itupun diseret orang ke pantai, lalu duduklah mereka dan mengumpulkan ikan yang baik ke dalam pasu dan ikan yang tidak baik mereka buang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So will it be in the end of the world. The angels will come forth, and separate the wicked from among the righteous.

block.text: Demikianlah juga pada akhir zaman: Malaikat-malaikat akan datang memisahkan orang jahat dari orang benar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.”

block.text: lalu mencampakkan orang jahat ke dalam dapur api; di sanalah akan terdapat ratapan dan kertakan gigi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you understood all these things?”

block.text: Mengertikah kamu semuanya itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Mereka menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord.”

block.text: <<Ya, kami mengerti.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Maka berkatalah Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore every scribe who has been made a disciple in the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a householder, who brings out of his treasure new and old things.”

block.text: <<Karena itu setiap ahli Taurat yang menerima pelajaran dari hal Kerajaan Sorga itu seumpama tuan rumah yang mengeluarkan harta yang baru dan yang lama dari perbendaharaannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed from there.

block.text: Setelah Yesus selesai menceriterakan perumpamaan-perumpamaan itu, Iapun pergi dari situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished, and said,

block.text: Setibanya di tempat asal-Nya, Yesus mengajar orang-orang di situ di rumah ibadat mereka. Maka takjublah mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where did this man get this wisdom, and these mighty works?

block.text: <<Dari mana diperoleh-Nya hikmat itu dan kuasa untuk mengadakan mujizat-mujizat itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother called Mary, and his brothers, James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?

block.text: Bukankah Ia ini anak tukang kayu? Bukankah ibu-Nya bernama Maria dan saudara-saudara-Nya: Yakobus, Yusuf, Simon dan Yudas?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren’t all of his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all of these things?”

block.text: Dan bukankah saudara-saudara-Nya perempuan semuanya ada bersama kita? Jadi dari mana diperoleh-Nya semuanya itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were offended by him. But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Lalu mereka kecewa dan menolak Dia. Maka Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and in his own house.”

block.text: <<Seorang nabi dihormati di mana-mana, kecuali di tempat asalnya sendiri dan di rumahnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He didn’t do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

block.text: Dan karena ketidakpercayaan mereka, tidak banyak mujizat diadakan-Nya di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 14
At that time, Herod the tetrarch heard the report concerning Jesus,
and said to his servants,

block.text: Pada masa itu sampailah berita-berita tentang Yesus kepada Herodes, raja wilayah.
Lalu ia berkata kepada pegawai-pegawainya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is John the Baptizer. He is risen from the dead. That is why these powers work in him.”

block.text: <<Inilah Yohanes Pembaptis; ia sudah bangkit dari antara orang mati dan itulah sebabnya kuasa-kuasa itu bekerja di dalam-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Herod had captured John, bound him, and put him in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
For John said to him,

block.text: Sebab memang Herodes telah menyuruh menangkap Yohanes, membelenggunya dan memenjarakannya, berhubung dengan peristiwa Herodias, isteri Filipus saudaranya.
Karena Yohanes pernah menegornya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

block.text: <<Tidak halal engkau mengambil Herodias!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod wanted to kill John but he was afraid of the people because they considered John to be a prophet.

block.text: Herodes ingin membunuhnya, tetapi ia takut akan orang banyak yang memandang Yohanes sebagai nabi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced among them and pleased Herod.
Then he promised her with an oath:

block.text: Tetapi pada hari ulang tahun Herodes, menarilah anak perempuan Herodias di tengah-tengah mereka dan menyukakan hati Herodes.
Jadi ia berjanji dengan sumpah:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will give you whatever you ask for!”

block.text: "Saya akan memberikan apa pun yang Anda minta!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: She, being prompted by her mother, said,

block.text: Maka setelah dihasut oleh ibunya, anak perempuan itu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptizer.”

block.text: <<Berikanlah aku di sini kepala Yohanes Pembaptis di sebuah talam.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The king was grieved, but for the sake of his oaths, and of those who sat at the table with him, he commanded that her request be granted.

block.text: Lalu sedihlah hati raja, tetapi karena sumpahnya dan karena tamu-tamunya diperintahkannya juga untuk memberikannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent and beheaded John in the prison.

block.text: Disuruhnya memenggal kepala Yohanes di penjara

ReferenceBlocks.text: His head was brought on a platter, and given to the young lady: and she brought it to her mother.

block.text: dan kepala Yohanes itupun dibawa orang di sebuah talam, lalu diberikan kepada gadis itu dan ia membawanya kepada ibunya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples came, and took the body, and buried it; and they went and told Jesus.

block.text: Kemudian datanglah murid-murid Yohanes Pembaptis mengambil mayatnya dan menguburkannya. Lalu pergilah mereka memberitahukannya kepada Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat, to a deserted place apart. When the multitudes heard it, they followed him on foot from the cities.

block.text: Setelah Yesus mendengar berita itu menyingkirlah Ia dari situ, dan hendak mengasingkan diri dengan perahu ke tempat yang sunyi. Tetapi orang banyak mendengarnya dan mengikuti Dia dengan mengambil jalan darat dari kota-kota mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went out, and he saw a great multitude. He had compassion on them, and healed their sick.

block.text: Ketika Yesus mendarat, Ia melihat orang banyak yang besar jumlahnya, maka tergeraklah hati-Nya oleh belas kasihan kepada mereka dan Ia menyembuhkan mereka yang sakit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had come, his disciples came to him, saying,

block.text: Menjelang malam, murid-murid-Nya datang kepada-Nya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This place is deserted, and the hour is already late. Send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves food.”

block.text: <<Tempat ini sunyi dan hari sudah mulai malam. Suruhlah orang banyak itu pergi supaya mereka dapat membeli makanan di desa-desa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They don’t need to go away. You give them something to eat.”

block.text: <<Tidak perlu mereka pergi, kamu harus memberi mereka makan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We only have here five loaves and two fish.”

block.text: <<Yang ada pada kami di sini hanya lima roti dan dua ikan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring them here to me.”

block.text: <<Bawalah ke mari kepada-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass; and he took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, broke and gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples gave to the multitudes.

block.text: Lalu disuruh-Nya orang banyak itu duduk di rumput. Dan setelah diambil-Nya lima roti dan dua ikan itu, Yesus menengadah ke langit dan mengucap berkat, lalu memecah-mecahkan roti itu dan memberikannya kepada murid-murid-Nya, lalu murid-murid-Nya membagi-bagikannya kepada orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all ate, and were filled. They took up twelve baskets full of that which remained left over from the broken pieces.

block.text: Dan mereka semuanya makan sampai kenyang. Kemudian orang mengumpulkan potongan-potongan roti yang sisa, dua belas bakul penuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who ate were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

block.text: Yang ikut makan kira-kira lima ribu laki-laki, tidak termasuk perempuan dan anak-anak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat, and to go ahead of him to the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus segera memerintahkan murid-murid-Nya naik ke perahu dan mendahului-Nya ke seberang, sementara itu Ia menyuruh orang banyak pulang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into the mountain by himself to pray. When evening had come, he was there alone.

block.text: Dan setelah orang banyak itu disuruh-Nya pulang, Yesus naik ke atas bukit untuk berdoa seorang diri. Ketika hari sudah malam, Ia sendirian di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, distressed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.

block.text: Perahu murid-murid-Nya sudah beberapa mil jauhnya dari pantai dan diombang-ambingkan gelombang, karena angin sakal.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the fourth watch of the night, Jesus came to them, walking on the sea.

block.text: Kira-kira jam tiga malam datanglah Yesus kepada mereka berjalan di atas air.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying,

block.text: Ketika murid-murid-Nya melihat Dia berjalan di atas air, mereka terkejut dan berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It’s a ghost!”

block.text: <<Itu hantu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and they cried in fear.
But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying

block.text: , lalu berteriak-teriak karena takut.
Tetapi segera Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”

block.text: <<Tenanglah! Aku ini, jangan takut!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered him and said,

block.text: Lalu Petrus berseru dan menjawab Dia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the waters.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, apabila Engkau itu, suruhlah aku datang kepada-Mu berjalan di atas air.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come!”

block.text: <<Datanglah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter stepped down from the boat, and walked on the waters to come to Jesus.

block.text: Maka Petrus turun dari perahu dan berjalan di atas air mendapatkan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he saw that the wind was strong, he was afraid, and beginning to sink, he cried out, saying,

block.text: Tetapi ketika dirasanya tiupan angin, takutlah ia dan mulai tenggelam lalu berteriak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, save me!”

block.text: <<Tuhan, tolonglah aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand, took hold of him, and said to him,

block.text: Segera Yesus mengulurkan tangan-Nya, memegang dia dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”

block.text: <<Hai orang yang kurang percaya, mengapa engkau bimbang?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they got up into the boat, the wind ceased.

block.text: Lalu mereka naik ke perahu dan anginpun redalah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were in the boat came and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Dan orang-orang yang ada di perahu menyembah Dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are truly the Son of God!”

block.text: <<Sesungguhnya Engkau Anak Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.

block.text: Setibanya di seberang mereka mendarat di Genesaret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the people of that place recognized him, they sent into all that surrounding region, and brought to him all who were sick.

block.text: Ketika Yesus dikenal oleh orang-orang di tempat itu, mereka memberitahukannya ke seluruh daerah itu. Maka semua orang yang sakit dibawa kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They begged him that they might just touch the fringe of his garment. As many as touched it were made whole.

block.text: Mereka memohon supaya diperkenankan menjamah jumbai jubah-Nya. Dan semua orang yang menjamah-Nya menjadi sembuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 15
Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying,

block.text: Kemudian datanglah beberapa orang Farisi dan ahli Taurat dari Yerusalem kepada Yesus dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do your disciples disobey the tradition of the elders? For they don’t wash their hands when they eat bread.”

block.text: <<Mengapa murid-murid-Mu melanggar adat istiadat nenek moyang kita? Mereka tidak membasuh tangan sebelum makan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Tetapi jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you also disobey the commandment of God because of your tradition?

block.text: <<Mengapa kamupun melanggar perintah Allah demi adat istiadat nenek moyangmu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God commanded, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’

block.text: Sebab Allah berfirman: <Hormatilah ayahmu dan ibumu;> dan lagi: <Siapa yang mengutuki ayahnya atau ibunya pasti dihukum mati.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you say, ‘Whoever may tell his father or his mother, “Whatever help you might otherwise have gotten from me is a gift devoted to God,”

block.text: Tetapi kamu berkata: <Barangsiapa berkata kepada bapanya atau kepada ibunya: Apa yang ada padaku yang dapat digunakan untuk pemeliharaanmu, sudah digunakan untuk persembahan kepada Allah,>

ReferenceBlocks.text: he shall not honor his father or mother.’ You have made the commandment of God void because of your tradition.”

block.text: orang itu tidak wajib lagi <menghormati bapanya atau ibunya.> Dengan demikian firman Allah kamu nyatakan tidak berlaku demi adat istiadatmu sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,

block.text: Hai orang-orang munafik! Benarlah nubuat Yesaya tentang kamu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘These people draw near to me with their mouth, and honor me with their lips; but their heart is far from me.

block.text: <Bangsa ini memuliakan Aku dengan bibirnya, padahal hatinya jauh dari pada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrine rules made by men.’”

block.text: Percuma mereka beribadah kepada-Ku, sedangkan ajaran yang mereka ajarkan ialah perintah manusia.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He summoned the multitude, and said to them,

block.text: Lalu Yesus memanggil orang banyak dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear, and understand.
That which enters into the mouth doesn’t defile the man; but that which proceeds out of the mouth, this defiles the man.”

block.text: <<Dengar dan camkanlah: bukan yang masuk ke dalam mulut yang menajiskan orang, melainkan yang keluar dari mulut, itulah yang menajiskan orang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the disciples came, and said to him,

block.text: Maka datanglah murid-murid-Nya dan bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended, when they heard this saying?”

block.text: <<Engkau tahu bahwa perkataan-Mu itu telah menjadi batu sandungan bagi orang-orang Farisi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Every plant which my heavenly Father didn’t plant will be uprooted.

block.text: <<Setiap tanaman yang tidak ditanam oleh Bapa-Ku yang di sorga akan dicabut dengan akar-akarnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Leave them alone. They are blind guides of the blind. If the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.”

block.text: Biarkanlah mereka itu. Mereka orang buta yang menuntun orang buta. Jika orang buta menuntun orang buta, pasti keduanya jatuh ke dalam lobang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered him,

block.text: Lalu Petrus berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Explain the parable to us.”

block.text: <<Jelaskanlah perumpamaan itu kepada kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So Jesus said,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you also still not understand?

block.text: <<Kamupun masih belum dapat memahaminya?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t you see that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the belly, and then out of the body?

block.text: Tidak tahukah kamu bahwa segala sesuatu yang masuk ke dalam mulut turun ke dalam perut lalu dibuang di jamban?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the things which proceed out of the mouth come out of the heart, and they defile the man.

block.text: Tetapi apa yang keluar dari mulut berasal dari hati dan itulah yang menajiskan orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For out of the heart come forth evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, sexual sins, thefts, false testimony, and blasphemies.

block.text: Karena dari hati timbul segala pikiran jahat, pembunuhan, perzinahan, percabulan, pencurian, sumpah palsu dan hujat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These are the things which defile the man; but to eat with unwashed hands doesn’t defile the man.”

block.text: Itulah yang menajiskan orang. Tetapi makan dengan tangan yang tidak dibasuh tidak menajiskan orang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went out from there, and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.

block.text: Lalu Yesus pergi dari situ dan menyingkir ke daerah Tirus dan Sidon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a Canaanite woman came out from those borders, and crying out she said,

block.text: Maka datanglah seorang perempuan Kanaan dari daerah itu dan berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have mercy on me, Lord, you son of David! My daughter is severely demonized!”

block.text: <<Kasihanilah aku, ya Tuhan, Anak Daud, karena anakku perempuan kerasukan setan dan sangat menderita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered her not a word. His disciples came and begged him, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus sama sekali tidak menjawabnya. Lalu murid-murid-Nya datang dan meminta kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Send her away; for she cries out after us.”

block.text: <<Suruhlah ia pergi, ia mengikuti kita dengan berteriak-teriak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I wasn’t sent to anyone but the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”

block.text: <<Aku diutus hanya kepada domba-domba yang hilang dari umat Israel.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she came and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Tetapi perempuan itu mendekat dan menyembah Dia sambil berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, help me.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, tolonglah aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not appropriate to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

block.text: <<Tidak patut mengambil roti yang disediakan bagi anak-anak dan melemparkannya kepada anjing.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she said,

block.text: Kata perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”

block.text: <<Benar Tuhan, namun anjing itu makan remah-remah yang jatuh dari meja tuannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus answered her,

block.text: Maka Yesus menjawab dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, great is your faith! Be it done to you even as you desire.”

block.text: <<Hai ibu, besar imanmu, maka jadilah kepadamu seperti yang kaukehendaki.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And her daughter was healed from that hour.

block.text: Dan seketika itu juga anaknya sembuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus departed there, and came near to the sea of Galilee; and he went up into the mountain, and sat there.

block.text: Setelah meninggalkan daerah itu, Yesus menyusur pantai danau Galilea dan naik ke atas bukit lalu duduk di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes came to him, having with them the lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others, and they put them down at his feet and he healed them.

block.text: Kemudian orang banyak berbondong-bondong datang kepada-Nya membawa orang lumpuh, orang timpang, orang buta, orang bisu dan banyak lagi yang lain, lalu meletakkan mereka pada kaki Yesus dan Ia menyembuhkan mereka semuanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The people were amazed when they saw the mute speaking, injured whole, lame walking, and blind seeing--and they glorified the God of Israel.

block.text: Maka takjublah orang banyak itu melihat orang bisu berkata-kata, orang timpang sembuh, orang lumpuh berjalan, orang buta melihat, dan mereka memuliakan Allah Israel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus summoned his disciples and said,

block.text: Lalu Yesus memanggil murid-murid-Nya dan berkata:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days and have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away fasting, or they might faint on the way.”

block.text: <<Hati-Ku tergerak oleh belas kasihan kepada orang banyak itu. Sudah tiga hari mereka mengikuti Aku dan mereka tidak mempunyai makanan. Aku tidak mau menyuruh mereka pulang dengan lapar, nanti mereka pingsan di jalan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples said to him,

block.text: Kata murid-murid-Nya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where should we get so many loaves in a deserted place as to satisfy so great a multitude?”

block.text: <<Bagaimana di tempat sunyi ini kita mendapat roti untuk mengenyangkan orang banyak yang begitu besar jumlahnya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How many loaves do you have?”

block.text: <<Berapa roti ada padamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Mereka mengatakan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Seven, and a few small fish.”

block.text: <<Tujuh, dan ada lagi beberapa ikan kecil.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the people, saying:

block.text: Lalu Yesus menyuruh

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit down on the ground.”

block.text: orang banyak itu duduk di tanah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the seven loaves and the fish. He gave thanks and broke them, and gave to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes.

block.text: Sesudah itu Ia mengambil ketujuh roti dan ikan-ikan itu, mengucap syukur, memecah-mecahkannya dan memberikannya kepada murid-murid-Nya, lalu murid-murid-Nya memberikannya pula kepada orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets full of the broken pieces that were left over.

block.text: Dan mereka semuanya makan sampai kenyang. Kemudian orang mengumpulkan potongan-potongan roti yang sisa, tujuh bakul penuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.

block.text: Yang ikut makan ialah empat ribu laki-laki, tidak termasuk perempuan dan anak-anak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he sent away the multitudes, got into the boat, and came into the borders of Magdala.

block.text: Lalu Yesus menyuruh orang banyak itu pulang. Ia naik perahu dan bertolak ke daerah Magadan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 16
The Pharisees and Sadducees came to test him and said,

block.text: Kemudian datanglah orang-orang Farisi dan Saduki hendak mencobai Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Show us a sign from Heaven.”

block.text: Mereka meminta supaya Ia memperlihatkan suatu tanda dari sorga kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Tetapi jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’

block.text: <<Pada petang hari karena langit merah, kamu berkata: Hari akan cerah,

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Hypocrites! You know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but you can’t discern the signs of the times!

block.text: dan pada pagi hari, karena langit merah dan redup, kamu berkata: Hari buruk. Rupa langit kamu tahu membedakannya tetapi tanda-tanda zaman tidak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and there will be no sign given to it, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.”

block.text: Angkatan yang jahat dan tidak setia ini menuntut suatu tanda. Tetapi kepada mereka tidak akan diberikan tanda selain tanda nabi Yunus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He left them, and departed.

block.text: Lalu Yesus meninggalkan mereka dan pergi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples came to the other side and had forgotten to take bread.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Pada waktu murid-murid Yesus menyeberang danau, mereka lupa membawa roti.
Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take heed and beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

block.text: <<Berjaga-jagalah dan waspadalah terhadap ragi orang Farisi dan Saduki.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned among themselves, saying,

block.text: Maka mereka berpikir-pikir dan seorang berkata kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We brought no bread.”

block.text: <<Itu dikatakan-Nya karena kita tidak membawa roti.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving it, said,

block.text: Dan ketika Yesus mengetahui apa yang mereka perbincangkan, Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you reason among yourselves, you of little faith, ‘because you have brought no bread?’

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu memperbincangkan soal tidak ada roti? Hai orang-orang yang kurang percaya!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t you yet not understand nor remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?

block.text: Belum juga kamu mengerti? Tidak kamu ingat lagi akan lima roti untuk lima ribu orang itu dan berapa bakul roti kamu kumpulkan kemudian?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you took up?

block.text: Ataupun akan tujuh roti untuk empat ribu orang itu dan berapa bakul kamu kumpulkan kemudian?

ReferenceBlocks.text: How is it that you don’t perceive that I didn’t speak to you concerning bread? But beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

block.text: Bagaimana mungkin kamu tidak mengerti bahwa bukan roti yang Kumaksudkan. Aku berkata kepadamu: Waspadalah terhadap ragi orang Farisi dan Saduki.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they understood that he didn’t tell them to beware of the yeast of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

block.text: Ketika itu barulah mereka mengerti bahwa bukan maksud-Nya supaya mereka waspada terhadap ragi roti, melainkan terhadap ajaran orang Farisi dan Saduki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus came into the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying,

block.text: Setelah Yesus tiba di daerah Kaisarea Filipi, Ia bertanya kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”

block.text: <<Kata orang, siapakah Anak Manusia itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Some say John the Baptizer, some, Elijah, and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.”

block.text: <<Ada yang mengatakan: Yohanes Pembaptis, ada juga yang mengatakan: Elia>> <<dan ada pula yang mengatakan: Yeremia atau salah seorang dari para nabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Yesus bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But who do you say that I am?”

block.text: <<Tetapi apa katamu, siapakah Aku ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter answered,

block.text: Maka jawab Simon Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”

block.text: <<Engkau adalah Mesias, Anak Allah yang hidup!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are you, Simon Bar Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: <<Berbahagialah engkau Simon bin Yunus sebab bukan manusia yang menyatakan itu kepadamu, melainkan Bapa-Ku yang di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I also tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my assembly, and the gates of Hades will not prevail against it.

block.text: Dan Akupun berkata kepadamu: Engkau adalah Petrus dan di atas batu karang ini Aku akan mendirikan jemaat-Ku dan alam maut tidak akan menguasainya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will give to you the keys of the Kingdom of Heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven; and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.”

block.text: Kepadamu akan Kuberikan kunci Kerajaan Sorga. Apa yang kauikat di dunia ini akan terikat di sorga dan apa yang kaulepaskan di dunia ini akan terlepas di sorga.>>
