ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he commanded the disciples that they should tell no one that he was Jesus the Christ.

block.text: Lalu Yesus melarang murid-murid-Nya supaya jangan memberitahukan kepada siapapun bahwa Ia Mesias.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that time, Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.

block.text: Sejak waktu itu Yesus mulai menyatakan kepada murid-murid-Nya bahwa Ia harus pergi ke Yerusalem dan menanggung banyak penderitaan dari pihak tua-tua, imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat, lalu dibunuh dan dibangkitkan pada hari ketiga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter took him aside, and began to rebuke him, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus menarik Yesus ke samping dan menegor Dia, katanya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Far be it from you, Lord! This will never be done to you.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, kiranya Allah menjauhkan hal itu! Hal itu sekali-kali takkan menimpa Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he turned, and said to Peter,

block.text: Maka Yesus berpaling dan berkata kepada Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, for you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of men.”

block.text: <<Enyahlah Iblis. Engkau suatu batu sandungan bagi-Ku, sebab engkau bukan memikirkan apa yang dipikirkan Allah, melainkan apa yang dipikirkan manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berkata kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

block.text: <<Setiap orang yang mau mengikut Aku, ia harus menyangkal dirinya, memikul salibnya dan mengikut Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, and whoever will lose his life for my sake will find it.

block.text: Karena barangsiapa mau menyelamatkan nyawanya, ia akan kehilangan nyawanya; tetapi barangsiapa kehilangan nyawanya karena Aku, ia akan memperolehnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what will it profit a man, if he gains the whole world, and forfeits his life? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life?

block.text: Apa gunanya seorang memperoleh seluruh dunia tetapi kehilangan nyawanya? Dan apakah yang dapat diberikannya sebagai ganti nyawanya?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to everyone according to his deeds.

block.text: Sebab Anak Manusia akan datang dalam kemuliaan Bapa-Nya diiringi malaikat-malaikat-Nya; pada waktu itu Ia akan membalas setiap orang menurut perbuatannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste of death, until they see the Son of Man coming in his Kingdom.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya di antara orang yang hadir di sini ada yang tidak akan mati sebelum mereka melihat Anak Manusia datang sebagai Raja dalam Kerajaan-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 17
After six days, Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John his brother, and brought them up into a high mountain by themselves.

block.text: Enam hari kemudian Yesus membawa Petrus, Yakobus dan Yohanes saudaranya, dan bersama-sama dengan mereka Ia naik ke sebuah gunung yang tinggi. Di situ mereka sendiri saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his garments became as white as the light.

block.text: Lalu Yesus berubah rupa di depan mata mereka; wajah-Nya bercahaya seperti matahari dan pakaian-Nya menjadi putih bersinar seperti terang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them talking with him.

block.text: Maka nampak kepada mereka Musa dan Elia sedang berbicara dengan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered, and said to Jesus,

block.text: Kata Petrus kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you want, let’s make three tents here: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, betapa bahagianya kami berada di tempat ini. Jika Engkau mau, biarlah kudirikan di sini tiga kemah, satu untuk Engkau, satu untuk Musa dan satu untuk Elia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them. Behold, a voice came out of the cloud, saying,

block.text: Dan tiba-tiba sedang ia berkata-kata turunlah awan yang terang menaungi mereka dan dari dalam awan itu terdengar suara yang berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Listen to him.”

block.text: <<Inilah Anak yang Kukasihi, kepada-Nyalah Aku berkenan, dengarkanlah Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces, and were very afraid.

block.text: Mendengar itu tersungkurlah murid-murid-Nya dan mereka sangat ketakutan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus came and touched them, saying:

block.text: Lalu Yesus datang kepada mereka dan menyentuh mereka sambil berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get up, and don’t be afraid.”

block.text: <<Berdirilah, jangan takut!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Lifting up their eyes, they saw no one, except Jesus alone.

block.text: Dan ketika mereka mengangkat kepala, mereka tidak melihat seorangpun kecuali Yesus seorang diri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying,

block.text: Pada waktu mereka turun dari gunung itu, Yesus berpesan kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t tell anyone what you saw, until the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”

block.text: <<Jangan kamu ceriterakan penglihatan itu kepada seorangpun sebelum Anak Manusia dibangkitkan dari antara orang mati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples asked him, saying,

block.text: Lalu murid-murid-Nya bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

block.text: <<Kalau demikian mengapa ahli-ahli Taurat berkata bahwa Elia harus datang dahulu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Elijah indeed comes first, and will restore all things.

block.text: <<Memang Elia akan datang dan memulihkan segala sesuatu

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that Elijah has come already, and they didn’t recognize him, but did to him whatever they wanted to. Even so the Son of Man will also suffer by them.”

block.text: dan Aku berkata kepadamu: Elia sudah datang, tetapi orang tidak mengenal dia, dan memperlakukannya menurut kehendak mereka. Demikian juga Anak Manusia akan menderita oleh mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the disciples understood that he spoke to them of John the Baptizer.

block.text: Pada waktu itu mengertilah murid-murid Yesus bahwa Ia berbicara tentang Yohanes Pembaptis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to the multitude, a man came to him, kneeling down to him, saying,

block.text: Ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya kembali kepada orang banyak itu, datanglah seorang mendapatkan Yesus dan menyembah,
katanya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is epileptic, and suffers grievously; for he often falls into the fire, and often into the water.

block.text: <<Tuhan, kasihanilah anakku. Ia sakit ayan dan sangat menderita. Ia sering jatuh ke dalam api dan juga sering ke dalam air.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So I brought him to your disciples, and they could not cure him.”

block.text: Aku sudah membawanya kepada murid-murid-Mu, tetapi mereka tidak dapat menyembuhkannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Faithless and perverse generation! How long will I be with you? How long will I bear with you? Bring him here to me.”

block.text: <<Hai kamu angkatan yang tidak percaya dan yang sesat, berapa lama lagi Aku harus tinggal di antara kamu? Berapa lama lagi Aku harus sabar terhadap kamu? Bawalah anak itu ke mari!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus rebuked him, the demon went out
of him, and the boy was cured from that hour.

block.text: Dengan keras Yesus menegor dia, lalu keluarlah
setan itu dari padanya dan anak itupun sembuh seketika itu juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately, and said,

block.text: Kemudian murid-murid Yesus datang dan ketika mereka sendirian dengan Dia, bertanyalah mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why weren’t we able to cast it out?”

block.text: <<Mengapa kami tidak dapat mengusir setan itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because of your unbelief. For most certainly I tell you, if you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you will tell this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.

block.text: <<Karena kamu kurang percaya. Sebab Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya sekiranya kamu mempunyai iman sebesar biji sesawi saja kamu dapat berkata kepada gunung ini: <Pindah dari tempat ini ke sana,> --maka gunung ini akan pindah, dan takkan ada yang mustahil bagimu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But this kind doesn’t go out except by prayer and fasting.”

block.text: (Jenis ini tidak dapat diusir kecuali dengan berdoa dan berpuasa.)>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them,

block.text: Pada waktu Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya bersama-sama di Galilea, Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man is about to be delivered up into the hands of men,
and they will kill him, and the third day he will be raised up.”

block.text: <<Anak Manusia akan diserahkan ke dalam tangan manusia
dan mereka akan membunuh Dia dan pada hari ketiga Ia akan dibangkitkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were exceedingly sorry.

block.text: Maka hati murid-murid-Nya itupun sedih sekali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come to Capernaum, those who collected the didrachma coins came to Peter, and said,

block.text: Ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya tiba di Kapernaum datanglah pemungut bea Bait Allah kepada Petrus dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Doesn’t your teacher pay the temple tax?”

block.text: <<Apakah gurumu tidak membayar bea dua dirham itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes.”

block.text: <<Memang membayar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying,

block.text: Dan ketika Petrus masuk rumah, Yesus mendahuluinya dengan pertanyaan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth receive toll or tribute? From their children, or from strangers?”

block.text: <<Apakah pendapatmu, Simon? Dari siapakah raja-raja dunia ini memungut bea dan pajak? Dari rakyatnya atau dari orang asing?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said to him,

block.text: Jawab Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “From strangers.”

block.text: <<Dari orang asing!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore the children are exempt.

block.text: <<Jadi bebaslah rakyatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But, lest we cause them to stumble, go to the sea, cast a hook, and take up the first fish that comes up. When you have opened its mouth, you will find a four Drachma coin. Take that, and give it to them for me and you.”

block.text: Tetapi supaya jangan kita menjadi batu sandungan bagi mereka, pergilah memancing ke danau. Dan ikan pertama yang kaupancing, tangkaplah dan bukalah mulutnya, maka engkau akan menemukan mata uang empat dirham di dalamnya. Ambillah itu dan bayarkanlah kepada mereka, bagi-Ku dan bagimu juga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 18
In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying,

block.text: Pada waktu itu datanglah murid-murid itu kepada Yesus dan bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?”

block.text: <<Siapakah yang terbesar dalam Kerajaan Sorga?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus called a little child to himself, and set him in their midst,
and said,

block.text: Maka Yesus memanggil seorang anak kecil dan menempatkannya di tengah-tengah mereka
lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, unless you turn, and become as little children, you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya jika kamu tidak bertobat dan menjadi seperti anak kecil ini, kamu tidak akan masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever therefore humbles himself as this little child, the same is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: Sedangkan barangsiapa merendahkan diri dan menjadi seperti anak kecil ini, dialah yang terbesar dalam Kerajaan Sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever receives one such little child in my name receives me,

block.text: Dan barangsiapa menyambut seorang anak seperti ini dalam nama-Ku, ia menyambut Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him that a huge millstone should be hung around his neck, and that he should be sunk in the depths of the sea.”

block.text: <<Tetapi barangsiapa menyesatkan salah satu dari anak-anak kecil ini yang percaya kepada-Ku, lebih baik baginya jika sebuah batu kilangan diikatkan pada lehernya lalu ia ditenggelamkan ke dalam laut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to the world because of occasions of stumbling! For it must be that the occasions come, but woe to that person through whom the occasion comes!

block.text: Celakalah dunia dengan segala penyesatannya: memang penyesatan harus ada, tetapi celakalah orang yang mengadakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life maimed or crippled, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.

block.text: <<Jika tanganmu atau kakimu menyesatkan engkau, penggallah dan buanglah itu, karena lebih baik bagimu masuk ke dalam hidup dengan tangan kudung atau timpang dari pada dengan utuh kedua tangan dan kedua kakimu dicampakkan ke dalam api kekal.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire.

block.text: Dan jika matamu menyesatkan engkau, cungkillah dan buanglah itu, karena lebih baik bagimu masuk ke dalam hidup dengan bermata satu dari pada dicampakkan ke dalam api neraka dengan bermata dua.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: See that you don’t despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that in heaven their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Ingatlah, jangan menganggap rendah seorang dari anak-anak kecil ini. Karena Aku berkata kepadamu: Ada malaikat mereka di sorga yang selalu memandang wajah Bapa-Ku yang di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost.”

block.text: (Karena Anak Manusia datang untuk menyelamatkan yang hilang.)

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you think? If a man has one hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, doesn’t he leave the ninety-nine, go to the mountains, and seek that which has gone astray?

block.text: Bagaimana pendapatmu? Jika seorang mempunyai seratus ekor domba, dan seekor di antaranya sesat, tidakkah ia akan meninggalkan yang sembilan puluh sembilan ekor di pegunungan dan pergi mencari yang sesat itu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If he finds it, most certainly I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.

block.text: Dan Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya jika ia berhasil menemukannya, lebih besar kegembiraannya atas yang seekor itu dari pada atas yang kesembilan puluh sembilan ekor yang tidak sesat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.”

block.text: Demikian juga Bapamu yang di sorga tidak menghendaki supaya seorangpun dari anak-anak ini hilang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If your brother sins against you, go, show him his fault between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained back your brother.

block.text: <<Apabila saudaramu berbuat dosa, tegorlah dia di bawah empat mata. Jika ia mendengarkan nasihatmu engkau telah mendapatnya kembali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if he doesn’t listen, take one or two more with you, that at the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.

block.text: Jika ia tidak mendengarkan engkau, bawalah seorang atau dua orang lagi, supaya atas keterangan dua atau tiga orang saksi, perkara itu tidak disangsikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the assembly. If he refuses to hear the assembly also, let him be to you as a Gentile or a tax collector.

block.text: Jika ia tidak mau mendengarkan mereka, sampaikanlah soalnya kepada jemaat. Dan jika ia tidak mau juga mendengarkan jemaat, pandanglah dia sebagai seorang yang tidak mengenal Allah atau seorang pemungut cukai.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, whatever things you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you release on earth will have been released in heaven.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya apa yang kamu ikat di dunia ini akan terikat di sorga dan apa yang kamu lepaskan di dunia ini akan terlepas di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, assuredly I tell you, that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Dan lagi Aku berkata kepadamu: Jika dua orang dari padamu di dunia ini sepakat meminta apapun juga, permintaan mereka itu akan dikabulkan oleh Bapa-Ku yang di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in their midst.”

block.text: Sebab di mana dua atau tiga orang berkumpul dalam Nama-Ku, di situ Aku ada di tengah-tengah mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter came and said to him,

block.text: Kemudian datanglah Petrus dan berkata kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?”

block.text: <<Tuhan, sampai berapa kali aku harus mengampuni saudaraku jika ia berbuat dosa terhadap aku? Sampai tujuh kali?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, not seven times, but, seventy times seven.

block.text: <<Bukan! Aku berkata kepadamu: Bukan sampai tujuh kali, melainkan sampai tujuh puluh kali tujuh kali.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who wanted to reconcile accounts with his servants.

block.text: Sebab hal Kerajaan Sorga seumpama seorang raja yang hendak mengadakan perhitungan dengan hamba-hambanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had begun to reconcile, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.

block.text: Setelah ia mulai mengadakan perhitungan itu, dihadapkanlah kepadanya seorang yang berhutang sepuluh ribu talenta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But because he couldn’t pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, with his wife, his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.

block.text: Tetapi karena orang itu tidak mampu melunaskan hutangnya, raja itu memerintahkan supaya ia dijual beserta anak isterinya dan segala miliknya untuk pembayar hutangnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The servant therefore fell down and worshipped him before him, saying, ‘Lord, have patience with me, and I will repay you all!’

block.text: Maka sujudlah hamba itu menyembah dia, katanya: <Sabarlah dahulu, segala hutangku akan kulunaskan.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lord of that servant, being moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.”

block.text: Lalu tergeraklah hati raja itu oleh belas kasihan akan hamba itu, sehingga ia membebaskannya dan menghapuskan hutangnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But that servant went out, and found one of his fellow servants, who owed him one hundred denarii, and he grabbed him, and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’”

block.text: <<Tetapi ketika hamba itu keluar, ia bertemu dengan seorang hamba lain yang berhutang seratus dinar kepadanya. Ia menangkap dan mencekik kawannya itu, katanya: <Bayar hutangmu!>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you!’

block.text: Maka sujudlah kawannya itu dan memohon kepadanya: <Sabarlah dahulu, hutangku itu akan kulunaskan.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He would not, but went and cast him into prison, until he should pay back that which was due.

block.text: Tetapi ia menolak dan menyerahkan kawannya itu ke dalam penjara sampai dilunaskannya hutangnya. >> <<

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were exceedingly sorry, and came and told to their lord all that was done.

block.text: Melihat itu kawan-kawannya yang lain sangat sedih lalu menyampaikan segala yang terjadi kepada tuan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then his lord called him in, and said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt, because you begged me.

block.text: Raja itu menyuruh memanggil orang itu dan berkata kepadanya: <Hai hamba yang jahat, seluruh hutangmu telah kuhapuskan karena engkau memohonkannya kepadaku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Shouldn’t you also have had mercy on your fellow servant, even as I had mercy on you?’

block.text: Bukankah engkaupun harus mengasihani kawanmu seperti aku telah mengasihani engkau?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His lord was angry, and delivered him to the tormentors, until he should pay all that was due to him.

block.text: Maka marahlah tuannya itu dan menyerahkannya kepada algojo-algojo, sampai ia melunaskan seluruh hutangnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So my heavenly Father will also do to you, if you don’t each forgive your brother from your hearts for his misdeeds.”

block.text: <<Maka Bapa-Ku yang di sorga akan berbuat demikian juga terhadap kamu, apabila kamu masing-masing tidak mengampuni saudaramu dengan segenap hatimu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 19
It happened when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee, and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan.

block.text: Setelah Yesus selesai dengan pengajaran-Nya itu, berangkatlah Ia dari Galilea dan tiba di daerah Yudea yang di seberang sungai Yordan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes followed him, and he healed them there.

block.text: Orang banyak berbondong-bondong mengikuti Dia dan Iapun menyembuhkan mereka di sana.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pharisees came to him, testing him, and saying,

block.text: Maka datanglah orang-orang Farisi kepada-Nya untuk mencobai Dia. Mereka bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason?”

block.text: <<Apakah diperbolehkan orang menceraikan isterinya dengan alasan apa saja?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Haven’t you read that he who made them from the beginning made them male and female?

block.text: <<Tidakkah kamu baca, bahwa Ia yang menciptakan manusia sejak semula <menjadikan mereka laki-laki dan perempuan?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘For this cause a man shall leave his father and mother, and shall join to his wife; and the two shall become one flesh?’

block.text: Dan firman-Nya: <Sebab itu laki-laki akan meninggalkan ayah dan ibunya dan bersatu dengan isterinya, sehingga keduanya itu menjadi satu daging.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So that they are no more two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, don’t let man tear apart.”

block.text: Demikianlah mereka bukan lagi dua, melainkan satu. Karena itu, apa yang telah dipersatukan Allah, tidak boleh diceraikan manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why then did Moses command us to give her a bill of divorce, and divorce her?”

block.text: <<Jika demikian, apakah sebabnya Musa memerintahkan untuk memberikan surat cerai jika orang menceraikan isterinya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, allowed you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it has not been so.

block.text: <<Karena ketegaran hatimu Musa mengizinkan kamu menceraikan isterimu, tetapi sejak semula tidaklah demikian.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery; and he who marries her when she is divorced commits adultery.”

block.text: Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Barangsiapa menceraikan isterinya, kecuali karena zinah, lalu kawin dengan perempuan lain, ia berbuat zinah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples said to him,

block.text: Murid-murid itu berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If this is the case of the man with his wife, it is not good to marry.”

block.text: <<Jika demikian halnya hubungan antara suami dan isteri, lebih baik jangan kawin.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Akan tetapi Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not all men can receive this saying, but those to whom it is given.

block.text: <<Tidak semua orang dapat mengerti perkataan itu, hanya mereka yang dikaruniai saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men; and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the Kingdom of Heaven’s sake. He who is able to receive it, let him receive it.”

block.text: Ada orang yang tidak dapat kawin karena ia memang lahir demikian dari rahim ibunya, dan ada orang yang dijadikan demikian oleh orang lain, dan ada orang yang membuat dirinya demikian karena kemauannya sendiri oleh karena Kerajaan Sorga. Siapa yang dapat mengerti hendaklah ia mengerti.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then little children were brought to him, that he should lay his hands on them and pray; and the disciples rebuked them.
But Jesus said,

block.text: Lalu orang membawa anak-anak kecil kepada Yesus, supaya Ia meletakkan tangan-Nya atas mereka dan mendoakan mereka; akan tetapi murid-murid-Nya memarahi orang-orang itu.
Tetapi Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow the little children, and don’t forbid them to come to me; for the Kingdom of Heaven belongs to ones like these.”

block.text: <<Biarkanlah anak-anak itu, janganlah menghalang-halangi mereka datang kepada-Ku; sebab orang-orang yang seperti itulah yang empunya Kerajaan Sorga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He laid his hands on them, and departed from there.

block.text: Lalu Ia meletakkan tangan-Nya atas mereka dan kemudian Ia berangkat dari situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, one came to him and said,

block.text: Ada seorang datang kepada Yesus, dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Good teacher, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?”

block.text: <<Guru, perbuatan baik apakah yang harus kuperbuat untuk memperoleh hidup yang kekal?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me good? No one is good but one, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”

block.text: <<Apakah sebabnya engkau bertanya kepada-Ku tentang apa yang baik? Hanya Satu yang baik. Tetapi jikalau engkau ingin masuk ke dalam hidup, turutilah segala perintah Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Kata orang itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which ones?”

block.text: <<Perintah yang mana?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: Kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “‘You shall not murder.’ ‘You shall not commit adultery.’ ‘You shall not steal.’ ‘You shall not offer false testimony.’

block.text: <<Jangan membunuh, jangan berzinah, jangan mencuri, jangan mengucapkan saksi dusta,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Honor your father and mother.’ And, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’”

block.text: hormatilah ayahmu dan ibumu dan kasihilah sesamamu manusia seperti dirimu sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young man said to him,

block.text: Kata orang muda itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All these things I have observed from my youth. What do I still lack?”

block.text: <<Semuanya itu telah kuturuti, apa lagi yang masih kurang?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you want to be perfect, go, sell what you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.”

block.text: <<Jikalau engkau hendak sempurna, pergilah, juallah segala milikmu dan berikanlah itu kepada orang-orang miskin, maka engkau akan beroleh harta di sorga, kemudian datanglah ke mari dan ikutlah Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the young man heard the saying, he went away sad, for he was one who had great possessions.
Jesus said to his disciples,

block.text: Ketika orang muda itu mendengar perkataan itu, pergilah ia dengan sedih, sebab banyak hartanya.
Yesus berkata kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I say to you, a rich man will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven with difficulty.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya sukar sekali bagi seorang kaya untuk masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Sekali lagi Aku berkata kepadamu, lebih mudah seekor unta masuk melalui lobang jarum dari pada seorang kaya masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the disciples heard it, they were exceedingly astonished, saying,

block.text: Ketika murid-murid mendengar itu, sangat gemparlah mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then can be saved?”

block.text: <<Jika demikian, siapakah yang dapat diselamatkan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Looking at them, Jesus said,

block.text: Yesus memandang mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

block.text: <<Bagi manusia hal ini tidak mungkin, tetapi bagi Allah segala sesuatu mungkin.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter answered,

block.text: Lalu Petrus menjawab dan berkata kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we have left everything, and followed you. What then will we have?”

block.text: <<Kami ini telah meninggalkan segala sesuatu dan mengikut Engkau; jadi apakah yang akan kami peroleh?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you that you who have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of Man will sit on the throne of his glory, you also will sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya pada waktu penciptaan kembali, apabila Anak Manusia bersemayam di takhta kemuliaan-Nya, kamu, yang telah mengikut Aku, akan duduk juga di atas dua belas takhta untuk menghakimi kedua belas suku Israel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who has left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my name’s sake, will receive one hundred times, and will inherit eternal life.

block.text: Dan setiap orang yang karena nama-Ku meninggalkan rumahnya, saudaranya laki-laki atau saudaranya perempuan, bapa atau ibunya, anak-anak atau ladangnya, akan menerima kembali seratus kali lipat dan akan memperoleh hidup yang kekal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.”

block.text: <<Tetapi banyak orang yang terdahulu akan menjadi yang terakhir, dan yang terakhir akan menjadi yang terdahulu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 20
“For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who was the master of a household, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.

block.text: <<Adapun hal Kerajaan Sorga sama seperti seorang tuan rumah yang pagi-pagi benar keluar mencari pekerja-pekerja untuk kebun anggurnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

block.text: Setelah ia sepakat dengan pekerja-pekerja itu mengenai upah sedinar sehari, ia menyuruh mereka ke kebun anggurnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace.

block.text: <<Kira-kira pukul sembilan pagi ia keluar pula dan dilihatnya ada lagi orang-orang lain menganggur di pasar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: To them he said, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ So they went their way.

block.text: Katanya kepada mereka: <Pergi jugalah kamu ke kebun anggurku dan apa yang pantas akan kuberikan kepadamu.> Dan merekapun pergi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.

block.text: Kira-kira pukul dua belas dan pukul tiga petang ia keluar pula dan melakukan sama seperti tadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle. He said to them, ‘Why do you stand here all day idle?’”

block.text: Kira-kira pukul lima petang ia keluar lagi dan mendapati orang-orang lain pula, lalu katanya kepada mereka: <Mengapa kamu menganggur saja di sini sepanjang hari?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us.’” “He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and you will receive whatever is right.’

block.text: Kata mereka kepadanya: <Karena tidak ada orang mengupah kami.> Katanya kepada mereka: <Pergi jugalah kamu ke kebun anggurku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had come, the lord of the vineyard said to his manager, ‘Call the laborers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last to the first.’”

block.text: Ketika hari malam tuan itu berkata kepada mandurnya: <Panggillah pekerja-pekerja itu dan bayarkan upah mereka, mulai dengan mereka yang masuk terakhir hingga mereka yang masuk terdahulu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When those who were hired at about the eleventh hour came, they each received a denarius.

block.text: Maka datanglah mereka yang mulai bekerja kira-kira pukul lima dan mereka menerima masing-masing satu dinar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise each received a denarius.

block.text: Kemudian datanglah mereka yang masuk terdahulu, sangkanya akan mendapat lebih banyak, tetapi merekapun menerima masing-masing satu dinar juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they received it, they murmured against the master of the household,
saying, ‘These last have spent one hour, and you have made them equal to us, who have borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat!’”

block.text: Ketika mereka menerimanya, mereka bersungut-sungut kepada tuan itu,
katanya: <Mereka yang masuk terakhir ini hanya bekerja satu jam dan engkau menyamakan mereka dengan kami yang sehari suntuk bekerja berat dan menanggung panas terik matahari.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Didn’t you agree with me for a denarius?

block.text: <<Tetapi tuan itu menjawab seorang dari mereka: <Saudara, aku tidak berlaku tidak adil terhadap engkau. Bukankah kita telah sepakat sedinar sehari?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take that which is yours, and go your way. It is my desire to give to this last just as much as to you.

block.text: Ambillah bagianmu dan pergilah; aku mau memberikan kepada orang yang masuk terakhir ini sama seperti kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isn’t it lawful for me to do what I want to with what I own? Or is your eye evil, because I am good?’

block.text: Tidakkah aku bebas mempergunakan milikku menurut kehendak hatiku? Atau iri hatikah engkau, karena aku murah hati?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few are chosen.”

block.text: Demikianlah orang yang terakhir akan menjadi yang terdahulu dan yang terdahulu akan menjadi yang terakhir.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside, and on the way he said to them,

block.text: Ketika Yesus akan pergi ke Yerusalem, Ia memanggil kedua belas murid-Nya tersendiri dan berkata kepada mereka di tengah jalan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death,

block.text: <<Sekarang kita pergi ke Yerusalem dan Anak Manusia akan diserahkan kepada imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat, dan mereka akan menjatuhi Dia hukuman mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to mock, to scourge, and to crucify; and the third day he will be raised up.”

block.text: Dan mereka akan menyerahkan Dia kepada bangsa-bangsa yang tidak mengenal Allah, supaya Ia diolok-olokkan, disesah dan disalibkan, dan pada hari ketiga Ia akan dibangkitkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, worshipping him and asking a certain thing of him.
He said to her,

block.text: Maka datanglah ibu anak-anak Zebedeus serta anak-anaknya itu kepada Yesus, lalu sujud di hadapan-Nya untuk meminta sesuatu kepada-Nya.
Kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want?”

block.text: <<Apa yang kaukehendaki?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said to him,

block.text: Jawabnya:

block.characterId: mother of the sons of Zebedee (James and John)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: mother of the sons of Zebedee (James and John)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Command that these, my two sons, may sit, one on your right hand, and one on your left hand, in your Kingdom.”

block.text: <<Berilah perintah, supaya kedua anakku ini boleh duduk kelak di dalam Kerajaan-Mu, yang seorang di sebelah kanan-Mu dan yang seorang lagi di sebelah kiri-Mu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus answered,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus menjawab, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”

block.text: <<Kamu tidak tahu, apa yang kamu minta. Dapatkah kamu meminum cawan, yang harus Kuminum?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are able.”

block.text: <<Kami dapat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You will indeed drink my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with, but to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it is for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”

block.text: <<Cawan-Ku memang akan kamu minum, tetapi hal duduk di sebelah kanan-Ku atau di sebelah kiri-Ku, Aku tidak berhak memberikannya. Itu akan diberikan kepada orang-orang bagi siapa Bapa-Ku telah menyediakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the ten heard it, they were indignant with the two brothers.

block.text: Mendengar itu marahlah kesepuluh murid yang lain kepada kedua saudara itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus summoned them, and said,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus memanggil mereka lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

block.text: <<Kamu tahu, bahwa pemerintah-pemerintah bangsa-bangsa memerintah rakyatnya dengan tangan besi dan pembesar-pembesar menjalankan kuasanya dengan keras atas mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It shall not be so among you, but whoever desires to become great among you shall be your servant.

block.text: Tidaklah demikian di antara kamu. Barangsiapa ingin menjadi besar di antara kamu, hendaklah ia menjadi pelayanmu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever desires to be first among you shall be your bondservant.

block.text: dan barangsiapa ingin menjadi terkemuka di antara kamu, hendaklah ia menjadi hambamu;

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

block.text: sama seperti Anak Manusia datang bukan untuk dilayani, melainkan untuk melayani dan untuk memberikan nyawa-Nya menjadi tebusan bagi banyak orang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went out from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.

block.text: Dan ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya keluar dari Yerikho, orang banyak berbondong-bondong mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out,

block.text: Ada dua orang buta yang duduk di pinggir jalan mendengar, bahwa Yesus lewat, lalu mereka berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!”

block.text: <<Tuhan, Anak Daud, kasihanilah kami!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude rebuked them, saying:

block.text: Tetapi orang banyak itu menegor mereka, dengan mengatakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet!”

block.text: "Diam!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: but they cried out even louder,

block.text: Tetapi mereka berteriak lebih keras:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!”

block.text: <<Tuhan, Anak Daud, kasihanilah kami!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus stood still, and called them, and asked,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berhenti dan memanggil mereka. Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do for you?”

block.text: <<Apa yang kamu kehendaki supaya Aku perbuat bagimu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, that our eyes may be opened.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, supaya mata kami dapat melihat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, being moved with compassion, touched their eyes; and immediately their eyes received their sight, and they followed him.

block.text: Maka tergeraklah hati Yesus oleh belas kasihan, lalu Ia menjamah mata mereka dan seketika itu juga mereka melihat lalu mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 21
When they drew near to Jerusalem, and came to Bethsphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
saying to them,

block.text: Ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya telah dekat Yerusalem dan tiba di Betfage yang terletak di Bukit Zaitun, Yesus menyuruh dua orang murid-Nya
dengan pesan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go into the village that is opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Untie them, and bring them to me.

block.text: <<Pergilah ke kampung yang di depanmu itu, dan di situ kamu akan segera menemukan seekor keledai betina tertambat dan anaknya ada dekatnya. Lepaskanlah keledai itu dan bawalah keduanya kepada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and immediately he will send them.”

block.text: Dan jikalau ada orang menegor kamu, katakanlah: Tuhan memerlukannya. Ia akan segera mengembalikannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying,

block.text: Hal itu terjadi supaya genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell the daughter of Zion, behold, your King comes to you, humble, and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.”

block.text: <<Katakanlah kepada puteri Sion: <Lihat, Rajamu datang kepadamu, Ia lemah lembut dan mengendarai seekor keledai, seekor keledai beban yang muda.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples went, and did just as Jesus commanded them.

block.text: Maka pergilah murid-murid itu dan berbuat seperti yang ditugaskan Yesus kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought the donkey and the colt, and laid their clothes on them; and he sat on them.

block.text: Mereka membawa keledai betina itu bersama anaknya, lalu mengalasinya dengan pakaian mereka dan Yesuspun naik ke atasnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A very great multitude spread their clothes on the road. Others cut branches from the trees, and spread them on the road.

block.text: Orang banyak yang sangat besar jumlahnya menghamparkan pakaiannya di jalan, ada pula yang memotong ranting-ranting dari pohon-pohon dan menyebarkannya di jalan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitudes who went before him, and who followed kept shouting,

block.text: Dan orang banyak yang berjalan di depan Yesus dan yang mengikuti-Nya dari belakang berseru, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

block.text: <<Hosana bagi Anak Daud, diberkatilah Dia yang datang dalam nama Tuhan, hosana di tempat yang mahatinggi!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred up, saying,

block.text: Dan ketika Ia masuk ke Yerusalem, gemparlah seluruh kota itu dan orang berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is this?”

block.text: <<Siapakah orang ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitudes said,

block.text: Dan orang banyak itu menyahut:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.”

block.text: " <<Inilah nabi Yesus dari Nazaret di Galilea.>> "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus entered into the temple of God, and drove out all of those who sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables and the seats of those who sold the doves.
He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Yesus masuk ke Bait Allah dan mengusir semua orang yang berjual beli di halaman Bait Allah. Ia membalikkan meja-meja penukar uang dan bangku-bangku pedagang merpati
dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a den of robbers!”

block.text: <<Ada tertulis: <Rumah-Ku akan disebut rumah doa. Tetapi kamu menjadikannya sarang penyamun.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The blind and the lame came to him in the temple, and he healed them.

block.text: Maka datanglah orang-orang buta dan orang-orang timpang kepada-Nya dalam Bait Allah itu dan mereka disembuhkan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children who were crying out in the temple and saying,

block.text: Tetapi ketika imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat melihat mujizat-mujizat yang dibuat-Nya itu dan anak-anak yang berseru dalam Bait Allah:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hosanna to the son of David!”

block.text: <<Hosana bagi Anak Daud!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: they were indignant,
and said to him,

block.text: hati mereka sangat jengkel,
lalu mereka berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you hear what these are saying?”

block.text: <<Engkau dengar apa yang dikatakan anak-anak ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes. Did you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of babes and nursing babies you have perfected praise?’”

block.text: <<Aku dengar; belum pernahkah kamu baca: <Dari mulut bayi-bayi dan anak-anak yang menyusu Engkau telah menyediakan puji-pujian?> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He left them, and went out of the city to Bethany, and lodged there.

block.text: Lalu Ia meninggalkan mereka dan pergi ke luar kota ke Betania dan bermalam di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in the morning, as he returned to the city, he was hungry.

block.text: Pada pagi-pagi hari dalam perjalanan-Nya kembali ke kota, Yesus merasa lapar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he came to it, and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to it,

block.text: Dekat jalan Ia melihat pohon ara lalu pergi ke situ, tetapi Ia tidak mendapat apa-apa pada pohon itu selain daun-daun saja. Kata-Nya kepada pohon itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let there be no fruit from you forever!”

block.text: <<Engkau tidak akan berbuah lagi selama-lamanya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the fig tree withered away.
When the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying,

block.text: Dan seketika itu juga keringlah pohon ara itu.
Melihat kejadian itu tercenganglah murid-murid-Nya, lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How did the fig tree immediately wither away?”

block.text: <<Bagaimana mungkin pohon ara itu sekonyong-konyong menjadi kering?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Yesus menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, if you have faith, and don’t doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it would be done.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya jika kamu percaya dan tidak bimbang, kamu bukan saja akan dapat berbuat apa yang Kuperbuat dengan pohon ara itu, tetapi juga jikalau kamu berkata kepada gunung ini: <Beranjaklah dan tercampaklah ke dalam laut!> hal itu akan terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things, whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”

block.text: Dan apa saja yang kamu minta dalam doa dengan penuh kepercayaan, kamu akan menerimanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him as he was teaching, and said,

block.text: Lalu Yesus masuk ke Bait Allah, dan ketika Ia mengajar di situ, datanglah imam-imam kepala serta tua-tua bangsa Yahudi kepada-Nya, dan bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “By what authority do you do these things? Who gave you this authority?”

block.text: <<Dengan kuasa manakah Engkau melakukan hal-hal itu? Dan siapakah yang memberikan kuasa itu kepada-Mu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I also will ask you one question. If you tell me, I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

block.text: <<Aku juga akan mengajukan satu pertanyaan kepadamu dan jikalau kamu memberi jawabnya kepada-Ku, Aku akan mengatakan juga kepadamu dengan kuasa manakah Aku melakukan hal-hal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The baptism of John, where was it from? From heaven or from men?”

block.text: Dari manakah baptisan Yohanes? Dari sorga atau dari manusia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying,

block.text: Mereka memperbincangkannya di antara mereka, dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

block.text: <<Jikalau kita katakan: Dari sorga, Ia akan berkata kepada kita: Kalau begitu, mengapakah kamu tidak percaya kepadanya?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all hold John as a prophet.”

block.text: Tetapi jikalau kita katakan: Dari manusia, kita takut kepada orang banyak, sebab semua orang menganggap Yohanes ini nabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered Jesus, and said,

block.text: Lalu mereka menjawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don’t know.”

block.text: <<Kami tidak tahu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He also said to them,

block.text: Dan Yesuspun berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.

block.text: <<Jika demikian, Aku juga tidak mengatakan kepadamu dengan kuasa manakah Aku melakukan hal-hal itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first, and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’

block.text: <<Tetapi apakah pendapatmu tentang ini: Seorang mempunyai dua anak laki-laki. Ia pergi kepada anak yang sulung dan berkata: <Anakku, pergi dan bekerjalah hari ini dalam kebun anggur.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he changed his mind, and went.

block.text: Jawab anak itu: <Baik, bapa.> Tetapi ia tidak pergi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to the second, and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I go, sir,’ but he didn’t go.

block.text: Lalu orang itu pergi kepada anak yang kedua dan berkata demikian juga. Dan anak itu menjawab: <Aku tidak mau.> Tetapi kemudian ia menyesal lalu pergi juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which one of the two did the will of his father?”

block.text: Siapakah di antara kedua orang itu yang melakukan kehendak ayahnya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The first.”

block.text: <<Yang terakhir.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering into the Kingdom of God before you.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya pemungut-pemungut cukai dan perempuan-perempuan sundal akan mendahului kamu masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you didn’t believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. When you saw it, you didn’t even repent afterward, that you might believe him.”

block.text: Sebab Yohanes datang untuk menunjukkan jalan kebenaran kepadamu, dan kamu tidak percaya kepadanya. Tetapi pemungut-pemungut cukai dan perempuan-perempuan sundal percaya kepadanya. Dan meskipun kamu melihatnya, tetapi kemudian kamu tidak menyesal dan kamu tidak juga percaya kepadanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household, who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a winepress in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.

block.text: <<Dengarkanlah suatu perumpamaan yang lain. Adalah seorang tuan tanah membuka kebun anggur dan menanam pagar sekelilingnya. Ia menggali lobang tempat memeras anggur dan mendirikan menara jaga di dalam kebun itu. Kemudian ia menyewakan kebun itu kepada penggarap-penggarap lalu berangkat ke negeri lain.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the season for the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the farmers, to receive his fruit.

block.text: <<Ketika hampir tiba musim petik, ia menyuruh hamba-hambanya kepada penggarap-penggarap itu untuk menerima hasil yang menjadi bagiannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The farmers took his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

block.text: Tetapi penggarap-penggarap itu menangkap hamba-hambanya itu: mereka memukul yang seorang, membunuh yang lain dan melempari yang lain pula dengan batu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they treated them the same way.

block.text: Kemudian tuan itu menyuruh pula hamba-hamba yang lain, lebih banyak dari pada yang semula, tetapi merekapun diperlakukan sama seperti kawan-kawan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But afterward he sent to them his son, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

block.text: Akhirnya ia menyuruh anaknya kepada mereka, katanya: <Anakku akan mereka segani.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the farmers, when they saw the son, said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and seize his inheritance.’

block.text: Tetapi ketika penggarap-penggarap itu melihat anaknya itu, mereka berkata seorang kepada yang lain: <Ia adalah ahli waris, mari kita bunuh dia, supaya warisannya menjadi milik kita.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took him, and threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.

block.text: Mereka menangkapnya dan melemparkannya ke luar kebun anggur itu, lalu membunuhnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?”

block.text: Maka apabila tuan kebun anggur itu datang, apakah yang akan dilakukannya dengan penggarap-penggarap itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He will destroy those miserable men, and will lease out the vineyard to other farmers, who will give him the fruit in its season.”

block.text: <<Ia akan membinasakan orang-orang jahat itu dan kebun anggurnya akan disewakannya kepada penggarap-penggarap lain, yang akan menyerahkan hasilnya kepadanya pada waktunya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka: "

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Did you never read in the Scriptures, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner. This was from the Lord. It is marvelous in our eyes?’”

block.text: <<Belum pernahkah kamu baca dalam Kitab Suci: Batu yang dibuang oleh tukang-tukang bangunan telah menjadi batu penjuru: hal itu terjadi dari pihak Tuhan, suatu perbuatan ajaib di mata kita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore I tell you, the Kingdom of God will be taken away from you, and will be given to a nation bringing forth its fruit.

block.text: Sebab itu, Aku berkata kepadamu, bahwa Kerajaan Allah akan diambil dari padamu dan akan diberikan kepada suatu bangsa yang akan menghasilkan buah Kerajaan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it will fall, it will scatter him as dust.”

block.text: (Dan barangsiapa jatuh ke atas batu itu, ia akan hancur dan barangsiapa ditimpa batu itu, ia akan remuk.)>> "

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he spoke about them.

block.text: Ketika imam-imam kepala dan orang-orang Farisi mendengar perumpamaan-perumpamaan Yesus, mereka mengerti, bahwa merekalah yang dimaksudkan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they sought to seize him, they said:

block.text: Dan mereka berusaha untuk menangkap Dia, tetapi mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We fear the people because they think he is a prophet.”

block.text: takut kepada orang banyak, karena orang banyak itu menganggap Dia nabi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 22
Jesus answered and spoke again in parables to them, saying,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berbicara pula dalam perumpamaan kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who made a marriage feast for his son.

block.text: <<Hal Kerajaan Sorga seumpama seorang raja, yang mengadakan perjamuan kawin untuk anaknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the marriage feast, but they would not come.

block.text: Ia menyuruh hamba-hambanya memanggil orang-orang yang telah diundang ke perjamuan kawin itu, tetapi orang-orang itu tidak mau datang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he sent out other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who are invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner. My cattle and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready. Come to the marriage feast!”’”

block.text: Ia menyuruh pula hamba-hamba lain, pesannya: <Katakanlah kepada orang-orang yang diundang itu: Sesungguhnya hidangan, telah kusediakan, lembu-lembu jantan dan ternak piaraanku telah disembelih; semuanya telah tersedia, datanglah ke perjamuan kawin ini.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his own farm, another to his merchandise.

block.text: Tetapi orang-orang yang diundang itu tidak mengindahkannya; ada yang pergi ke ladangnya, ada yang pergi mengurus usahanya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The rest grabbed his servants, and treated them shamefully, and killed them.

block.text: dan yang lain menangkap hamba-hambanya itu, menyiksanya dan membunuhnya.>> <<

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the king heard that, he was angry, and sent his armies, destroyed those murderers, and burned their city.”

block.text: Maka murkalah raja itu, lalu menyuruh pasukannya ke sana untuk membinasakan pembunuh-pembunuh itu dan membakar kota mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited weren’t worthy.

block.text: Sesudah itu ia berkata kepada hamba-hambanya: Perjamuan kawin telah tersedia, tetapi orang-orang yang diundang tadi tidak layak untuk itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Go therefore to the intersections of the highways, and as many as you may find, invite to the marriage feast.’”

block.text: Sebab itu pergilah ke persimpangan-persimpangan jalan dan undanglah setiap orang yang kamu jumpai di sana ke perjamuan kawin itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together as many as they found, both bad and good. The wedding was filled with guests.

block.text: Maka pergilah hamba-hamba itu dan mereka mengumpulkan semua orang yang dijumpainya di jalan-jalan, orang-orang jahat dan orang-orang baik, sehingga penuhlah ruangan perjamuan kawin itu dengan tamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man who didn’t have on wedding clothing,

block.text: <<Ketika raja itu masuk untuk bertemu dengan tamu-tamu itu, ia melihat seorang yang tidak berpakaian pesta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here not wearing wedding clothing?’ He was speechless.

block.text: Ia berkata kepadanya: <Hai saudara, bagaimana engkau masuk ke mari dengan tidak mengenakan pakaian pesta?> Tetapi orang itu diam saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the king said to the servants, ‘Bind him hand and foot, take him away, and throw him into the outer darkness; there is where the weeping and grinding of teeth will be.’

block.text: Lalu kata raja itu kepada hamba-hambanya: <Ikatlah kaki dan tangannya dan campakkanlah orang itu ke dalam kegelapan yang paling gelap, di sanalah akan terdapat ratap dan kertak gigi.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For many are called, but few chosen.”

block.text: <<Sebab banyak yang dipanggil, tetapi sedikit yang dipilih.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the Pharisees went and took counsel how they might entrap him in his words.

block.text: Kemudian pergilah orang-orang Farisi; mereka berunding bagaimana mereka dapat menjerat Yesus dengan suatu pertanyaan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sent their disciples to him, along with the Herodians, saying,

block.text: Mereka menyuruh murid-murid mereka bersama-sama orang-orang Herodian bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and teach the way of God in truth, no matter whom you teach, for you aren’t partial to anyone.

block.text: <<Guru, kami tahu, Engkau adalah seorang yang jujur dan dengan jujur mengajar jalan Allah dan Engkau tidak takut kepada siapapun juga, sebab Engkau tidak mencari muka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Tell us therefore, what do you think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

block.text: Katakanlah kepada kami pendapat-Mu: Apakah diperbolehkan membayar pajak kepada Kaisar atau tidak?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mengetahui kejahatan hati mereka itu lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you test me, you hypocrites?
Show me the tax money.”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu mencobai Aku, hai orang-orang munafik?
Tunjukkanlah kepada-Ku mata uang untuk pajak itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought to him a denarius.
He asked them,

block.text: Mereka membawa suatu dinar kepada-Nya.
Maka Ia bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whose is this image and inscription?”

block.text: <<Gambar dan tulisan siapakah ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Caesar’s.”

block.text: <<Gambar dan tulisan Kaisar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

block.text: <<Berikanlah kepada Kaisar apa yang wajib kamu berikan kepada Kaisar dan kepada Allah apa yang wajib kamu berikan kepada Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard it, they marveled, and left him, and went away.

block.text: Mendengar itu heranlah mereka dan meninggalkan Yesus lalu pergi. "

ReferenceBlocks.text: On that day Sadducees (those who say that there is no resurrection) came to him. They asked him,
saying,

block.text: Pada hari itu datanglah kepada Yesus beberapa orang Saduki, yang berpendapat, bahwa tidak ada kebangkitan. Mereka bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed for his brother.’

block.text: <<Guru, Musa mengatakan, bahwa jika seorang mati dengan tiada meninggalkan anak, saudaranya harus kawin dengan isterinya itu dan membangkitkan keturunan bagi saudaranya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there were with us seven brothers. The first married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.

block.text: Tetapi di antara kami ada tujuh orang bersaudara. Yang pertama kawin, tetapi kemudian mati. Dan karena ia tidak mempunyai keturunan, ia meninggalkan isterinya itu bagi saudaranya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way, the second also, and the third, to the seventh.

block.text: Demikian juga yang kedua dan yang ketiga sampai dengan yang ketujuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After them all, the woman died.

block.text: Dan akhirnya, sesudah mereka semua, perempuan itupun mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the resurrection therefore, whose wife will she be of the seven? For they all had her.”

block.text: Siapakah di antara ketujuh orang itu yang menjadi suami perempuan itu pada hari kebangkitan? Sebab mereka semua telah beristerikan dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus answered them,

block.text: Yesus menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God.

block.text: <<Kamu sesat, sebab kamu tidak mengerti Kitab Suci maupun kuasa Allah!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like God’s angels in heaven.

block.text: Karena pada waktu kebangkitan orang tidak kawin dan tidak dikawinkan melainkan hidup seperti malaikat di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, haven’t you read that which was spoken to you by God when He said:

block.text: Tetapi tentang kebangkitan orang-orang mati tidakkah kamu baca apa yang difirmankan Allah, ketika Ia bersabda:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?’ God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”

block.text: <Akulah Allah Abraham, Allah Ishak dan Allah Yakub? Ia bukanlah Allah orang mati, melainkan Allah orang hidup.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.

block.text: Orang banyak yang mendengar itu takjub akan pengajaran-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees, when they heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, gathered themselves together.

block.text: Ketika orang-orang Farisi mendengar, bahwa Yesus telah membuat orang-orang Saduki itu bungkam, berkumpullah mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of them, a lawyer, asked him a question, testing him.

block.text: dan seorang dari mereka, seorang ahli Taurat, bertanya untuk mencobai Dia: "

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?”

block.text: <<Guru, hukum manakah yang terutama dalam hukum Taurat?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’

block.text: << <Kasihilah Tuhan, Allahmu, dengan segenap hatimu dan dengan segenap jiwamu dan dengan segenap akal budimu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the first and great commandment.

block.text: Itulah hukum yang terutama dan yang pertama.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A second likewise is this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’

block.text: Dan hukum yang kedua, yang sama dengan itu, ialah: <Kasihilah sesamamu manusia seperti dirimu sendiri.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The whole law and the prophets depend on these two commandments.”

block.text: Pada kedua hukum inilah tergantung seluruh hukum Taurat dan kitab para nabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now while the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question,
saying,

block.text: Ketika orang-orang Farisi sedang berkumpul, Yesus bertanya kepada mereka, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you think of the Christ? Whose son is he?”

block.text: <<Apakah pendapatmu tentang Mesias? Anak siapakah Dia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Of David.”

block.text: <<Anak Daud.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How then does David in the Spirit call him Lord, saying,

block.text: <<Jika demikian, bagaimanakah Daud oleh pimpinan Roh dapat menyebut Dia <Tuannya,> ketika ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, sit on my right hand, until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet?’”

block.text: <Tuhan telah berfirman kepada Tuanku: <<duduklah di sebelah kanan-Ku, sampai musuh-musuh-Mu Kutaruh di bawah kaki-Mu.>> >

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If then David calls him Lord, how is he his son?”

block.text: Jadi jika Daud menyebut Dia <Tuannya,> bagaimana mungkin Ia anaknya pula?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one was able to answer him a word, neither did any man dare ask him any more questions from that day forth.

block.text: Tidak ada seorangpun yang dapat menjawab-Nya, dan sejak hari itu tidak ada seorangpun juga yang berani menanyakan sesuatu kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 23
Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to his disciples,
saying,

block.text: Maka berkatalah Yesus kepada orang banyak dan kepada murid-murid-Nya, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The scribes and the Pharisees sat on Moses’ seat.

block.text: <<Ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi telah menduduki kursi Musa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things therefore whatever they tell you to observe, observe and do, but don’t do their works; for they say, and don’t do.

block.text: Sebab itu turutilah dan lakukanlah segala sesuatu yang mereka ajarkan kepadamu, tetapi janganlah kamu turuti perbuatan-perbuatan mereka, karena mereka mengajarkannya tetapi tidak melakukannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they bind heavy burdens that are grievous to be borne, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves will not lift a finger to help them.

block.text: Mereka mengikat beban-beban berat, lalu meletakkannya di atas bahu orang, tetapi mereka sendiri tidak mau menyentuhnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But all their works they do to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad, enlarge the fringes of their garments.

block.text: Semua pekerjaan yang mereka lakukan hanya dimaksud supaya dilihat orang; mereka memakai tali sembahyang yang lebar dan jumbai yang panjang;

ReferenceBlocks.text: They love the place of honor at feasts, and the best seats in the synagogues.

block.text: mereka suka duduk di tempat terhormat dalam perjamuan dan di tempat terdepan di rumah ibadat;

ReferenceBlocks.text: They love to be greeted in the marketplaces, and to be called ‘Rabbi, Rabbi’ by men.

block.text: mereka suka menerima penghormatan di pasar dan suka dipanggil Rabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But don’t you be called ‘Rabbi,’ for one is your teacher, the Christ, and all of you are brothers.

block.text: Tetapi kamu, janganlah kamu disebut Rabi; karena hanya satu Rabimu dan kamu semua adalah saudara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Call no man on the earth your father, for one is your Father, he who is in heaven.

block.text: Dan janganlah kamu menyebut siapapun bapa di bumi ini, karena hanya satu Bapamu, yaitu Dia yang di sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither be called masters, for one is your master, the Christ.

block.text: Janganlah pula kamu disebut pemimpin, karena hanya satu Pemimpinmu, yaitu Mesias.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who is greatest among you will be your servant.

block.text: Barangsiapa terbesar di antara kamu, hendaklah ia menjadi pelayanmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.”

block.text: Dan barangsiapa meninggikan diri, ia akan direndahkan dan barangsiapa merendahkan diri, ia akan ditinggikan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour widows’ houses, and as a pretense you make long prayers. Therefore you will receive greater damnation.”

block.text: <<Celakalah kamu, hai ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi, hai kamu orang-orang munafik, karena kamu menutup pintu-pintu Kerajaan Sorga di depan orang. Sebab kamu sendiri tidak masuk dan kamu merintangi mereka yang berusaha untuk masuk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you shut up the Kingdom of Heaven against men; for you don’t enter in yourselves, neither do you allow those who are entering in to enter.

block.text: (Celakalah kamu, hai ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi, hai kamu orang-orang munafik, sebab kamu menelan rumah janda-janda sedang kamu mengelabui mata orang dengan doa yang panjang-panjang. Sebab itu kamu pasti akan menerima hukuman yang lebih berat.)>> "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel around by sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much of a son of Gehenna as yourselves.”

block.text: <<Celakalah kamu, hai ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi, hai kamu orang-orang munafik, sebab kamu mengarungi lautan dan menjelajah daratan, untuk mentobatkan satu orang saja menjadi penganut agamamu dan sesudah ia bertobat, kamu menjadikan dia orang neraka, yang dua kali lebih jahat dari pada kamu sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, you blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.’

block.text: <<Celakalah kamu, hai pemimpin-pemimpin buta, yang berkata: <Bersumpah demi Bait Suci, sumpah itu tidak sah; tetapi bersumpah demi emas Bait Suci, sumpah itu mengikat.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: You blind fools! For which is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifies the gold?

block.text: Hai kamu orang-orang bodoh dan orang-orang buta, apakah yang lebih penting, emas atau Bait Suci yang menguduskan emas itu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obligated?’

block.text: Bersumpah demi mezbah, sumpah itu tidak sah; tetapi bersumpah demi persembahan yang ada di atasnya, sumpah itu mengikat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: You blind fools! For which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifies the gift?

block.text: <<Hai kamu orang-orang buta, apakah yang lebih penting, persembahan atau mezbah yang menguduskan persembahan itu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He therefore who swears by the altar, swears by it, and by everything on it.

block.text: Karena itu barangsiapa bersumpah demi mezbah, ia bersumpah demi mezbah dan juga demi segala sesuatu yang terletak di atasnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who swears by the temple, swears by it, and by him who was living in it.

block.text: Dan barangsiapa bersumpah demi Bait Suci, ia bersumpah demi Bait Suci dan juga demi Dia, yang diam di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God, and by the one who sits on it.”

block.text: Dan barangsiapa bersumpah demi sorga, ia bersumpah demi takhta Allah dan juga demi Dia, yang bersemayam di atasnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint, dill, and cumin, and have left undone the weightier matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faith. But you ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.

block.text: <<Celakalah kamu, hai ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi, hai kamu orang-orang munafik, sebab persepuluhan dari selasih, adas manis dan jintan kamu bayar, tetapi yang terpenting dalam hukum Taurat kamu abaikan, yaitu: keadilan dan belas kasihan dan kesetiaan. Yang satu harus dilakukan dan yang lain jangan diabaikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You blind guides, who strain out a gnat, and swallow a camel!”

block.text: Hai kamu pemimpin-pemimpin buta, nyamuk kamu tapiskan dari dalam minumanmu, tetapi unta yang di dalamnya kamu telan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and unrighteousness.”

block.text: <<Celakalah kamu, hai ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi, hai kamu orang-orang munafik, sebab cawan dan pinggan kamu bersihkan sebelah luarnya, tetapi sebelah dalamnya penuh rampasan dan kerakusan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You blind Pharisee, first clean the inside of the cup and of the platter, that its outside may become clean also.”

block.text: Hai orang Farisi yang buta, bersihkanlah dahulu sebelah dalam cawan itu, maka sebelah luarnya juga akan bersih.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitened tombs, which outwardly appear beautiful, but inwardly are full of dead men’s bones, and of all uncleanness.

block.text: <<Celakalah kamu, hai ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi, hai kamu orang-orang munafik, sebab kamu sama seperti kuburan yang dilabur putih, yang sebelah luarnya memang bersih tampaknya, tetapi yang sebelah dalamnya penuh tulang belulang dan pelbagai jenis kotoran.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.”

block.text: Demikian jugalah kamu, di sebelah luar kamu tampaknya benar di mata orang, tetapi di sebelah dalam kamu penuh kemunafikan dan kedurjanaan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and decorate the tombs of the righteous.

block.text: <<Celakalah kamu, hai ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi, hai kamu orang-orang munafik, sebab kamu membangun makam nabi-nabi dan memperindah tugu orang-orang saleh

ReferenceBlocks.text: You say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we wouldn’t have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.’

block.text: dan berkata: <Jika kami hidup di zaman nenek moyang kita, tentulah kami tidak ikut dengan mereka dalam pembunuhan nabi-nabi itu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore you testify to yourselves that you are children of those who killed the prophets.

block.text: Tetapi dengan demikian kamu bersaksi terhadap diri kamu sendiri, bahwa kamu adalah keturunan pembunuh nabi-nabi itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers.

block.text: Jadi, penuhilah juga takaran nenek moyangmu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: You serpents, you offspring of vipers, how will you escape the judgment of Gehenna?

block.text: <<Hai kamu ular-ular, hai kamu keturunan ular beludak! Bagaimanakah mungkin kamu dapat meluputkan diri dari hukuman neraka?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore behold, I send to you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify; and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city.

block.text: Sebab itu, lihatlah, Aku mengutus kepadamu nabi-nabi, orang-orang bijaksana dan ahli-ahli Taurat: separuh di antara mereka akan kamu bunuh dan kamu salibkan, yang lain akan kamu sesah di rumah-rumah ibadatmu dan kamu aniaya dari kota ke kota,
