ReferenceBlocks.text: And so on you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you killed between the sanctuary and the altar.

block.text: supaya kamu menanggung akibat penumpahan darah orang yang tidak bersalah mulai dari Habel, orang benar itu, sampai kepada Zakharia anak Berekhya, yang kamu bunuh di antara tempat kudus dan mezbah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, all these things will come upon this generation.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya semuanya ini akan ditanggung angkatan ini!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I would have gathered your children together, even as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you would not!

block.text: <<Yerusalem, Yerusalem, engkau yang membunuh nabi-nabi dan melempari dengan batu orang-orang yang diutus kepadamu! Berkali-kali Aku rindu mengumpulkan anak-anakmu, sama seperti induk ayam mengumpulkan anak-anaknya di bawah sayapnya, tetapi kamu tidak mau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate.

block.text: Lihatlah rumahmu ini akan ditinggalkan dan menjadi sunyi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I tell you, you will not see me from now on, until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”

block.text: Dan Aku berkata kepadamu: Mulai sekarang kamu tidak akan melihat Aku lagi, hingga kamu berkata: <Diberkatilah Dia yang datang dalam nama Tuhan!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 24
Jesus went out from the temple, and was going on his way. His disciples came to him and said:

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus keluar dari Bait Allah, lalu pergi. Murid-murid-Nya datang kepadanya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, look at all these magnificent buildings.”

block.text: "Guru, lihatlah semua bangunan megah."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You see all of these things, don’t you? Most certainly I tell you, there will not be left here one stone on another, that will not be thrown down.”

block.text: <<Kamu melihat semuanya itu? Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya tidak satu batupun di sini akan dibiarkan terletak di atas batu yang lain; semuanya akan diruntuhkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying,

block.text: Ketika Yesus duduk di atas Bukit Zaitun, datanglah murid-murid-Nya kepada-Nya untuk bercakap-cakap sendirian dengan Dia. Kata mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign of your coming, and of the end of the age?”

block.text: <<Katakanlah kepada kami, bilamanakah itu akan terjadi dan apakah tanda kedatangan-Mu dan tanda kesudahan dunia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be careful that no one leads you astray.

block.text: <<Waspadalah supaya jangan ada orang yang menyesatkan kamu!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will lead many astray.

block.text: Sebab banyak orang akan datang dengan memakai nama-Ku dan berkata: <Akulah Mesias,> dan mereka akan menyesatkan banyak orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you aren’t troubled, for all this must happen, but the end is not yet.

block.text: Kamu akan mendengar deru perang atau kabar-kabar tentang perang. Namun berawas-awaslah jangan kamu gelisah; sebab semuanya itu harus terjadi, tetapi itu belum kesudahannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there will be famines, plagues, and earthquakes in various places.

block.text: Sebab bangsa akan bangkit melawan bangsa, dan kerajaan melawan kerajaan. Akan ada kelaparan dan gempa bumi di berbagai tempat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But all these things are the beginning of birth pains.

block.text: Akan tetapi semuanya itu barulah permulaan penderitaan menjelang zaman baru.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will deliver you up to oppression, and will kill you. You will be hated by all of the nations for my name’s sake.

block.text: <<Pada waktu itu kamu akan diserahkan supaya disiksa, dan kamu akan dibunuh dan akan dibenci semua bangsa oleh karena nama-Ku,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then many will stumble, and will deliver up one another, and will hate one another.

block.text: dan banyak orang akan murtad dan mereka akan saling menyerahkan dan saling membenci.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many false prophets will arise, and will lead many astray.

block.text: Banyak nabi palsu akan muncul dan menyesatkan banyak orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because iniquity will be multiplied, the love of many will grow cold.

block.text: Dan karena makin bertambahnya kedurhakaan, maka kasih kebanyakan orang akan menjadi dingin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who endures to the end will be saved.

block.text: Tetapi orang yang bertahan sampai pada kesudahannya akan selamat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This Good News of the Kingdom will be preached in the whole world for a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.”

block.text: Dan Injil Kerajaan ini akan diberitakan di seluruh dunia menjadi kesaksian bagi semua bangsa, sesudah itu barulah tiba kesudahannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When, therefore, you see the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),

block.text: <<Jadi apabila kamu melihat <Pembinasa keji berdiri di tempat kudus,> menurut firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi Daniel--para pembaca hendaklah memperhatikannya--

ReferenceBlocks.text: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

block.text: maka orang-orang yang di Yudea haruslah melarikan diri ke pegunungan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take out things that are in his house.

block.text: Orang yang sedang di peranginan di atas rumah janganlah ia turun untuk mengambil barang-barang dari rumahnya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let him who is in the field not return back to get his clothes.

block.text: dan orang yang sedang di ladang janganlah ia kembali untuk mengambil pakaiannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But woe to those who are with child and to nursing mothers in those days!

block.text: Celakalah ibu-ibu yang sedang hamil atau yang menyusukan bayi pada masa itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pray that your flight will not be in the winter, nor on a Sabbath.

block.text: <<Berdoalah, supaya waktu kamu melarikan diri itu jangan jatuh pada musim dingin dan jangan pada hari Sabat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For then there will be great oppression, such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now, no, nor ever will be.

block.text: Sebab pada masa itu akan terjadi siksaan yang dahsyat seperti yang belum pernah terjadi sejak awal dunia sampai sekarang dan yang tidak akan terjadi lagi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Unless those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved. But for the sake of the chosen ones, those days will be shortened.”

block.text: Dan sekiranya waktunya tidak dipersingkat, maka dari segala yang hidup tidak akan ada yang selamat; akan tetapi oleh karena orang-orang pilihan waktu itu akan dipersingkat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then if anyone tells you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ,’ or, ‘There,’ don’t believe it.

block.text: <<Pada waktu itu jika orang berkata kepada kamu: <Lihat, Mesias ada di sini,> atau <Mesias ada di sana,> jangan kamu percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there will arise false christs, and false prophets, and they will show great signs and wonders, so as to lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.”

block.text: Sebab Mesias-mesias palsu dan nabi-nabi palsu akan muncul dan mereka akan mengadakan tanda-tanda yang dahsyat dan mujizat-mujizat, sehingga sekiranya mungkin, mereka menyesatkan orang-orang pilihan juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I have told you beforehand.

block.text: Camkanlah, Aku sudah mengatakannya terlebih dahulu kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore they tell you, ‘Behold, he is in the wilderness,’ don’t go out; ‘Behold, he is in the inner rooms,’ don’t believe it.

block.text: <<Jadi, apabila orang berkata kepadamu: <Lihat, Ia ada di padang gurun,> janganlah kamu pergi ke situ; atau: <Lihat, Ia ada di dalam bilik,> janganlah kamu percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as the lightning flashes from the east, and is seen even to the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

block.text: Sebab sama seperti kilat memancar dari sebelah timur dan melontarkan cahayanya sampai ke barat, demikian pulalah kelak kedatangan Anak Manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For wherever the carcass is, there is where the vultures gather together.

block.text: Di mana ada bangkai, di situ burung nazar berkerumun.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But immediately after the oppression of those days, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light, the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

block.text: <<Segera sesudah siksaan pada masa itu, <matahari akan menjadi gelap dan bulan tidak bercahaya dan bintang-bintang akan berjatuhan dari langit dan kuasa-kuasa langit akan goncang.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. Then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory.

block.text: Pada waktu itu akan tampak tanda Anak Manusia di langit dan semua bangsa di bumi akan meratap dan mereka akan melihat Anak Manusia itu datang di atas awan-awan di langit dengan segala kekuasaan dan kemuliaan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will send out his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from one end of the sky to the other.”

block.text: Dan Ia akan menyuruh keluar malaikat-malaikat-Nya dengan meniup sangkakala yang dahsyat bunyinya dan mereka akan mengumpulkan orang-orang pilihan-Nya dari keempat penjuru bumi, dari ujung langit yang satu ke ujung langit yang lain.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now from the fig tree learn this parable. When its branch has now become tender, and puts forth its leaves, you know that the summer is near.

block.text: <<Tariklah pelajaran dari perumpamaan tentang pohon ara: Apabila ranting-rantingnya melembut dan mulai bertunas, kamu tahu, bahwa musim panas sudah dekat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also, when you see all these things, know that it is near, even at the doors.

block.text: Demikian juga, jika kamu melihat semuanya ini, ketahuilah, bahwa waktunya sudah dekat, sudah di ambang pintu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away, until all these things are accomplished.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya angkatan ini tidak akan berlalu, sebelum semuanya ini terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

block.text: Langit dan bumi akan berlalu, tetapi perkataan-Ku tidak akan berlalu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But no one knows of that day and hour, not even the angels of heaven, but my Father only.”

block.text: <<Tetapi tentang hari dan saat itu tidak seorangpun yang tahu, malaikat-malaikat di sorga tidak, dan Anakpun tidak, hanya Bapa sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As the days of Noah were, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

block.text: <<Sebab sebagaimana halnya pada zaman Nuh, demikian pula halnya kelak pada kedatangan Anak Manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as in those days which were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship,

block.text: Sebab sebagaimana mereka pada zaman sebelum air bah itu makan dan minum, kawin dan mengawinkan, sampai kepada hari Nuh masuk ke dalam bahtera,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and they didn’t know until the flood came, and took them all away, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

block.text: dan mereka tidak tahu akan sesuatu, sebelum air bah itu datang dan melenyapkan mereka semua, demikian pulalah halnya kelak pada kedatangan Anak Manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then two men will be in the field: one will be taken and one will be left.

block.text: Pada waktu itu kalau ada dua orang di ladang, yang seorang akan dibawa dan yang lain akan ditinggalkan;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Two women grinding at the mill, one will be taken and one will be left.

block.text: kalau ada dua orang perempuan sedang memutar batu kilangan, yang seorang akan dibawa dan yang lain akan ditinggalkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know in what hour your Lord comes.

block.text: <<Karena itu berjaga-jagalah, sebab kamu tidak tahu pada hari mana Tuhanmu datang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch of the night the thief was coming, he would have watched, and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.

block.text: <<Tetapi ketahuilah ini: Jika tuan rumah tahu pada waktu mana pada malam hari pencuri akan datang, sudahlah pasti ia berjaga-jaga, dan tidak akan membiarkan rumahnya dibongkar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore also be ready, for in an hour that you don’t expect, the Son of Man will come.”

block.text: Sebab itu, hendaklah kamu juga siap sedia, karena Anak Manusia datang pada saat yang tidak kamu duga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom his lord has set over his household, to give them their food in due season?

block.text: <<Siapakah hamba yang setia dan bijaksana, yang diangkat oleh tuannya atas orang-orangnya untuk memberikan mereka makanan pada waktunya?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord finds doing so when he comes.

block.text: Berbahagialah hamba, yang didapati tuannya melakukan tugasnya itu, ketika tuannya itu datang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you that he will set him over all that he has.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya tuannya itu akan mengangkat dia menjadi pengawas segala miliknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if that servant is evil, he will say in his heart, ‘My lord is delaying his coming.’

block.text: Akan tetapi apabila hamba itu jahat dan berkata di dalam hatinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he will begin to beat his fellow servants, and eat and drink with the drunkards.

block.text: <Tuanku tidak datang-datang,> lalu ia mulai memukul hamba-hamba lain, dan makan minum bersama-sama pemabuk-pemabuk,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he doesn’t expect it, and in an hour when he doesn’t know it.

block.text: maka tuan hamba itu akan datang pada hari yang tidak disangkakannya, dan pada saat yang tidak diketahuinya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will cut him in pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.”

block.text: dan akan membunuh dia dan membuat dia senasib dengan orang-orang munafik. Di sanalah akan terdapat ratapan dan kertakan gigi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 25
“Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went out to meet the bridegroom.

block.text: <<Pada waktu itu hal Kerajaan Sorga seumpama sepuluh gadis, yang mengambil pelitanya dan pergi menyongsong mempelai laki-laki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

block.text: Lima di antaranya bodoh dan lima bijaksana.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were foolish took their lamps with them but took no oil.

block.text: Gadis-gadis yang bodoh itu membawa pelitanya, tetapi tidak membawa minyak,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The wise took oil in their vessels along with their lamps.

block.text: sedangkan gadis-gadis yang bijaksana itu membawa pelitanya dan juga minyak dalam buli-buli mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now while the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.

block.text: Tetapi karena mempelai itu lama tidak datang-datang juga, mengantuklah mereka semua lalu tertidur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But at midnight there was a cry, ‘Behold! The bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!’

block.text: Waktu tengah malam terdengarlah suara orang berseru: <Mempelai datang! Songsonglah dia!>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

block.text: Gadis-gadis itupun bangun semuanya lalu membereskan pelita mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.’

block.text: <<Gadis-gadis yang bodoh berkata kepada gadis-gadis yang bijaksana: <Berikanlah kami sedikit dari minyakmu itu, sebab pelita kami hampir padam.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the wise answered, saying, ‘What if there isn’t enough oil for us and you? You go rather to those who sell oil, and buy some for yourselves.’

block.text: Tetapi jawab gadis-gadis yang bijaksana itu: <Tidak, nanti tidak cukup untuk kami dan untuk kamu. Lebih baik kamu pergi kepada penjual minyak dan beli di situ.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While they went away to buy more oil, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the marriage feast, and the door was shut.

block.text: Akan tetapi, waktu mereka sedang pergi untuk membelinya, datanglah mempelai itu dan mereka yang telah siap sedia masuk bersama-sama dengan dia ke ruang perjamuan kawin, lalu pintu ditutup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward the other virgins also came, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us.’

block.text: Kemudian datang juga gadis-gadis yang lain itu dan berkata: <Tuan, tuan, bukakanlah kami pintu!>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered, ‘Most certainly I tell you, I don’t know you.’

block.text: Tetapi ia menjawab: <Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya aku tidak mengenal kamu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.”

block.text: Karena itu, berjaga-jagalah, sebab kamu tidak tahu akan hari maupun akan saatnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For it is like a man, going into another country, who called his own servants, and entrusted his goods to them.

block.text: <<Sebab hal Kerajaan Sorga sama seperti seorang yang mau bepergian ke luar negeri, yang memanggil hamba-hambanya dan mempercayakan hartanya kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.

block.text: Yang seorang diberikannya lima talenta, yang seorang lagi dua dan yang seorang lain lagi satu, masing-masing menurut kesanggupannya, lalu ia berangkat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he who received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.

block.text: Segera pergilah hamba yang menerima lima talenta itu. Ia menjalankan uang itu lalu beroleh laba lima talenta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way, he who got the two talents gained another two.

block.text: Hamba yang menerima dua talenta itupun berbuat demikian juga dan berlaba dua talenta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who received the one went away and dug a hole in the ground and hid his lord’s money.”

block.text: Tetapi hamba yang menerima satu talenta itu pergi dan menggali lobang di dalam tanah lalu menyembunyikan uang tuannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now after a long time the lord of those servants came, and reconciled accounts with them.

block.text: <<Lama sesudah itu pulanglah tuan hamba-hamba itu lalu mengadakan perhitungan dengan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who received the five talents came and brought another five talents, saying, ‘Lord, you delivered to me five talents. Behold, I have gained another five talents besides them.’”

block.text: Hamba yang menerima lima talenta itu datang dan ia membawa laba lima talenta, katanya: <Tuan, lima talenta tuan percayakan kepadaku; lihat, aku telah beroleh laba lima talenta.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’”

block.text: Maka kata tuannya itu kepadanya: <Baik sekali perbuatanmu itu, hai hambaku yang baik dan setia; engkau telah setia dalam perkara kecil, aku akan memberikan kepadamu tanggung jawab dalam perkara yang besar. Masuklah dan turutlah dalam kebahagiaan tuanmu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He also who got the two talents came and said, ‘Lord, you delivered to me two talents. Behold, I have gained another two talents besides them.’”

block.text: <<Lalu datanglah hamba yang menerima dua talenta itu, katanya: <Tuan, dua talenta tuan percayakan kepadaku; lihat, aku telah beroleh laba dua talenta.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’”

block.text: Maka kata tuannya itu kepadanya: <Baik sekali perbuatanmu itu, hai hambaku yang baik dan setia, engkau telah setia memikul tanggung jawab dalam perkara yang kecil, aku akan memberikan kepadamu tanggung jawab dalam perkara yang besar. Masuklah dan turutlah dalam kebahagiaan tuanmu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He also who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew you that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter.

block.text: <<Kini datanglah juga hamba yang menerima satu talenta itu dan berkata: <Tuan, aku tahu bahwa tuan adalah manusia yang kejam yang menuai di tempat di mana tuan tidak menabur dan yang memungut dari tempat di mana tuan tidak menanam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the ground. Behold, you have what is yours.’”

block.text: Karena itu aku takut dan pergi menyembunyikan talenta tuan itu di dalam tanah: Ini, terimalah kepunyaan tuan!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But his lord answered him, ‘You wicked and slothful servant. You knew that I reap where I didn’t sow, and gather where I didn’t scatter.

block.text: <<Maka jawab tuannya itu: <Hai kamu, hamba yang jahat dan malas, jadi kamu sudah tahu, bahwa aku menuai di tempat di mana aku tidak menabur dan memungut dari tempat di mana aku tidak menanam?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You ought therefore to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back my own with interest.

block.text: Karena itu sudahlah seharusnya uangku itu kauberikan kepada orang yang menjalankan uang, supaya sekembaliku aku menerimanya serta dengan bunganya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take away therefore the talent from him, and give it to him who has the ten talents.

block.text: Sebab itu ambillah talenta itu dari padanya dan berikanlah kepada orang yang mempunyai sepuluh talenta itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For to everyone who has will be given, and he will have abundance, but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away.

block.text: Karena setiap orang yang mempunyai, kepadanya akan diberi, sehingga ia berkelimpahan. Tetapi siapa yang tidak mempunyai, apapun juga yang ada padanya akan diambil dari padanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Throw out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’”

block.text: Dan campakkanlah hamba yang tidak berguna itu ke dalam kegelapan yang paling gelap. Di sanalah akan terdapat ratap dan kertak gigi.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.

block.text: <<Apabila Anak Manusia datang dalam kemuliaan-Nya dan semua malaikat bersama-sama dengan Dia, maka Ia akan bersemayam di atas takhta kemuliaan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Before him all the nations will be gathered, and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

block.text: Lalu semua bangsa akan dikumpulkan di hadapan-Nya dan Ia akan memisahkan mereka seorang dari pada seorang, sama seperti gembala memisahkan domba dari kambing,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

block.text: dan Ia akan menempatkan domba-domba di sebelah kanan-Nya dan kambing-kambing di sebelah kiri-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the King will tell those on his right hand, ‘Come, blessed of my Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

block.text: <<Dan Raja itu akan berkata kepada mereka yang di sebelah kanan-Nya: <Mari, hai kamu yang diberkati oleh Bapa-Ku, terimalah Kerajaan yang telah disediakan bagimu sejak dunia dijadikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I was hungry, and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me drink. I was a stranger, and you took me in.

block.text: Sebab ketika Aku lapar, kamu memberi Aku makan; ketika Aku haus, kamu memberi Aku minum; ketika Aku seorang asing, kamu memberi Aku tumpangan;

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was naked, and you clothed me. I was sick, and you visited me. I was in prison, and you came to me.’”

block.text: ketika Aku telanjang, kamu memberi Aku pakaian; ketika Aku sakit, kamu melawat Aku; ketika Aku di dalam penjara, kamu mengunjungi Aku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, and feed you; or thirsty, and give you a drink?

block.text: <<Maka orang-orang benar itu akan menjawab Dia, katanya: <Tuhan, bilamanakah kami melihat Engkau lapar dan kami memberi Engkau makan, atau haus dan kami memberi Engkau minum?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When did we see you as a stranger, and take you in; or naked, and clothe you?

block.text: Bilamanakah kami melihat Engkau sebagai orang asing, dan kami memberi Engkau tumpangan, atau telanjang dan kami memberi Engkau pakaian?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When did we see you sick, or in prison, and come to you?’”

block.text: Bilamanakah kami melihat Engkau sakit atau dalam penjara dan kami mengunjungi Engkau?

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The King will answer them, ‘Most certainly I tell you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’

block.text: Dan Raja itu akan menjawab mereka: Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya segala sesuatu yang kamu lakukan untuk salah seorang dari saudara-Ku yang paling hina ini, kamu telah melakukannya untuk Aku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he will say also to those on the left hand, ‘Depart from me, you cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels.

block.text: <<Dan Ia akan berkata juga kepada mereka yang di sebelah kiri-Nya: <Enyahlah dari hadapan-Ku, hai kamu orang-orang terkutuk, enyahlah ke dalam api yang kekal yang telah sedia untuk Iblis dan malaikat-malaikatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for I was hungry, and you didn’t give me food to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave me no drink.

block.text: Sebab ketika Aku lapar, kamu tidak memberi Aku makan; ketika Aku haus, kamu tidak memberi Aku minum;

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was a stranger, and you didn’t take me in; naked, and you didn’t clothe me; sick, and in prison, and you didn’t visit me.’”

block.text: ketika Aku seorang asing, kamu tidak memberi Aku tumpangan; ketika Aku telanjang, kamu tidak memberi Aku pakaian; ketika Aku sakit dan dalam penjara, kamu tidak melawat Aku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then they will also answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and didn’t help you?’”

block.text: <<Lalu merekapun akan menjawab Dia, katanya: <Tuhan, bilamanakah kami melihat Engkau lapar, atau haus, atau sebagai orang asing, atau telanjang atau sakit, atau dalam penjara dan kami tidak melayani Engkau?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then he will answer them, saying, ‘Most certainly I tell you, inasmuch as you didn’t do it to one of the least of these, you didn’t do it to me.’

block.text: Maka Ia akan menjawab mereka: <Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya segala sesuatu yang tidak kamu lakukan untuk salah seorang dari yang paling hina ini, kamu tidak melakukannya juga untuk Aku.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”

block.text: Dan mereka ini akan masuk ke tempat siksaan yang kekal, tetapi orang benar ke dalam hidup yang kekal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 26
It happened, when Jesus had finished all these words, that he said to his disciples,

block.text: Setelah Yesus selesai dengan segala pengajaran-Nya itu, berkatalah Ia kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified.”

block.text: <<Kamu tahu, bahwa dua hari lagi akan dirayakan Paskah, maka Anak Manusia akan diserahkan untuk disalibkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas.

block.text: Pada waktu itu berkumpullah imam-imam kepala dan tua-tua bangsa Yahudi di istana Imam Besar yang bernama Kayafas,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took counsel together that they might take Jesus by deceit, and kill him.
But they said,

block.text: dan mereka merundingkan suatu rencana untuk menangkap Yesus dengan tipu muslihat dan untuk membunuh Dia.
Tetapi mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not during the feast, lest a riot occur among the people.”

block.text: <<Jangan pada waktu perayaan, supaya jangan timbul keributan di antara rakyat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper.

block.text: Ketika Yesus berada di Betania, di rumah Simon si kusta,

ReferenceBlocks.text: A woman came to him having an alabaster jar of very expensive ointment, and she poured it on his head as he sat at the table.

block.text: datanglah seorang perempuan kepada-Nya membawa sebuah buli-buli pualam berisi minyak wangi yang mahal. Minyak itu dicurahkannya ke atas kepala Yesus, yang sedang duduk makan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when his disciples saw this, they were indignant, saying,

block.text: Melihat itu murid-murid gusar dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why this waste?
For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.”

block.text: <<Untuk apa pemborosan ini?
Sebab minyak itu dapat dijual dengan mahal dan uangnya dapat diberikan kepada orang-orang miskin.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, knowing this, Jesus said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mengetahui pikiran mereka lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you trouble the woman? Because she has done a good work for me.

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu menyusahkan perempuan ini? Sebab ia telah melakukan suatu perbuatan yang baik pada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you always have the poor with you; but you don’t always have me.

block.text: Karena orang-orang miskin selalu ada padamu, tetapi Aku tidak akan selalu bersama-sama kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in pouring this ointment on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.

block.text: Sebab dengan mencurahkan minyak itu ke tubuh-Ku, ia membuat suatu persiapan untuk penguburan-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be spoken of as a memorial of her.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya di mana saja Injil ini diberitakan di seluruh dunia, apa yang dilakukannya ini akan disebut juga untuk mengingat dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then one of the twelve, who was called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests,
and said,

block.text: Kemudian pergilah seorang dari kedua belas murid itu, yang bernama Yudas Iskariot, kepada imam-imam kepala.
Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you willing to give me, that I should deliver him to you?”

block.text: <<Apa yang hendak kamu berikan kepadaku, supaya aku menyerahkan Dia kepada kamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They weighed out for him thirty pieces of silver.

block.text: Mereka membayar tiga puluh uang perak kepadanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that time he sought opportunity to betray him.

block.text: Dan mulai saat itu ia mencari kesempatan yang baik untuk menyerahkan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now on the first day of unleavened bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying to him,

block.text: Pada hari pertama dari hari raya Roti Tidak Beragi datanglah murid-murid Yesus kepada-Nya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”

block.text: <<Di mana Engkau kehendaki kami mempersiapkan perjamuan Paskah bagi-Mu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go into the city to a certain person, and tell him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is at hand. I will keep the Passover at your house with my disciples.”’”

block.text: <<Pergilah ke kota kepada si Anu dan katakan kepadanya: <Pesan Guru: waktu-Ku hampir tiba; di dalam rumahmulah Aku mau merayakan Paskah bersama-sama dengan murid-murid-Ku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples did as Jesus commanded them, and they prepared the Passover.

block.text: Lalu murid-murid-Nya melakukan seperti yang ditugaskan Yesus kepada mereka dan mempersiapkan Paskah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when evening had come, he was reclining at the table with the twelve disciples.

block.text: Setelah hari malam, Yesus duduk makan bersama-sama dengan kedua belas murid itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were eating, he said,

block.text: Dan ketika mereka sedang makan, Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you that one of you will betray me.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya seorang di antara kamu akan menyerahkan Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were exceedingly sorrowful, and each began to ask him,

block.text: Dan dengan hati yang sangat sedih berkatalah mereka seorang demi seorang kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It isn’t me, is it, Lord?”

block.text: <<Bukan aku, ya Tuhan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Ia menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who dipped his hand with me in the dish, the same will betray me.

block.text: <<Dia yang bersama-sama dengan Aku mencelupkan tangannya ke dalam pinggan ini, dialah yang akan menyerahkan Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man goes, even as it is written of him, but woe to that man through whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”

block.text: Anak Manusia memang akan pergi sesuai dengan yang ada tertulis tentang Dia, akan tetapi celakalah orang yang olehnya Anak Manusia itu diserahkan. Adalah lebih baik bagi orang itu sekiranya ia tidak dilahirkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas, who betrayed him, answered,

block.text: Yudas, yang hendak menyerahkan Dia itu menjawab, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It isn’t me, is it, Rabbi?”

block.text: <<Bukan aku, ya Rabi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You said it.”

block.text: <<Engkau telah mengatakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, gave thanks for it, and broke it. He gave to the disciples, and said,

block.text: Dan ketika mereka sedang makan, Yesus mengambil roti, mengucap berkat, memecah-mecahkannya lalu memberikannya kepada murid-murid-Nya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take, eat; this is my body.”

block.text: <<Ambillah, makanlah, inilah tubuh-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the cup, gave thanks, and gave to them, saying,

block.text: Sesudah itu Ia mengambil cawan, mengucap syukur lalu memberikannya kepada mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All of you drink it,
for this is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many for the remission of sins.

block.text: <<Minumlah, kamu semua, dari cawan ini.
Sebab inilah darah-Ku, darah perjanjian, yang ditumpahkan bagi banyak orang untuk pengampunan dosa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on, until that day when I drink it anew with you in my Father’s Kingdom.”

block.text: Akan tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: mulai dari sekarang Aku tidak akan minum lagi hasil pokok anggur ini sampai pada hari Aku meminumnya, yaitu yang baru, bersama-sama dengan kamu dalam Kerajaan Bapa-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Then Jesus said to them,

block.text: Sesudah menyanyikan nyanyian pujian, pergilah Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya ke Bukit Zaitun.
Maka berkatalah Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’

block.text: <<Malam ini kamu semua akan tergoncang imanmu karena Aku. Sebab ada tertulis: <Aku akan membunuh gembala dan kawanan domba itu akan tercerai-berai.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”

block.text: Akan tetapi sesudah Aku bangkit, Aku akan mendahului kamu ke Galilea.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter answered him,

block.text: Petrus menjawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Even if all will be made to stumble because of you, I will never be made to stumble.”

block.text: <<Biarpun mereka semua tergoncang imannya karena Engkau, aku sekali-kali tidak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you that tonight, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya malam ini, sebelum ayam berkokok, engkau telah menyangkal Aku tiga kali.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said to him,

block.text: Kata Petrus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Even if I must die with you, I will not deny you.”

block.text: <<Sekalipun aku harus mati bersama-sama Engkau, aku takkan menyangkal Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And all of the other disciples said the same.

block.text: Semua murid yang lainpun berkata demikian juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to his disciples,

block.text: Maka sampailah Yesus bersama-sama murid-murid-Nya ke suatu tempat yang bernama Getsemani. Lalu Ia berkata kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit here, while I go there and pray.”

block.text: <<Duduklah di sini, sementara Aku pergi ke sana untuk berdoa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and severely troubled.
Then he said to them,

block.text: Dan Ia membawa Petrus dan kedua anak Zebedeus serta-Nya. Maka mulailah Ia merasa sedih dan gentar,
lalu kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch with me.”

block.text: <<Hati-Ku sangat sedih, seperti mau mati rasanya. Tinggallah di sini dan berjaga-jagalah dengan Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went forward a little, fell on his face, and prayed, saying,

block.text: Maka Ia maju sedikit, lalu sujud dan berdoa, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass away from me; nevertheless, not what I desire, but what you desire.”

block.text: <<Ya Bapa-Ku, jikalau sekiranya mungkin, biarlah cawan ini lalu dari pada-Ku, tetapi janganlah seperti yang Kukehendaki, melainkan seperti yang Engkau kehendaki.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to the disciples, and found them sleeping, and said to Peter,

block.text: Setelah itu Ia kembali kepada murid-murid-Nya itu dan mendapati mereka sedang tidur. Dan Ia berkata kepada Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What, couldn’t you watch with me for one hour?

block.text: <<Tidakkah kamu sanggup berjaga-jaga satu jam dengan Aku?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch and pray, that you don’t enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

block.text: Berjaga-jagalah dan berdoalah, supaya kamu jangan jatuh ke dalam pencobaan: roh memang penurut, tetapi daging lemah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, a second time he went away, and prayed, saying,

block.text: Lalu Ia pergi untuk kedua kalinya dan berdoa, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Father, if this cup can’t pass away from me unless I drink it, your desire be done.”

block.text: <<Ya Bapa-Ku jikalau cawan ini tidak mungkin lalu, kecuali apabila Aku meminumnya, jadilah kehendak-Mu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came again and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.

block.text: Dan ketika Ia kembali pula, Ia mendapati mereka sedang tidur, sebab mata mereka sudah berat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He left them again, went away, and prayed a third time, saying the same words.

block.text: Ia membiarkan mereka di situ lalu pergi dan berdoa untuk ketiga kalinya dan mengucapkan doa yang itu juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he came to his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: Sesudah itu Ia datang kepada murid-murid-Nya dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sleep on now, and take your rest. Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

block.text: <<Tidurlah sekarang dan istirahatlah. Lihat, saatnya sudah tiba, bahwa Anak Manusia diserahkan ke tangan orang-orang berdosa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Arise, let’s be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”

block.text: Bangunlah, marilah kita pergi. Dia yang menyerahkan Aku sudah dekat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priest and elders of the people.

block.text: Waktu Yesus masih berbicara datanglah Yudas, salah seorang dari kedua belas murid itu, dan bersama-sama dia serombongan besar orang yang membawa pedang dan pentung, disuruh oleh imam-imam kepala dan tua-tua bangsa Yahudi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he who betrayed him gave them a sign, saying,

block.text: Orang yang menyerahkan Dia telah memberitahukan tanda ini kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever I kiss, he is the one. Seize him.”

block.text: <<Orang yang akan kucium, itulah Dia, tangkaplah Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he came to Jesus, and said,

block.text: Dan segera ia maju mendapatkan Yesus dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hail, Rabbi!”

block.text: <<Salam Rabi,>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and kissed him.
Jesus said to him,

block.text: lalu mencium Dia.
Tetapi Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Friend, why are you here?”

block.text: <<Hai teman, untuk itukah engkau datang?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they came and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.

block.text: Maka majulah mereka memegang Yesus dan menangkap-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and
struck the servant of the high priest, and struck off his ear.
Then Jesus said to him,

block.text: Tetapi seorang dari mereka yang menyertai Yesus mengulurkan tangannya, menghunus pedangnya dan
menetakkannya kepada hamba Imam Besar sehingga putus telinganya.
Maka kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Put your sword back into its place, for all those who take the sword will die by the sword.

block.text: <<Masukkan pedang itu kembali ke dalam sarungnya, sebab barangsiapa menggunakan pedang, akan binasa oleh pedang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or do you think that I couldn’t ask my Father, and he would even now send me more than twelve legions of angels?

block.text: Atau kausangka, bahwa Aku tidak dapat berseru kepada Bapa-Ku, supaya Ia segera mengirim lebih dari dua belas pasukan malaikat membantu Aku?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that it must be so?”

block.text: Jika begitu, bagaimanakah akan digenapi yang tertulis dalam Kitab Suci, yang mengatakan, bahwa harus terjadi demikian?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes,

block.text: Pada saat itu Yesus berkata kepada orang banyak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you come out as against a robber with swords and clubs to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me.

block.text: <<Sangkamu Aku ini penyamun, maka kamu datang lengkap dengan pedang dan pentung untuk menangkap Aku? Padahal tiap-tiap hari Aku duduk mengajar di Bait Allah, dan kamu tidak menangkap Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But all this has happened, that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.”

block.text: Akan tetapi semua ini terjadi supaya genap yang ada tertulis dalam kitab nabi-nabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then all the disciples left him, and fled.

block.text: Lalu semua murid itu meninggalkan Dia dan melarikan diri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who had taken Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.

block.text: Sesudah mereka menangkap Yesus, mereka membawa-Nya menghadap Kayafas, Imam Besar. Di situ telah berkumpul ahli-ahli Taurat dan tua-tua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter followed him from a distance, to the court of the high priest, and entered in and sat with the officers, to see the end.

block.text: Dan Petrus mengikuti Dia dari jauh sampai ke halaman Imam Besar, dan setelah masuk ke dalam, ia duduk di antara pengawal-pengawal untuk melihat kesudahan perkara itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the chief priests, the elders, and the whole council sought false testimony against Jesus, that they might put him to death.

block.text: Imam-imam kepala, malah seluruh Mahkamah Agama mencari kesaksian palsu terhadap Yesus, supaya Ia dapat dihukum mati,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they did not find any, even though many false witnesses came forward. Finally, two false witnesses came forward,
and said,

block.text: tetapi mereka tidak memperolehnya, walaupun tampil banyak saksi dusta. Tetapi akhirnya tampillah dua orang,
yang mengatakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.’”

block.text: <<Orang ini berkata: <Aku dapat merubuhkan Bait Allah dan membangunnya kembali dalam tiga hari.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest stood up, and said to him,

block.text: Lalu Imam Besar itu berdiri dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you no answer? What is this that these testify against you?”

block.text: <<Tidakkah Engkau memberi jawab atas tuduhan-tuduhan saksi-saksi ini terhadap Engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus held his peace. The high priest answered him,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus tetap diam. Lalu kata Imam Besar itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I adjure you by the living God, that you tell us whether you are the Christ, the Son of God.”

block.text: <<Demi Allah yang hidup, katakanlah kepada kami, apakah Engkau Mesias, Anak Allah, atau tidak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have said it. Nevertheless, I tell you, after this you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of the sky.”

block.text: <<Engkau telah mengatakannya. Akan tetapi, Aku berkata kepadamu, mulai sekarang kamu akan melihat Anak Manusia duduk di sebelah kanan Yang Mahakuasa dan datang di atas awan-awan di langit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the high priest tore his clothing, saying,

block.text: Maka Imam Besar itu mengoyakkan pakaiannya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Behold, now you have heard his blasphemy.
What do you think?”

block.text: <<Ia menghujat Allah. Untuk apa kita perlu saksi lagi? Sekarang telah kamu dengar hujat-Nya.
Bagaimana pendapat kamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered,

block.text: Mereka menjawab dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is worthy of death!”

block.text: <<Ia harus dihukum mati!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they spit in his face and beat him with their fists, and some slapped him,
saying,

block.text: Lalu mereka meludahi muka-Nya dan meninju-Nya; orang-orang lain memukul Dia,
dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Prophesy to us, you Christ! Who hit you?”

block.text: <<Cobalah katakan kepada kami, hai Mesias, siapakah yang memukul Engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Peter was sitting outside in the court, and a servant girl came to him, saying,

block.text: Sementara itu Petrus duduk di luar di halaman. Maka datanglah seorang hamba perempuan kepadanya, katanya:

block.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard
ReferenceBlocks.text: “You were also with Jesus, the Galilean!”

block.text: <<Engkau juga selalu bersama-sama dengan Yesus, orang Galilea itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he denied it before them all, saying,

block.text: Tetapi ia menyangkalnya di depan semua orang, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I don’t know what you are talking about.”

block.text: <<Aku tidak tahu, apa yang engkau maksud.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had gone out onto the porch, someone else saw him, and said to those who were there,

block.text: Ketika ia pergi ke pintu gerbang, seorang hamba lain melihat dia dan berkata kepada orang-orang yang ada di situ:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man also was with Jesus of Nazareth.”

block.text: <<Orang ini bersama-sama dengan Yesus, orang Nazaret itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he denied it with an oath,

block.text: Dan ia menyangkalnya pula dengan bersumpah:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I don’t know the man.”

block.text: <<Aku tidak kenal orang itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After a little while those who stood by came and said to Peter,

block.text: Tidak lama kemudian orang-orang yang ada di situ datang kepada Petrus dan berkata:

block.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)/those standing near

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)/those standing near
ReferenceBlocks.characterIdOverrideForScript: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Surely you are also one of them, for your speech makes you known.”

block.text: <<Pasti engkau juga salah seorang dari mereka, itu nyata dari bahasamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he began to curse and to swear,

block.text: Maka mulailah Petrus mengutuk dan bersumpah:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I don’t know the man!”

block.text: <<Aku tidak kenal orang itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the rooster
crowed.
Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said to him,

block.text: Dan pada saat itu berkokoklah
ayam.
Maka teringatlah Petrus akan apa yang dikatakan Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”

block.text: <<Sebelum ayam berkokok, engkau telah menyangkal Aku tiga kali.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out and wept bitterly.

block.text: Lalu ia pergi ke luar dan menangis dengan sedihnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 27
Now when morning had come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death.

block.text: Ketika hari mulai siang, semua imam kepala dan tua-tua bangsa Yahudi berkumpul dan mengambil keputusan untuk membunuh Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They bound him, led him away, and delivered him up to Pontius Pilate, the governor.

block.text: Mereka membelenggu Dia, lalu membawa-Nya dan menyerahkan-Nya kepada Pilatus, wali negeri itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Judas, who betrayed him, when he saw that Jesus was condemned, felt remorse, and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
saying,

block.text: Pada waktu Yudas, yang menyerahkan Dia, melihat, bahwa Yesus telah dijatuhi hukuman mati, menyesallah ia. Lalu ia mengembalikan uang yang tiga puluh perak itu kepada imam-imam kepala dan tua-tua,
dan berkata:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have sinned in that I betrayed innocent blood.”

block.text: <<Aku telah berdosa karena menyerahkan darah orang yang tak bersalah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they said,

block.text: Tetapi jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is that to us? You see to it.”

block.text: <<Apa urusan kami dengan itu? Itu urusanmu sendiri!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He threw
down the pieces of silver in the sanctuary, and departed. He went away and hanged himself.

block.text: Maka iapun melemparkan
uang perak itu ke dalam Bait Suci, lalu pergi dari situ dan menggantung diri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests took the pieces of silver, and said,

block.text: Imam-imam kepala mengambil uang perak itu dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It’s not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood.”

block.text: <<Tidak diperbolehkan memasukkan uang ini ke dalam peti persembahan, sebab ini uang darah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said:

block.text: Mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We shall use the money to buy the land called the Potter’s Field so that strangers can be buried there.”

block.text: "Kita akan menggunakan uang untuk membeli tanah yang disebut Tanah Tukang Periuk sehingga orang asing bisa dimakamkan di sana."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore that field was called “The Field of Blood” to this day.

block.text: Itulah sebabnya tanah itu sampai pada hari ini disebut Tanah Darah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then, that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,

block.text: Dengan demikian genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi Yeremia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him upon whom a price had been set, whom some of the children of Israel priced,
and they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”

block.text: <<Mereka menerima tiga puluh uang perak, yaitu harga yang ditetapkan untuk seorang menurut penilaian yang berlaku di antara orang Israel,
dan mereka memberikan uang itu untuk tanah tukang periuk, seperti yang dipesankan Tuhan kepadaku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying,

block.text: Lalu Yesus dihadapkan kepada wali negeri. Dan wali negeri bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: <<Engkaukah raja orang Yahudi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes… it is as you say.”

block.text: <<Engkau sendiri mengatakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.
Then Pilate said to him,

block.text: Tetapi atas tuduhan yang diajukan imam-imam kepala dan tua-tua terhadap Dia, Ia tidak memberi jawab apapun.
Maka kata Pilatus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t you hear how many things they testify against you?”

block.text: <<Tidakkah Engkau dengar betapa banyaknya tuduhan saksi-saksi ini terhadap Engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gave him no answer, not even one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.

block.text: Tetapi Ia tidak menjawab suatu katapun, sehingga wali negeri itu sangat heran.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to releasing to the multitude one prisoner whom they desired.

block.text: Telah menjadi kebiasaan bagi wali negeri untuk membebaskan satu orang hukuman pada tiap-tiap hari raya itu atas pilihan orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They had a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.

block.text: Dan pada waktu itu ada dalam penjara seorang yang terkenal kejahatannya yang bernama Yesus Barabas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, when they were gathered together, Pilate said to them,

block.text: Karena mereka sudah berkumpul di sana, Pilatus berkata kepada mereka:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus, who is called Christ?”

block.text: <<Siapa yang kamu kehendaki kubebaskan bagimu, Yesus Barabas atau Yesus, yang disebut Kristus?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he knew that they had delivered him up because of envy.

block.text: Ia memang mengetahui, bahwa mereka telah menyerahkan Yesus karena dengki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying,

block.text: Ketika Pilatus sedang duduk di kursi pengadilan, isterinya mengirim pesan kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have nothing to do with that righteous man, for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.”

block.text: <<Jangan engkau mencampuri perkara orang benar itu, sebab karena Dia aku sangat menderita dalam mimpi tadi malam.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the chief priests and the elders persuaded the multitudes to ask for Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.

block.text: Tetapi oleh hasutan imam-imam kepala dan tua-tua, orang banyak bertekad untuk meminta supaya Barabas dibebaskan dan Yesus dihukum mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the governor answered them,

block.text: Wali negeri menjawab dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?”

block.text: <<Siapa di antara kedua orang itu yang kamu kehendaki kubebaskan bagimu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Kata mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Barabbas!”

block.text: <<Barabas.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to them,

block.text: Kata Pilatus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What then shall I do to Jesus, who is called Christ?”

block.text: <<Jika begitu, apakah yang harus kuperbuat dengan Yesus, yang disebut Kristus?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all said to him,

block.text: Mereka semua berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify him!”

block.text: <<Ia harus disalibkan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the governor said,

block.text: Katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why? What evil has he done?”

block.text: <<Tetapi kejahatan apakah yang telah dilakukan-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they cried out exceedingly, saying,

block.text: Namun mereka makin keras berteriak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify him!”

block.text: <<Ia harus disalibkan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when Pilate saw that nothing was being gained, but rather that a disturbance was starting, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying,

block.text: Ketika Pilatus melihat bahwa segala usaha akan sia-sia, malah sudah mulai timbul kekacauan, ia mengambil air dan membasuh tangannya di hadapan orang banyak dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am innocent of the blood of this righteous person. You see to it.”

block.text: <<Aku tidak bersalah terhadap darah orang ini; itu urusan kamu sendiri!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people answered,

block.text: Dan seluruh rakyat itu menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May his blood be on us, and on our children!”

block.text: <<Biarlah darah-Nya ditanggungkan atas kami dan atas anak-anak kami!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he released to them Barabbas, but Jesus he flogged and delivered to be crucified.

block.text: Lalu ia membebaskan Barabas bagi mereka, tetapi Yesus disesahnya lalu diserahkannya untuk disalibkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium, and gathered the whole garrison together against him.

block.text: Kemudian serdadu-serdadu wali negeri membawa Yesus ke gedung pengadilan, lalu memanggil seluruh pasukan berkumpul sekeliling Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They stripped him, and put a scarlet robe on him.

block.text: Mereka menanggalkan pakaian-Nya dan mengenakan jubah ungu kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They braided a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they kneeled down before him, and mocked him, saying,

block.text: Mereka menganyam sebuah mahkota duri dan menaruhnya di atas kepala-Nya, lalu memberikan Dia sebatang buluh di tangan kanan-Nya. Kemudian mereka berlutut di hadapan-Nya dan mengolok-olokkan Dia, katanya:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hail, King of the Jews!”

block.text: <<Salam, hai Raja orang Yahudi!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They spat on him, and took the reed and struck him on the head.

block.text: Mereka meludahi-Nya dan mengambil buluh itu dan memukulkannya ke kepala-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had mocked him, they took the robe off of him, and put his clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.

block.text: Sesudah mengolok-olokkan Dia mereka menanggalkan jubah itu dari pada-Nya dan mengenakan pula pakaian-Nya kepada-Nya. Kemudian mereka membawa Dia ke luar untuk disalibkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name, and they compelled him to go with them, that he might carry his cross.

block.text: Ketika mereka berjalan ke luar kota, mereka berjumpa dengan seorang dari Kirene yang bernama Simon. Orang itu mereka paksa untuk memikul salib Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to a place called “Golgotha,” that is to say, “The place of a skull.”

block.text: Maka sampailah mereka di suatu tempat yang bernama Golgota, artinya: Tempat Tengkorak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They gave him sour wine to drink mixed with gall. When he had tasted it, he would not drink.

block.text: Lalu mereka memberi Dia minum anggur bercampur empedu. Setelah Ia mengecapnya, Ia tidak mau meminumnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among them, casting lots, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet,

block.text: Ketika mereka menyalibkan Dia, mereka membagi pakaian di antara mereka, membuang undi, bahwa itu terjadi supaya genaplah firman yang disampaikan oleh nabi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They parted my clothes among them, and for my cloak they cast lots.”

block.text: "Mereka berpisah pakaian saya di antara mereka, dan untuk jubah saya mereka membuang undi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and they sat and watched him there.

block.text: Lalu mereka duduk di situ menjaga Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They set up over his head the accusation against him written, “THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

block.text: Dan di atas kepala-Nya terpasang tulisan yang menyebut alasan mengapa Ia dihukum: INILAH YESUS RAJA ORANG YAHUDI.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then there were two robbers crucified with him, one on his right hand and one on the left.

block.text: Bersama dengan Dia disalibkan dua orang penyamun, seorang di sebelah kanan dan seorang di sebelah kiri-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads,
and saying,

block.text: Orang-orang yang lewat di sana menghujat Dia dan sambil menggelengkan kepala,
mereka berkata:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”

block.text: <<Hai Engkau yang mau merubuhkan Bait Suci dan mau membangunnya kembali dalam tiga hari, selamatkanlah diri-Mu jikalau Engkau Anak Allah, turunlah dari salib itu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise the chief priests also mocking, with the scribes, the Pharisees, and the elders, said,

block.text: Demikian juga imam-imam kepala bersama-sama ahli-ahli Taurat dan tua-tua mengolok-olokkan Dia dan mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He saved others, but he can’t save himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in him.

block.text: <<Orang lain Ia selamatkan, tetapi diri-Nya sendiri tidak dapat Ia selamatkan! Ia Raja Israel? Baiklah Ia turun dari salib itu dan kami akan percaya kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He trusts in God. Let God deliver him now, if he wants him; for he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”

block.text: Ia menaruh harapan-Nya pada Allah: baiklah Allah menyelamatkan Dia, jikalau Allah berkenan kepada-Nya! Karena Ia telah berkata: <Aku adalah Anak Allah.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The robbers also who were crucified with him cast on him the same reproach.

block.text: Bahkan penyamun-penyamun yang disalibkan bersama-sama dengan Dia mencela-Nya demikian juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

block.text: Mulai dari jam dua belas kegelapan meliputi seluruh daerah itu sampai jam tiga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying,

block.text: Kira-kira jam tiga berserulah Yesus dengan suara nyaring:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?”

block.text: <<Eli, Eli, lama sabakhtani?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: That is,

block.text: Artinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

block.text: <<Allah-Ku, Allah-Ku, mengapa Engkau meninggalkan Aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of them who stood there, when they heard it, said,

block.text: Mendengar itu, beberapa orang yang berdiri di situ berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man is calling Elijah.”

block.text: <<Ia memanggil Elia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately one of them ran, and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him a drink.
The rest said,

block.text: Dan segeralah datang seorang dari mereka; ia mengambil bunga karang, mencelupkannya ke dalam anggur asam, lalu mencucukkannya pada sebatang buluh dan memberi Yesus minum.
Tetapi orang-orang lain berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to save him.”

block.text: <<Jangan, baiklah kita lihat, apakah Elia datang untuk menyelamatkan Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus cried again with a loud voice, and yielded up his spirit.

block.text: Yesus berseru pula dengan suara nyaring lalu menyerahkan nyawa-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, the veil of the temple was torn
in two from the top to the bottom. The earth quaked and the rocks were split.

block.text: Dan lihatlah, tabir Bait Suci terbelah
dua dari atas sampai ke bawah dan terjadilah gempa bumi, dan bukit-bukit batu terbelah,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The tombs were opened and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised.

block.text: dan kuburan-kuburan terbuka dan banyak orang kudus yang telah meninggal bangkit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming out of the tombs after his resurrection, they entered into the holy city and appeared to many.

block.text: Dan sesudah kebangkitan Yesus, merekapun keluar dari kubur, lalu masuk ke kota kudus dan menampakkan diri kepada banyak orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the centurion and those who were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things that were done, they were greatly afraid and said,

block.text: Kepala pasukan dan prajurit-prajuritnya yang menjaga Yesus menjadi sangat takut ketika mereka melihat gempa bumi dan apa yang telah terjadi, lalu berkata:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly this was the Son of God.”

block.text: <<Sungguh, Ia ini adalah Anak Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many women were there watching from afar, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, serving him.

block.text: Dan ada di situ banyak perempuan yang melihat dari jauh, yaitu perempuan-perempuan yang mengikuti Yesus dari Galilea untuk melayani Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

block.text: Di antara mereka terdapat Maria Magdalena, dan Maria ibu Yakobus dan Yusuf, dan ibu anak-anak Zebedeus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had come, a rich man from Arimathaea, named Joseph, who himself was also Jesus’ disciple came.

block.text: Menjelang malam datanglah seorang kaya, orang Arimatea, yang bernama Yusuf dan yang telah menjadi murid Yesus juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given up.

block.text: Ia pergi menghadap Pilatus dan meminta mayat Yesus. Pilatus memerintahkan untuk menyerahkannya kepadanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Joseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth.

block.text: Dan Yusufpun mengambil mayat itu, mengapaninya dengan kain lenan yang putih bersih,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut out in the rock. He rolled a great stone to the door of the tomb, and departed.

block.text: lalu membaringkannya di dalam kuburnya yang baru, yang digalinya di dalam bukit batu, dan sesudah menggulingkan sebuah batu besar ke pintu kubur itu, pergilah ia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.

block.text: Tetapi Maria Magdalena dan Maria yang lain tinggal di situ duduk di depan kubur itu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now on the next day, which was the day after the Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together to Pilate,
saying,

block.text: Keesokan harinya, yaitu sesudah hari persiapan, datanglah imam-imam kepala dan orang-orang Farisi bersama-sama menghadap Pilatus,
dan mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, we remember what that deceiver said while he was still alive: ‘After three days I will rise again.’

block.text: <<Tuan, kami ingat, bahwa si penyesat itu sewaktu hidup-Nya berkata: <Sesudah tiga hari Aku akan bangkit.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Command therefore that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest perhaps his disciples come at night and steal him away, and tell the people, ‘He is risen from the dead;’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”

block.text: Karena itu perintahkanlah untuk menjaga kubur itu sampai hari yang ketiga; jikalau tidak, murid-murid-Nya mungkin datang untuk mencuri Dia, lalu mengatakan kepada rakyat: Ia telah bangkit dari antara orang mati, sehingga penyesatan yang terakhir akan lebih buruk akibatnya dari pada yang pertama.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to them,

block.text: Kata Pilatus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have a guard. Go, make it as secure as you can.”

block.text: <<Ini penjaga-penjaga bagimu, pergi dan jagalah kubur itu sebaik-baiknya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they went with the guard and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone.

block.text: Maka pergilah mereka dan dengan bantuan penjaga-penjaga itu mereka memeterai kubur itu dan menjaganya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 28
Now after the Sabbath, as it began to dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.

block.text: Setelah hari Sabat lewat, menjelang menyingsingnya fajar pada hari pertama minggu itu, pergilah Maria Magdalena dan Maria yang lain, menengok kubur itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from the sky, and came and rolled away the stone from the door, and sat on it.

block.text: Maka terjadilah gempa bumi yang hebat sebab seorang malaikat Tuhan turun dari langit dan datang ke batu itu dan menggulingkannya lalu duduk di atasnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing white as snow.

block.text: Wajahnya bagaikan kilat dan pakaiannya putih bagaikan salju.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The guards were so afraid of him that they shook and became like dead men.

block.text: Dan penjaga-penjaga itu gentar ketakutan dan menjadi seperti orang-orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The angel answered the women,

block.text: Akan tetapi malaikat itu berkata kepada perempuan-perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus, who has been crucified.

block.text: <<Janganlah kamu takut; sebab aku tahu kamu mencari Yesus yang disalibkan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is not here, for he has risen, just like he said. Come, see the place where the Lord was lying.

block.text: Ia tidak ada di sini, sebab Ia telah bangkit, sama seperti yang telah dikatakan-Nya. Mari, lihatlah tempat Ia berbaring.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Go quickly and tell his disciples, ‘He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him.’ Behold, I have told you.”

block.text: Dan segeralah pergi dan katakanlah kepada murid-murid-Nya bahwa <Ia telah bangkit dari antara orang mati. Ia mendahului kamu ke Galilea; di sana kamu akan melihat Dia.> Sesungguhnya aku telah mengatakannya kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring his disciples word.

block.text: Mereka segera pergi dari kubur itu, dengan takut dan dengan sukacita yang besar dan berlari cepat-cepat untuk memberitahukannya kepada murid-murid Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying,

block.text: Tiba-tiba Yesus berjumpa dengan mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rejoice!”

block.text: <<Salam bagimu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came and took hold of his feet, and worshiped him.
Then Jesus said to them,

block.text: Mereka mendekati-Nya dan memeluk kaki-Nya serta menyembah-Nya.
Maka kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t be afraid. Go tell my brothers that they should go into Galilee, and there they will see me.”

block.text: <<Jangan takut. Pergi dan katakanlah kepada saudara-saudara-Ku, supaya mereka pergi ke Galilea, dan di sanalah mereka akan melihat Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guards came into the city, and told the chief priests all the things that had happened.

block.text: Ketika mereka di tengah jalan, datanglah beberapa orang dari penjaga itu ke kota dan memberitahukan segala yang terjadi itu kepada imam-imam kepala.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave a large amount of silver to the soldiers,
saying,

block.text: Dan sesudah berunding dengan tua-tua, mereka mengambil keputusan lalu memberikan sejumlah besar uang kepada serdadu-serdadu itu
dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Say that his disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.

block.text: <<Kamu harus mengatakan, <bahwa murid-murid-Nya datang malam-malam dan mencuri-Nya ketika kamu sedang tidur.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If this comes to the governor’s ears, we will persuade him and make you free of worry.”

block.text: Dan apabila hal ini kedengaran oleh wali negeri, kami akan berbicara dengan dia, sehingga kamu tidak beroleh kesulitan apa-apa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took the money and did as they were told. This saying was spread abroad among the Jews, and continues until this day.

block.text: Mereka menerima uang itu dan berbuat seperti yang dipesankan kepada mereka. Dan ceritera ini tersiar di antara orang Yahudi sampai sekarang ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had sent them.

block.text: Dan kesebelas murid itu berangkat ke Galilea, ke bukit yang telah ditunjukkan Yesus kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they saw him, they bowed down to him, but some doubted.

block.text: Ketika melihat Dia mereka menyembah-Nya, tetapi beberapa orang ragu-ragu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus came to them and said,

block.text: Yesus mendekati mereka dan berkata:"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.

block.text: <<Kepada-Ku telah diberikan segala kuasa di sorga dan di bumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Go, and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Karena itu pergilah, jadikanlah semua bangsa murid-Ku dan baptislah mereka dalam nama Bapa dan Anak dan Roh Kudus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Teach them to observe all things that I commanded you. Behold, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Amen.

block.text: dan ajarlah mereka melakukan segala sesuatu yang telah Kuperintahkan kepadamu. Dan ketahuilah, Aku menyertai kamu senantiasa sampai kepada akhir zaman.>>
